The room itself was fine, no temperature or noise issues but the mattress was a disaster. As an older person with back issues, it meant very poor sleep for the whole stay due to back pain. If you are sensitive to too-soft mattresses with poor support, I would stay away. Since it seems most of the clientele consists of the young and hip, perhaps this doesn't matter for most but I would approach this hotel cautiously if you are not in that demographic. A minor issue was that, while there was adequate closet space, there was no chest or other location for non-hanging clothes, meaning you have to live out of your suitcase. We did eat in the restaurant for dinner and enjoyed it but probably will not stay here again.

title: Beautiful place with horrible service and amenities
text:
The building is gorgeous and well appointed. And a few of the staff are capable of providing great customer service. But that is where it ends.

First off, our flight home was cancelled and we had to stay in NYC an extra day. 2 weeks out, I tried calling them to see if we could extend our stay by a day. I was told that there wasn't any availability, but that they'd have someone from the front desk call me in the next 24 hours to see if there was something they could do. I waited. No call back.

Called again, got the exact same message from them. And the exact same result. No call back.

I gave up and just booked the TWA Hotel for one night (which was so much fun...). Unlike this place.

Rather than write an essay, I'll just summarize:
- There is no place outside the room to just hang out that isn't a bar. You can't go anywhere near the great sculpture on the terrace or up to the roof top unless it is open for business. The only way I was able to take my teenage kids up to see the view was to sneak them up there and then get in trouble.
- We said we had 4 people staying (my wife, myself, and our 2 kids). Yet they were surprised when I asked why there wasn't bedding for the pull out couch.
- WiFi is HORRIBLE. Ended up getting constantly kicked off and when it worked it was slower than a 3G connection. Complained multiple times with standard "try again" with no changes what so ever.
- In room lighting is task lighting only. So, if you're trying to get ready to go out, good luck locating items in your bags or checking how you look in the mirror.
- HVAC in the room inconsistent. Constantly freezing or boiling no matter what we did.
- Flooring is incredibly slippery. Getting up at night to tend to something always led to me slipping and falling on my ass.

Not recommended.

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We had a wonderful stay here. The staff was lovely and accommodating. Evelyn at the front desk was  warm and friendly and very helpful. The room was super nice, especially the shower! We would definitely come back.

title: A gem in Soho!
text: ModernHaus is centrally located in Soho where shops and good restaurants are. Staff’s attitude are generally very warm and friendly. They are helpful and make you feel at home. Triple filtered water and Nespresso machine readily available in the room are some of the considerate things the hotel gives their guests. Houeskeeping staff descended from heaven and they are angels. Good restaurants for breakfast, brunch and lunches at least in our experience. The room we stayed in was not huge by any standard but it was very well-designed. It has everything one needs including the latest Type C UBS charging system. I would highly recommend this hotel for downtown Manhattan stay.

title: Best Experience in NYC!
text: I’ve travelled to NYC at least 20 times and I always stay somewhere different to experience the city. Modernhaus was the BEST one experience  we have had. Great location, food , rooms and service. I would definitely return. Many thanks to Evelyn and Christie I felt like they were long time friends at the front desk.

title: Kristy ROCKS!
text:
Traveled to NYC this past weekend for my first time not knowing much about the area or what to see! Kristy helped us with absolutely everything and she really went over and beyond. She made sure we were taken care of at all times during our stay! Thanks for everything Kristy we miss you!

 xx Gaby & Gavin

title: All windows and light
text:
This boutique hotel had a great location in Soho, steps from the Canal Street metro stop. My room had large windows on 2 sides and a glass wall to the bathroom, creating a spacious, airy feel.  The breakfast was excellent in a beautiful room, with high ceiling and a contemplative vibe even though it had many people in it. Well- appointed with slippers, robe, good selection of bath products.  Will definitely be back. 

I LOVED their idea of providing  filtered water for your room in glass bottles - thank  you for not using plastic bottles !!  All  hotels should do this to eliminate plastic !

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel
text: Hosted a work event at the ModernHaus Soho this past weekend and it's one of the best events we've held yet. Our clients were blown away! The staff is so accommodating and really genuinely friendly. Just kind people! We've not had the same experience in other Boutique NYC hotels. The rooms were beautiful and the location is prime! Highly recommend and cannot wait to come back. We worked with Maria to line everything up and she is a GEM!

title: European-style Hospitality
text: Our stay was for a long weekend couple's get-away, and we could not have been more pleased with our stay at the Modernhaus. We were greeted by name on each arrival and departure and asked of our plans and if any assistance was needed.  Even the housekeeping staff was pro-active in scheduling the daily room "refresh" at our convenience.  We chose the "breakfast included" option, and unlike most hotel offerings of a minimal credit which barely covers the price of a beverage, a full breakfast was actually included in the room rate.  This was our first stay in SoHo rather than mid-town, and we found the location an easy 4-8 block walk to shops, restaurants, Chinatown and Little Italy. Taxis are regularly available at the nearest corner of 6th Avenue ($10 to Greenwich Village & Chelsea, $20 to midtown, $30 to the "Uppers), and the Canal Street Metro (A-C-E Line) is only one block away.

title: Amazing Staff!
text: The hotel is a great and beautiful space but it's truly the staff that makes the hotel what it is. We stayed for three nights and received such great service the entire time. Special shoutout to Kenny who helped with our bags during checkin and checkout, ordered us a well priced car, and was just an overall warm and friendly person!

title: Staff Standout
text: We recently spent three nights at the ModernHaus Soho and had a wonderful time.  I wanted to point out that Kristy M at the reception desk was extremely helpful from helping us with a nicer room to offering suggestions on dinner and things to do.  Her positive attitude and helpful demeanor was a highlight every time we saw her.

title: A hidden gem, don’t miss it.
text: What an amazing hotel, a hidden gem. I stayed in a different hotel my first 2 weeks in NYC and wish I had found this one earlier. Better priced and more luxurious than many other similar options. Very quiet in a great area. The Veranda restaurant and the rooftop bar at awesome. The staff is both very welcoming and efficient at sorting out whatever few issues you might have. Shoutout to Eric and everyone else at the front desk. Highly highly recommended.

title: Night club on the roof prevails
text: Room was nice enough, clean, nice staff.  My issue - which I think is important - is the music from the night club on the roof  resonated in our room till like 2 AM  if you have no issue with this - then this is a fine hotel.  If you like sleep, probably better to find another place.  Had to sleep with noise cancelling headphones on - which is not real sleep  - very disappointed

title: Excellent Hotel & Staff
text: We were in town for TKAM in December 2021. 1st time at ModernHaus Soho.  Excellent property, location and staff. Staff were excellent, especially Kristy.  Great food on site as well as in the neighborhood and, well, it was NYC on a fair weather weekend.

title: Absolutely the best possible stay in New York
text: Guys. This place is amazing!! The views, the art, the hospitality, the accommodations. It was incredible!! I am an artist so this hotel drew me in at first by the unique artwork they had. But the staff was so kind and helpful, they made me feel like I was their top priority! The room itself was so comfortable. The shower was incredible! I loved how all of the products they have for toiletries are from Le Labo, one of my all time favorite brands. It smells so good! I could not recommend this place more. You have to try it out!

title: Service received, location and amenities
text:
The Hotel is perfectly located in the border of Soho and TriBeca, modern and with nice bar and great menus.

What really stand out was the staff, in special the front desk lady, Evelin. She went our of her way to make hour experience of staying there a memorable one.

Shoot out to the place and the staff.

We will be returning on every opportunity, keep it up!

title: Am coming
text: Am outside your hotel please come and pick me now and I will come back to you with absolutely anything else you need me to bring along for your birthday please feel a bit rushed off by the airport at the moment and I will probably come back at a reasonable time for

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE!
text: I came with my boyfriend to this hotel a few days ago. We had such an amazing experience. We were in the Skyline King Suite and we immediately fell in love as soon as we walked in. The bed was SUPER COMFORTABLE! The set up and layout of the bedroom was absolutely gorgeous. We loved everything about our hotel room. I want to give a MAJOR thanks to Evelin for being so kind and for answering all of our questions. She was a big help in our stay at the hotel. On our check out day we did room service for breakfast. Our breakfast was absolutely DELICIOUS! We got the egg sandwich and pancakes. Me and my boyfriend still talk about this hotel and the amazing experience we had. We will definitely come back.

title: Beautiful Hotel in the heart of SoHo
text: We stayed here for a family trip to NYC during the Christmas season. The hotel was immaculate, the staff were so helpful and supportive (especially of our daughter who has diabetes and coeliacs disease). The overall design is stunning, very modern with an eclectic collection  of contemporary art displayed throughout the hotel. The food was delicious both in the cafe and for room service. And the views from both our room and our daughters’ room were incredible! We also really like the location downtown. It is just a stones throw away from some lovely boutiques and restaurants. Overall the Modern Haus hotel was a very comfortable and enjoyable place to stay. We highly recommend it.

title: Great location, ok hotel and service
text: Pretty much an ok stay! Not spectacular, especially considering it cost $1.3K for two nights. The hotel wasn’t particularly festive, the room had a nice view and a ton of windows but was average otherwise. Front desk staff was helpful but certainly doesn’t go above and beyond. I emailed asking about extending my reservation and that was a pretty unhelpful dialogue. The location is fantastic though!  Very walkable.

title: Exceptional Customer Service!
text:
I have never reviewed a hotel, but felt the experience I had staying at ModernHaus to be exceptional and worth going out of my way.  The highlights from my stay were the friendly valet and front desk staff, the well designed room with super unique bathroom design that allowed natural sunlight to fully flow into the shower.  The room was super clean and the bed was comfy.  The hotel had 3 restaurants/cafe's which gave me a lot of dining options.

Additionally, there was a small issue that came up that was not even the hotels fault.  The manager went out of his way to over correct the issue and I left feeling taken care of.

Thanks for the great stay!
Dave H- Boston

title: Bright airy room with luxe comforts
text:
Excellent breakfast in an airy 2nd floor wirh high ceilings and windows.   Bed was very comfortable and loved rhe spacious shower and Le Labo amenities.  A very nice stay.  
Loved being 1 blk from the subway at Canal St.

title: Highly recommend
text: I don’t often review hotels, but we loved staying at ModernHaus. The staff were all amazing. It’s on a quiet side street near amazing restaurants, bakeries and shops. We traveled with two teens and this hotel felt super welcoming and chic. The coffee and food options are great as well. It was the perfect place to land after a busy/hectic day in the city. The rooms are clean and have amazing views. I can’t say enough about the staff! Book this place. You won’t be sorry!

title: Great Boutique Hotel and Staff
text: Kris and Kristy at the front desk were amazing and extremely helpful! The hotel was clean, nice sized room with an excellent view! The Veranda restaurant was delicious with several vegan choices. We would we definitely visit again.

title: Amazing place!
text: Exceptional experience, quality service, and excellent location! WILL definitely go back!! Staff were so attentive, nice and efficient. Our room was amazing! Great views, heated bathroom floors and Le Labo products!

title: A magical night
text:
Just wanna take the time to say what an amazing team the modern haus has. As of November 13 i became a Fiancé to a wonderful man, just want to say thank you to all of housekeeping and management team for giving such an amazing experience. The room was so beautiful with balloons flowers and the view was to die for, the restaurant called veranda is a top notch place to dine in and enjoy. 
The name I’m going to say are A+ for making our dream happen that day…..

The team names ( kris, Krystle, celia, Leslie, Angelique, Davion, jamarious, and much love and thank yo the team at verandas for also making my dream come true. 

Thank you so much to you all and god bless

title: Brooklyners Visit Soho Hotel
text:
We are New Yorkers but we stayed here for two nights in a suite in connection with our wedding.  

The location is great and the rooms had a positive aesthetic.  I thought that for the price it felt a bit run down, even though it was just recently renovated.  For example, there were watermarks on the ceiling of the sitting room and a missing tile in the bathroom.  The front desk consistently seemed understaffed and there was often a long queue to check in or out.  But, they were often very accommodating of our requests and the staff was very helpful once you actually spoke with someone.

title: A Great "New" (to me) Hotel Option in Soho
text: I am really glad to have discovered the ModernHaus Soho. It is a truly unique property with friendly staff, spacious and comfortable rooms, and interesting dining options. Love the look and the location. I will definitely go back.

title: Great value with FABULOUS SERVICE
text:
The service was PERFECTION.  This was my first hotel stay in 2yrs, so I don't have anything to compare it to post pandemic - maybe everyone everywhere is on their game now, but I kind of doubt it.  Every single person I encountered was exceptionally friendly and efficient - making things happen quickly with a smile.  I had some trouble with noise in my room (partiers upstairs).  They offered to switch me in the middle of the night.  I declined, so they offered earplugs and switched me (with an upgrade) the next day.   
So many above and beyond examples of great service.
The rooms are not tiny, as they are so many other places, and they're very well equipped (well placed outlets galore) and laid out.  Decor is minimalist.  I think some floor coverings would go a long way - vibe, noise control and safety (those floors are crazy slippery in sock feet).   
For the price, which is VERY reasonable for a 4 star hotel in Soho, this place is da bomb.  I will be back.

title: Outstanding, unforgettable experience
text: ModernHaus was an absolute salvation after being displaced by the flooding recently. The view in this corner room was simply breathtaking, and the room itself was clean and spacious and well-furnished. Jumpin Jacks, Veranda, and JIMMY - all within the building - were fantastic spaces for social or dining needs through the day or night. The primary perk of our stay however was the incredible staff - Krystle, Kris, Shefi, Jonathan and Maurice on the front desk, and Eric, Kenny, Francis and Jamarius on the door. They were consistently friendly, helpful and thoughtful, and truly went above and beyond to make the stay unforgettable, and to make us smile.

title: Birthday Vacation
text: Pretty from the outside. Room had dust all over the floor. Nespresso machine had left over water along with the used pod  from previous guests.  Toilet seat was stained yellow throughout and chipped. Closet door wouldn’t shut unless you slammed it shut. The light wouldn’t turn off and would shine through the crack. The mattress was sunken in from so much use. Hotel manager felt bad and agreed with the poor condition of the room. We weren’t offered any other options because they had no rooms available. Even if they had we were too grossed out to stay. We checked out after one hour of being there. Only good thing was the corner room NYC  skyline view. We did our research and thought this place would be a perfect weekend getaway. Never again!

title: Great stay!
text: We had a wonderful stay at Modernhaus. The room was very clean and pretty spacious by NYC standards. And we loved the big windows to bring in a lot of light to the room (often a rarity with NYC hotel rooms as well). We had a great experience parking at the 311 West Broadway lot (you can book a space in advance online). All around a great and seamless experience.

title: Excellent location and service
text: Had a great stay at ModernHaus. Had an issue with my trip and had to extend my stay, and Maurice at the front desk was super helpful in assisting me. Great location, super walkable to excellent restaurants, and rooms are clean and nice.

title: Top 5 rooftop bars in the city ; super friendly staff from top to bottom
text:
Literally everyone we came in contact who worked here was awesome. I had what could have been a major setback in our trip during the check in process but the manager was kind enough to help us out and get accommodated. The receptionist was very nice, Eric at the front was cool af. The staff on the rooftop bar JIMMY (which is probably top 5 in the city) was fun. Shout out to Brian! Good music ; good vibes. Wish we could have stayed longer. 

Would absolutely stay here again, and not just for the killer views. 

Thank you!

title: Great hotel!
text: My husband and I stayed at ModernHaus for the first time, and we were so happy that we found this gem! Great location in Soho, and the room was clean, modern, and  a good size (we stayed in the standard king). The bathroom was also very nice, with a sizable shower (with great shampoo and soap products) and ample counter space, which is always an issue in hotel bathrooms! We were very pleased with this hotel and will be staying here again in the future!

title: This hotel was awesome
text: great experience at modernhaus soho! rooms are amazing amenties are awesome! Kris and maurice should get a raise made us feel like home. my girlfriend and i visited the city and i would love to come back. because MAURICE AND KRIS MADE US FEEL LIKE HOME. and extended our stay. thank you Maurice and kris. you guys rock

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
text: Yu-On welcomed us with open arms when we came for the Day he was genuine, accommodating and extremely friendly. The hotel was clean, pool was perfect and my sister and I had a wonderful afternoon. We will be back!

title:
Cecile SiuPing Lee and WaiMing Ho
From San Francisco
text:
My Daughter Cynthia Lee is the Vice President of an esteemed Company. She travelled around the World for business as well as for pleasure. She has been the travel planner for us her dear Parents. This time for New York she chose ModernHaus SoHo for us. 

We have stayed at quite a few best hotels around the World including The Pennisula in Tokyo Japan. We were more impressed by ModernHaus SoHo. We stayed on the 10th floor with the most spectacular view. The room was spacious cozy and the interior design was tasteful. We swam almost daily on the top floor swimming pool which is beautiful sleek and clean, overlooking all the skyscrapers around, exactly feeling ‘ on top of the World ‘.  The food and drinks from Jimmy and Jumping Jack are beyond expectations.

Besides the great ambiance and amenities, what makes this hotel unique are the PEOPLE!  As soon as the taxi pulled in Jimmy opened the door gave us the biggest welcome ( also when leaving lively Kenny took care of our transportation to the airport nicely ).
Front desk Yuon Chiu helped us an early check in and arranged us an upgrade the next day. Even though we speak English Mr. Chiu ‘s Cantonese helped us feel at home- his Parent and us originally came from Hong Kong.
Other front desk personnel worth mentioning were Tibia, Kris and Yami. 
The staff  Maddy, Nery and Obei at Jumping Jack were most attentive daily.
Respectively the staff DK and Antonio at Jimmy the Bar were fun yet made us feel at home with the constant young crowd there.

In private my husband and I discussed wondering why everyone working in the hotel are happy, appreciative and truly enjoying their job? Who can hire and train such a wonderful team? 
Towards the end of of our stay I was lucky to meet the Manager Krystle. She is beautiful elegant intelligent humble personable…….She took her time to listen to how I feel about this hotel to the smallest detail. She is eager to do any improvement to the hotel.  She is the leader of this wonderful team of service. She is the reason to bring every single guest coming back. I told her ModernHaus SoHo is the best of bestest hotels we have ever stayed in.
Our favorite hotel in our favorite City New York! 
We would recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Please acknowledge this review. And give the recognition this hotel deserves. Thank you.

Cecile

title: Amazing Customer Service! Even Right After Ida!
text: My husband and I were absolutely floored by how well we were treated by management and staff as soon as we walked in the door, even though it was early morning after Ida hit, and they were still cleaning up the aftermath. We were at least 6 hours early, and they of course had other things on their minds, but you wouldn't know it: All Smiles from everyone. And they got us into a room within about an hour. AND they switched us to another room within 30 minutes of us deciding that we'd rather not stay across from the elevator in a hotel with a pretty hot rooftop bar (even though there is a different elevator for that). Jamarius ("sp?"), Crystal, Eric and just about everyone else was amazing. Bravo, ModernHaus.

title: Fantastic renovation and excellent service
text: If you’re thinking of staying in lower Manhattan or SoHo, I highly recommend Modernhaus SoHo.  The renovation has great attention to detail, numerous food/drink options, an area in the 2nd floor to work quietly and an amazing rooftop!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Perfect spot in Soho. It’s in the center of everything. The hotel itself was super nice and clean. The two woman at the front desk (Leidy & Yami) we’re so sweet, accommodating and helpful. Definitely would come back & stay here!

title: The most amazing staycation I could have hoped for!
text: I couldn't have asked for a better staycation at ModernHaus SoHo! It's super chic and has floors with no carpet! The front desk are super welcoming and they loved my little dog. We checked in early and managed to get some time at the pool before the room was ready. DK, the lifeguard, was very attentive and lovely! I had drinks at the bar with friends-- the most incredible cocktails, and opted for room service in my robe and king size bed! Since I was there the height of summer, I got to the pool really early the next day and stayed the entire day. Perfect little NYC getaway. If I could give this establishment more stars, I would!

title: Love the location, hate the service
text: I am currently staying here and it is typically one of my favorite hotels when I am visiting from LA. However, this time I have noticed how terrible the rooftop is for hotel guests. We went up there for both night and day and both times could hardly get someone to notice us and when they finally did they were extremely rude. Leaving the pool today where we had to sit on the ground, not one person asked us if we needed anything the only time we saw someone was when they told us we needed to leave so they could open to the public. They care so much more about making money from patrons of the roof than the guests. Really wish they cared about the guests experience more.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed for an extended weekend! loved the convient soho location, just a minute walk to the subway and citi bike hub, and everything else really.  rooms were updated and comfortable- a little on the small side (NY standard) but didnt seem tight given high cieling and smart arrangement.  Nespresso in room, peloton in gym, and nice amenities. Updated and clean.  Some street noise even on the 10th floor. Wish the pool area didnt turn into a night hang to the public as i would have enjoyed it in later hours. most of the tables were reserved after 4 so the hours were pretty limited.  overall i found the staff very kind and helpful and plan to return again.

title: Please Give Yuan a raise!
text: My first ever review but had to do so because totally blown away by the amazing staff at ModernHaus Soho. I had called and put in a special request and the wonderful gentleman Yuan totally made sure everything was taken care of. He was super attentive to all details and made sure all our requests were well heard and accommodated. Would totally come back given the amazing views and the super hospitable staff!

title: One Of The Best!
text: Me and my wife checked in for our stay (just a one-night getaway) and have to say the hotel was just beautiful. Rooms are just a little small but the great service that was provided by Maurice definitely made up for it. We will be back for sure!

title: Probably one of the best NYC hotels to stay at that aren't insanely expensive
text: The rooms were very clean, very comfortable, quite spacious for NYC standard, and the staff was amazing, especially Yu.On. They went over and beyond to help make my stay enjoyable. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Manhattan. The amenities at the hotel are also amazing. They have the best rooftop bars I've been too in NYC (I've been to quite a few). There is also a pool that you can swim in on the rooftop. It has amazing views and you have complete access to it as a guest, unlike other hotels where you'd need a reservation that aren't always available during your stay. This has been my favorite hotel to stay at.

title: Amazing Staycation at Modernhaus
text: Brought my husband to Modernhaus for a 2 night escape/staycation to celebrate his birthday. What an awesome experience. We arrived past midnight and, even though it was late, Maurice at the front desk was warm and welcoming. We stayed in a Deluxe King which, by city standards, was spacious, the corner windows were bright and open. The rain shower had amazing pressure we and we loved all the La Labo products. We had breakfast at Jumping Jacks which was great and the service was genuinely friendly (even behind the masks). We spent the day up at Jimmy poolside, lounging and swimming. The staff (both the lifeguard and bartender) up there were also genuinely friendly and gracious. The view is incredible, the pool was perfectly crisp and not crowded at all. Modernhaus felt comfortable and luxurious all at the same time. We will certainly return.  Thank you!

title: Roei
text:
I had great time visiting the Modernhause hotel in soho. Nice and clean room, good restaurant and great bar at the rooftop.  crew was amazing took care of all my needs even more than expected. YU ON on the reception together with LEIDY were spectacularly helpful and for sure I’ll come back and will really recommend the hotel for friends. 
Thanks guys for wonderful vacation 😍

title: My new favorite hotel
text:
Best hotel in New York!  Was greeted upon arrival by the hotel GM.  Staff was beyond friendly and I loved the humus amenity with handwritten note from the staff during turndown.  

Veranda was amazing and Jimmy was a blast with the best rooftop view of the city.

I love the simplistic style of the rooms with floor to ceiling windows everywhere.

I’ll be back!

title: The staff and hotel is great
text: When we arrived  Saturday at midday and  we were able to  check in early. At the desk we had pleasure to deal with Yuan and Yumi. Yuan answer all our questions and request. I didn't like the view in my room we called the front desk and hang up, but Yuan was kind enough to called us back to see if we had an issue?. he was happy to check for a better view. He was young but really care to make sure we were happy in our stay.  We also had breakfast at viranda and our waiter was also very. good and. accommodated . At the pool we had Max he try his best to help. I will suggest for the pool area maybe smaller beds so more people could use it at one time. At. our check out we also had Yumi she was super nice. I will be back to this hotel. every staff person was very cool, positive and totally get that hospitality is what people need. We will be back!!!!

title: Best place to stay in SoHo
text: ModernHaus is our favorite place to stay in SoHo. The location couldn't be more convenient for shopping, dining, and getting around the city. The team is super friendly and helpful—especially Yami at the front desk. Jimmy's rooftop overlooks the most stunning views of downtown, and Jumpin Jack's is such a nice place to grab breakfast and catch up on work. Veranda is gorgeous for lunch or dinner as well. The new rooms are so comfortable and beautifully done, and the views are everything you could hope for when staying downtown. The best experience overall, can't wait for our next visit. Thank you ModernHaus! Rob and Dana G.

title: At the Intersection of Impeccable Style and Outstanding Hospitality
text:
As a former NYC resident and for the last few decades a frequent visitor, I've always gravitated to either midtown or the Upper West Side.  For some reason, on my most recent trip  I decided to stay in a different part of the city and I'm so glad I did.  Not only for the great vibe of Soho and the surrounding neighborhoods (Little Italy, Chinatown, the West Village, etc.) but for the experience of staying at Modernhaus.  
Now, "experience" is a slightly overused word in the hotel and the restaurant industry but in the case of Modernhaus that word is not hyperbole.  You're getting more than a hotel room to return to after a long day of exploring the city.  With its beautifully designed  public spaces and fabulous art collection throughout the building, you're inspired from the moment you entire the hotel by the obvious passion and creativity of the folks who designed this unique property.
The staff carry out the mission of the hotel's developers by providing the type of genuine warmth and hospitality not often found in NYC.  Mike at the front desk was incredibly welcoming and helpful during my stay.  The doormen were great guys, always helpful with directions and a quick chat whether I was coming or going.  The staff at Jumping Jacks and JIMMY were very professional and attentive.  My only regret is that I never had an opportunity to dine or have a cocktail at Veranda.  I did walk around the restaurant one morning before they opened and it was an absolutely beautiful space.  The Kaws sculpture featured in Veranda is incredibly unique and a real "I don't think we're in Kansas, anymore" moment when you first spot it. 
I don't want to gloss over the restaurant and bar outlets without mentioning the chef.  Unfortunately, I didn't catch his name but based on the meals I enjoyed during my stay, he is clearly very talented.  I had his version of a Portuguese custard tart (I forget the exact menu name)  one morning at breakfast which was simply outstanding.    
I'm sure many other reviews will mention the rooftop lounge and pool area.  Needless to say the views are remarkable.  On the evening we were up there, a storm had just passed through and we got to watch the residual lighting show to the west over North Jersey.  It was spectacular!
Looking forward to my next trip to NYC and will definitely be staying at Modernhaus again.

title: Great hotel, hospitable staff, iffy amenities
text: I would definitely stay at ModernHaus again. I love the swanky, sexy art-deco style balanced with a clean, modern look. The rooms were clean and had nice extras such as a Nespresso machine, thrice filtered water in glass bottles, robes, slippers, and a full-size mirror in the closet door. Everyone at the hotel is so kind, and I truly felt like a valued guest. We were given a complementary upgrade to a better view and 2 free drink credits at any bar except the rooftop club. The drinks at the Veranda were awesome, and the vibe there was perfect for couples. I was a bit disappointed by the pool. First of all, the pool deck was tiny. There were a dozen chairs (or less), and everything was very close together. Second, the hours aren't great. The pool closes at 2PM on weekends and 4PM on weekdays. For a 3PM check-in, that guarantees you won't be able to enjoy the pool on your first night. On top of that, the bar opens at 1:30. I think that enjoying a drink with lunch is perfectly reasonable, especially while sunbathing on an NYC rooftop. It was hot! The only frozen drink that they had was a frosé, but I think that they should extend that to daiquiris, frozen margaritas, or piña coladas for summer pool drinks. It gets very, very hot up there and if they're charging a resort fee, they should have resort drinks. Breakfast was pretty good. I got the avocado toast, which was great, but my boyfriend didn't love his eggs. There's a really nice backgammon table in the breakfast lounge and club chairs for people looking to do work. This is definitely not a hotel for families, but I loved my experience on a romantic vacation. It would also be a great choice for business travelers looking for some fun at the bars and club within the hotel. The ACE 123 lines are a couple of minutes from the hotel, and the 456 NWR DF trains are about a 10 minute walk. Surprisingly, we heard very little street noise from our room despite it being a more vibrant area.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
After researching hotels in NYC with outdoor pools for a one night "staycation" we landed on Modernhaus and glad we did!   So many hotels I researched had horror stories of terrible service, cleanliness issues and more that seem way too prevalent right now in this post COVID world.  What we found at Modernhaus was just the opposite.  Every staff member (almost!...see below) that we interacted with was friendly, accommodating and just a pleasure to deal with.  After an early check-in, we headed to our room which, on the 16th floor had great city and river views.  The room was small, but modern and nicely furnished.  The bathroom and shower setup were great and the bed comfortable.   

We changed into bathing suits and headed up to the rooftop pool.   The rooftop and pool are tiny but just perfect.  With only about 15 people up there, they were "at capacity" but, Max, the lifeguard/attendant was fantastic and got us some stools and said he'd move us once some chairs freed up.   All the other guests were so nice and everyone was chatting and having a good time.  It was not a stuffy vibe at all.   After a few minutes, we secured some chairs and ordered a bottle of wine and some lunch.  Getting the food and drink was a bit slow but the food was delicious.  

The pool was cold which was amazing for this 100 degree day and we spent the next few hours lounging, reading, sipping wine and taking the occasional dip in the pool to cool off.   The pool closes at 4 to then reopen to the public as a lounge at night.  

Dinner at Veranda was fantastic and again the service was exemplary.  There's a ton of restaurants in the neighborhood, but if you're staying in the hotel, I highly recommend a meal there.  Drinks, appetizers and main courses were all above expectations.   It's a diverse menu with Portugese flair.  It was raining and lightning throughout our entire meal and the all glass ceiling made for an interesting sideshow while we ate. 

The next morning we went up to the roof around 8am to ensure that we got a lounge chair, but it never really got filled up. We had requested a late checkout so we can lounge for a few hours.  Unlike the day before, the lifeguard/attendant was less than stellar barely acknowledging guests, not being particularly helpful and not hustling at all like Max was the day before. 

All in all, it was an excellent stay in a great neighborhood with friendly, impeccable service.

title: Amazing, comfortable stay
text: Had such a great stay at ModernHaus. The rooms are spacious and the bed was so comfortable and top notch. The hotel has art pieces scattered all throughout which was really cool. You can stay here for an entire weekend without leaving the hotel property and still feel like you got the true NYC experience. From coffee and breakfast on the second floor, to dinner at Veranda and  night cap at Jimmy. Overall great experience.

title: All round excellent
text:
Not only is the hotel beautiful but the staff and service was outstanding. The location is marvelous and the hotel has a beautiful art collection throughout the property with ORIGINAL Calder pieces. When I checked in, I still needed to get some worked done and did so at the Jumpin Jacks lounge located on the 2nd floor (I didn't know this place existed SoHo), its beautifully designed and the offer coffee, cocktails and bites.  The room I had was…well roomy and tastefully done up! My room boosted beautiful city views of FiDi. Breakfast was amazing, I ordered room service and the food was beautifully presented, well cooked and well presented with friendly and efficient staff. 

Will definitely return!

title: Great pride weekend stay
text: This hotel is amazing and everyone is very friendly and accommodating. I stayed for pride weekend with friends who could not stop talking about our dinner in Veranda, drinks at the bar Jimmy, and our rooms. Decor is simple but luxurious. Thanks for the experience.  I highly recommend ModernHaus SoHo!

title: Had a really fun couples' stay
text:
Stayed here one night with my partner and we really loved its whole vibe and art collection. We had never opted for a hotel in the Soho neighborhood before and enjoyed being so close to the different retail stores, restaurants, and public transit. The concierge, believe his name was Yu-On, was super nice and texted a couple of times throughout our stay to make sure we had everything we needed – a nice touch that I don't see done often.

Had a romantic dinner at their restaurant Veranda and then enjoyed watching the sunset on the upper outdoor terraces (there's quite a few open air spots to relax throughout the property). Next morning the second floor coffee bar had a much-needed espresso pick me up. Overall a great experience and somewhere I'd book again!

title: Poor Service Spoiled Our Stay
text:
My husband and I are familiar with the previous iteration of this hotel (The James Soho) and we were really looking forward to celebrating our anniversary at the newly renovated ModernHaus. Unfortunately, inept staff put a big damper on our stay.

First, the positives: having just opened in April 2021, the renovations are apparent. The Bauhaus aesthetic is a welcome departure from the previous worn and overly minimalist look. Throughout the hotel, from the rooms to the restaurants, there's fun art paired with clean lines and warm interior decor. We quite enjoyed our Skyline King Studio with views of Manhattan and we'll always have a soft spot for the Jimmy rooftop, where we took engagement photos years ago.

On to the service: three months after opening, it's hard to believe there are still so many hiccups. When I asked a staff member to clarify the names of the hotel bars, he had no clue. When I asked another staff member whether I could have a drink at The Back Bar, I was told you need reservations; he assured me that he made a reservation on my behalf but when I tried to be seated, I was informed that there was a private party. It took three calls to get through to room service, and yet another follow-up call for our order (a hummus plate and bottle of champagne) to get to our room -- nearly an hour later. Breakfast service at the Jumpin Jacks restaurant was similarly slow. And the bartender at the rooftop was atrocious.

All in all, an incredibly disappointing stay, with service far below what we were expecting.

title: Dinner at Veranda
text:
Modernhaus is in a great location inSoHo. We went with another couple to check out the Jimmy for great drinks along with spectacular views. Then we went to Veranda where we ate under the sky, complemented by a glass roof and comfortable banquets. I highly recommend this newly renovated gem for
delicious  food, paired with attentive service and a cool vibe.

title: First time at Modernhaus
text:
I got a great recommendation about this hotel but then I met Leidy Garcia from the front desk and she made my visit there such an amazing. She took care and helped me in above and beyond my expectation. She is super kind and lovely, she really cares and assisted with anything I asked even she wasn’t there she covered everything I needed. I will definitely come back and recommend to my friends visit and stay there not only because it is a great hotel but also because of her. 

Thanks Leidy, appreciated your kindness. 
Naama

title: Will definitely be back!!!!
text: This hotel checked all the boxes!! Beautiful room with amazing view( two walls of windows!) The rooftop bar Jimmy offered a fun vibe, great drinks and the views are incredible.  Dinner at Veranda delicious.  Jumpin Jacks was lovely for breakfast. Excellent service all around. We didn't have much time to spend in NY but wanted the best for the time we had. This place did not disappoint.  Staff went above and beyond.

title: Saturday Stay
text: overall we had a very good experience at this newly renovated hotel. we have previously stayed at this location when it was James and the updates are noticeably good. great rooftop bar and food at the restaurant is amazing.

title: Wedding Celebration
text: On May 1st, my husband and I hosted our wedding at the ModernHaus SoHo. Given the current circumstances we knew our wedding would be private and intimate however, we did not want to compromise our guest experience. The team at ModernHaus SoHo was exceptional, especially Laura. They truly fostered an environment that allowed our guest to feel "normal" during unprecedent times. We utilized various parts of the hotel for ceremony, cocktail hour and dinner reception - we would not have changed a thing. Each section was thoughtful, clean, modern, and customer service was beyond our expectations. Whether you are staying as a guest or looking to host events, we would recommend ModernHaus SoHo time and time again. FYI - I loved the food at the Veranda restaurant so much, I am planning a dinner with my colleagues there. Thank you ModernHaus team for making our day memorable and special!

title: Impeccable Boutique Hotel in SoHo
text:
We stayed at the ModernHaus as a staycation in NYC to celebrate my birthday. 

We loved everything about our stay at the hotel, and the staff went above and beyond to make sure it was a special experience for my birthday. 

We stayed in one of the suites (1508), which is decorated nicely with modern touches, and has an incredible 180 view of the city. We booked through an introductory offer and awaiting us in the room was a delicious charcuterie plate, a bottle of champagne, and honestly some of the best chocolate truffles I’ve ever had (apparently they are made in house). 

The location of the hotel is also great. It’s on a slightly quieter street, and walking north takes you straight into the Village and east into the heart of SoHo.

We also made reservations at Veranda one night. The food is certainly a standout and we’d recommend dining there. The bread, asparagus, ceviche, and grilled branzino were all top notch. Probably the best branzino we’ve ever had, and don’t miss out on the bread and butter as a side.

Lastly, the Jimmy has a great view too. So make sure to head up to the rooftop for a drink.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: My weekend stay was amazing! Everyone from the front desk, to the bell hop, to the Jumpin Jacks team were so wonderful!!  The new outfit is beautiful and it was so perfectly located near all the great shopping and restaurants. I will definitely be back!!

title: How the mighty have fallen, not bad, but previously much better!
text: The staff and location of The James is fantastic! But the room quality has seemed to decline. Our dead bolt was almost busted off the door, the blowdryer was a fire hazard, no bottle opener provided in mini-bar, dry cleaning tag and staples sticking out of comforter....not that any of these were major, but it all starts to add up! The food situation is also dire. The restaurant AND the Jimmy were BOTH closed down. Room service was bodega quality. Hope they can turn this property around to its former glory!

title: Incredible location
text: We spent a weekend at The James. Short walking distance to the best stores and restaurants, and not far from Brooklyn Bridge and One World Trade Center. Very service minded staff - Manny & co. Great weekend

title: New York trip
text:
Found the staff non caring , the reception desk was not informative of the $40 per day charge 
The rooms were poorly cleaned , the staff at the front doors (valet ) did not even offer to put our luggage’s in the car,just barely opened the door . Will not stay again

title: Good hotel bad experience
text: We stayed I winter time but lot of the hotel amenities were closed and the hotel still charged us the full facility fee.  If I had stayed in the summer time I would have more than happy to pay the fee.

title: Aging badly
text: Great location, but the guest rooms are aging badly. Unpatched holes in the walls, non-functional drawers in nightstand, limescale all over the shower, etc.  The walls are also thin and you can hear everything in the hallways but that’s pretty normal in nyc.

title: Great desk staff
text: The room was comfortable, but not super clean. There were hairs all over the bathroom, and someone had written their name on the mirror, which was not appropriately cleaned (since it was still there). Staff was stellar at the desk. They text and make sure things are going well with your room. There is a happy hour (wine & cheese- free) from 6-7pm. We wandered down thinking it started an hour earlier, and the nice gentleman at the desk grabbed us glasses of wine anyway. Selection for this happy hour is Keebler similar crackers and one cheese. Wine is decent, and it’s nice that they do this despite the food selection. Good location in SoHo.

title: Good Quality /price , dedicated staff
text:
I was in NY feb 5-7 on a business trip , actually in Manhattan and did get my return flight cancelled from LaGuardia and stayed an additional night .  I booked this appealing and modern style hotel and was very satisfied by how I was hosted (although the flight mishaps) , greeted with early room access and did get a very high level services at all levels .  First at the concierge and then with the reception , staff communicated with me on the short stay attending to all my needs .
Room was clean so was bathroom , I would recommend  this hotel in Soho , lower Manhattan ...nice environment for walks , boutiques and restaurants . Less crowded and noisy than Times Square !

title: Room & staff nice, should have mentioned renovations.
text: Nice room. Bed and bathroom very good. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Too bad we were not able to enjoy the rooftop bar for the view because of 5 month renovations which we found out on our day of arrival. A huge disappointment because it was a big reason we chose this particular hotel. We visited with a bigger group and had planned on closing the day together in the bar. This should have been mentioned during booking already because it might changed our choice. Too bad because it ruined the joy of our stay while everything else was very nice.

title: Excellent customer service
text: We stayed at the hotel for one night in the Penthouse Suite.  We had a few problems with the suite but the management was responsive and made it all right. The managers Alex and Mr. Roman were very cordial and helpful. The hotel is now being renovated so I imagine the problems we encountered will no longer be an issue.  It's a great place for a summer getaway right in NYC.

title: Convenient location and clean
text:
Great Bell service, great staff and reception area,convenient location and pricing.
I was traveling for leisure and business, this was my third time staying at this Hotel.
They honored the AMEX amenities and services.

title: Nice room and even nicer hotel team!
text: I came to The James hotel for a short NYC work trip. I was warmly welcomed and got a lovely room. The beds are comfortable and I had a nice view...but the best part was how accommodating everyone was...Kenny, in particular -- he helped me charge my phone and guided me to some great local spots I really enjoyed! One of the best stays I have had in a while, THANK YOU!

title: Modern hotel, well appointed rooms and friendly staff
text:
I was very impressed with the hotel overall. The room I had was a good size and had everything I needed to make my stay comfortable. There was a well stocked mini bar and a daily credit.

The bathroom was a large walk in rain shower (no bath). I was very happy with this. There were plenty of towels and bath robes available.

The bed was very comfortable.

The staff were attentive and happy to offer help and advice.

I did not eat in the hotel but there was 24hr room service and paid breakfast in room dinning options. There was daily scones and coffee available in the mornings.

I would stay in the hotel again,

title: Awesome
text: This hotel was great! Super clean, comfy bed, awesome staff, and a cool (chill) club on top floor. The lobby coffee and scones in the am, and wine and cheese in the late afternoon, were great to start and end the day with. Will def stay here again...might be my new NYC fav.

title: Great spot in SOHO
text: Close to shops.  Hotel staff was super helpful with restaurant reservations and recommendations.  Gorgeous lobby area with lots of bright sunlight and great views of city.  Nice touch that they offer cookies and wine at night, scones and coffee in the am.

title: Home away from home
text: I have stayed at a few hotels in this area, and the James is one of the top on my list. The staff is extremely hospitable and friendly, and rooms are spacious and comfortable. Certainly a pleasant experience.

title: NYC Favorite
text:
My Husband & I travel to New York several times a year & love coming back to The James Soho. 
The staff are the best of the best, extremely pleasant & accommodating. We love the well designed rooms & decor, cozy beds & crisp linens. Whether you are relaxing in your room, chilling in the 2nd level lobby lounge with morning coffee, or having a happy hour cocktail at the roof top bar, you can count on amazing views of the skyline & bustling streets below. Not to mention the location in Soho is where you want to be... great shopping & restaurants within walking distance.

title: One of my favorite hotels.
text: Love waking up to the floor to ceiling view of Manhattan and the Freedom tower skyline. Bathrooms and rooms are very well designed. Lots of space for clothing and storage as well as well designed amenities, plugs everywhere.

title: disapointed- not worth the price
text: we were surprised how little the staff tried to make our stay special even though it was new year's eve. At other hotels in NYC where we have stayed in past years they even left us a bottle of champagne for NYE for half the price room rate we paid here. We also asked if we would be able to see the fire works with the kids and we were told yes at time of reservation but then when we arrived we were told we could not even access the roof. And no we could not see the fire works from the room either as we had been told by the front desk when we checked in.

title: Find luxury somewhere else
text:
This hotel is marketed as a luxury hotel, but spend your money somewhere else that is actually luxury. The rooms are nice and the location is great but for the price that includes a sneaky 45$ "service charge", and ironically we were disappointed in the service. The service charge has "perks" that we found to be not worth it (wine and cheese for one hour which was cheap wine, cut up cheddar, and crackers as an example). The room service is overpriced as room service often is but then on top of that there is gratuity and a $10 service fee built it, making it around $32 for a BLT. If we are paying a $45 a night service charge, why do we need to pay yet more money just to actually get service in the hotel? On top of that, when the time came when we actually needed service as an incident at the hotel caused damage to our belongings, no one apologized or tried to make the situation better, only doing the bare minimum when we asked for help. I had to throw out some of my belongings and actually lost money as a result of their poor service. We followed up via e-mail and we still have not gotten a response more than a week later. Where is this service charge coming in hand now? Also the bed was uncomfortable and the room was loud. The glass windows, location, and shower were very nice and the most redeeming quality but also comparable to other places we have stayed in NYC.

Bottom line, if you want luxury you won't get it from here despite paying luxury prices, and their whole concept of "service" can create a bad vibe for your NYC vacation.

title: Great Service
text:
I lived in NYC for 46 years and when I go back to visit friends, I choose The James for the location, well appointed & bright rooms with awesome views (hard to find in NYC) and the service.

Kenny, one of the doormen, went above and beyond in every way to take care of me.  One more reason I’ll be back on my next visit!

title: Excelente hotel para vacacionar
text: Pasamos Año Nuevo en NYC y estamos muy contentos de haber elegido este hotel. Las habitaciones son cómodas, lo mismo las instalaciones del hotel. Queda en el SoHo cerca de transporte público, bares, restaurantes y tiendas súper bonitas. Esta muy bien ubicado, el roof top posee una excelente vista, y aunque no era tiempo de piscina, la misma nos pareció muy agradable.   El personal del hotel es atento.  Tenemos que hacer mención especial a Leidy, del front desk, cuya amabilidad, calidez y eficiencia superaron todas nuestras expectativas.    Camille, nuestra housekeeper, siempre dejo nuestra habitación en muy buenas condiciones.

title: Cosy Soho place
text:
Cosy hotel on nice location.
Close to metrolines and many nice shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood.
Excellent service and relaxed atmosphere with serviced lounge and a magnificent rooftopbar at the top.

title: Great location, yet small rooms and weak service.
text: While I do acknowledge that this is a boutique hotel, its levels of service and comfort can be improved, as it may not offer the best value for money. To begin, my online reservation, although confirmed on the website, was not found upon check-in. The receptionist was kind enough to help and sort things out, and luckily a room similar to what I reserved was available for the 7 days we were to spend in New York. The room, although advertised as a corner studio, implying some form of spaciousness, was surprisingly small, measuring at around 300 square feet. While the view from the room was pleasing, and the presence of floor-to-ceiling windows helped, the room still felt cramped, especially with two suitcases around. The hotel's day-to-day housekeeping was carried out without a hitch, however any other services beyond that were frustrating. Orders for water bottles and in-room dining took long to be brought up, sometimes requiring more than one follow-up call. Not to mention the very limited in-room dining options, which disappear after 11 PM, requiring you to order food from outside. As for the available amenities, there aren't many. The hotel lobby is relatively small, with a few couches, at which you can have complimentary thermos coffee in a paper cup and scones in the morning, and complimentary bottled wine, saltine crackers, and one kind of cheese in the evening - which feels somewhat cheap. The only redeeming factor for The James SOHO is its amazing location, which puts you at walking distance from most interesting attractions in lower Manhattan, the east village and west village, in addition to its vibrant rooftop lounge.

title: Christmas season visit
text: From Alex's very friendly response upon our arrival to our final checkout, the staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  Our room was ready well in advance of customary check in and we were given a room on a higher level.  The James is a modest sized boutique hotel with clean lines, great natural light and a convenient location one block from the Canal Street subway entrance.  While on the edge of Soho, it feels entirely connected.  Like many hotels, its fitness room (a priority for us as frequent travelers is modest, but adequate); its primary restaurant (which we used once for breakfast) is fine, if not exceptional (we were there during winter, so were unable to take advantage of what appear to be terrific outdoor terrace spaces).  The top floor bar has excellent views and is fun spot for a late night cocktail.  We would return for a second visit and have stayed in many hotels in NYC.

title: Awesome service
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. 

Received complimentary coffee and scones every morning, as well as wine in the evenings. 

Great location, walking distance from Chinatown.

Michael at reception was of great service.

title: Christmas vacation
text: Fabulous stay, excellent service from Paul who always went out of his way to help whenever he could, super comfortable bed and fun bar on the rooftop, excellent location for SoHo’s restaurants, bars & shopping

title: Holiday getaway.
text: Spending the holidays in NYC is always a great getaway!  Staying in SoHo for boutique shopping and great meals was a perfect decision.  So was the selection of James SoHo this year!  We will definitively return to the James SoHo.

title: soho boho
text: great location with lovely amenities.  modern decor with awesome window views.  Daily coffee and scones downstairs.  wine in evenings.  excellent rooftop bar.  gym and plunge pool.  genuine staff that was always helpful.

title: Great location, nothing really special otherwise.
text: Very welcoming staff. A bit of a hurdle to get from dropping off a car (parked in a garage several blocks away), to the above street level front desk. Rooms were clean, New York-typical small. No coffee in rooms. The proximity  to the Holland tunnel is what directed us here. It was fine, but we’d likely not stay here again.

title: Certainement pas 4 etoiles
text:
Suite à un avis sur Booking, je me dis que je dois aussi publier mon avis sur TripAdvisor. En effet, la réponse de l'hôtel semble même indiquer que les désagréments de leurs clients leur importent peu. Leur objectif est de surpasser les attentes de leurs clients mais ce n'est qu'une phrase écrite en réponse à une évaluation négative. La stratégie est celle du one shot dans une ville où ils peuvent se le permettre. Alors ne tombez pas dans leur piège et lisez mon avis.
Certes, une belle vue (si vous prenez une chambre coûteuse comme la mienne) et un emplacement pratique mais rien ne vaut un service 4 étoiles que vous n'aurez pas dans cet hôtel. En arrivant, mauvaise communication de mon offre Booking où ils allaient facturer 2 fois mon petit-déjeuner. J'ai d'ailleurs dû expliquer plusieurs fois pendant le séjour que cela ne devait pas être facturé car leur organisation est complexe (la gestion de la cuisine qui reste allumée et cerise sur le gâteau, un ingénieur qui ne résout pas les problèmes. L'hôtel est vétuste et son état s'aggravera probablement avec le temps et les réparations négligées. Des clients m'ont permis de découvrir que New York a son propre Spring Break en hiver (Winter Break peut-être ? ) car des clients ont réservé plusieurs chambres à mon étage et ont fait la fête pendant de heures la nuit, dans leur chambre et le couloir. Mes différents appels téléphoniques n'ont pas pu motiver la réception à faire un suivi professionnel de ces clients sans aucun respect. Pas de restaurant à l'hôtel donc le petit-déjeuner doit se prendre dans la chambre ou à l'extérieur de l'hôtel. Un soir, la TV ne fonctionnait pas: inutile de vois dire que l'ingénieur n'a rien réglé ce soir-là. Enfin, les réductions promises pendant le séjour (et bien faibles par rapport aux désagréments occasionnés) n'étaient pas prises en compte sur la note de checkout. En conclusion, un hôtel dont le prix et les étoiles ne sont pas du tout en rapport avec l'expérience réelle et encore moins avec leur objectif de surpasser les attentes de leurs clients. Leur objectif est d'attirer les clients comme moi avec de belles photos et descriptions qui surpassent en effet nos attentes, avant de décevoir.

title: Our new go to hotel in NYC
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our 7 day Xmas stay at the James. Our son lives in Manhattan and we’ve stayed in numerous hotels. Hands down James takes it. Wonderful staff, great location!  We’ll be back again!!

title: Great!
text: I ended up catching a bad cold while I was in NY. The hotel staff was highly accommodating, especially LADY who was really great and really helpful with everything! What a nice hotel and what a great staff you have! Highly recommended - especially if you're sick!

title: Christmas trip
text: Enjoyed the hotel staff friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and the beds were very comfortable. Would recommend this to friends and family. The staff explained the subway system and helped us be able to take less cabs.

title: Christmas in the City!
text: It has become a tradition in my family to stay 1 night in NYC on our way to see family for the Holidays. This year we wanted a view of the Freedom Tower. This hotel not only has the best views, it’s staff is truly world class. From the time we arrived Kenny made us feel like we were VIP’s. With great food and entertainment right at your fingertips to the high end rooms with heated bathroom floors and modern amenities this hotel has so much to offer. With out any exception though Kenny is something no other hotel can offer.

title: Amazing Visit
text:
The moment we arrived we knew it would be a great visit. Upon arriving to The James we were greatest by Kris and Yami and there bright smiles. They were very welcoming and immediately made us feel welcome. Upon checking in- they wanted to make sure our visit was memorable and upgraded our room and greeted us with complimentary wine. This was by far one of the warmest and most welcoming greetings to a hotel I have experienced for as much as we travel.

Thank you Kris and Yami for the great experience.

title: Great place to stay
text: I recently stayed here on a business trip and found the hotel to be wonderful.  It was clean and the staff was super friendly and helpful.  The rooms weren't huge but fine and great for working from the room.  The restaurant Gitano was great.  Overall would definitely recommend this property.

title: Wonderful!!
text: Love it there! Only wish they had Netflix on the tv. Friendliest staff in all of NYC!! The room was always clean. Wonderful part of soho. Very accessible to all the great shopping and subway! We always recommend the james to our friends!!

title: All you need for a nice stay.
text: Stayed for two nights for work. Staff are friendly and helpful. Room is spacious and nicely fitted out with a comfortable bed, well specced bathroom and a great shower. Gym is well equipped. Breakfast is great 👍🏼. All I need for a great stay. Thank you again to the team at James Hotel.

title: URGENT STAY
text:
I had a trouble booking through a website and I showed up to the reception with no reservations!! 
I explained my situation and Yuoh and Leidy were very helpful trying to find me a good room in a peak time during the year “Christmas”.

Yuoh walked me to the elevator and helped me with my bags and shakes my hands, Leidy cheered me with a nice welcoming smile. My first impression was excellent, and the room is spectacular.

Thank you so much!

title: Used to be an awesome hotel
text: Staff is very helpful, but this hotel is under new management and it shows. Walls are peeling (look at the ceiling). Stains on bed linen. Location is the best, but the rooms and quality need attention. It's sad this used to be my favorite hotel in NYC. I used to only stay here. Nice coffee shop across the street. I started staying elsewhere.

title: Spazioso
text: Carino hotel molto spazioso come camere e bagno, colazione carina ma migliorabile. Strano il fatto di dover passare da livello stradale a lounge con un ascensore e poi usare un altro ascensore per accedere alle camere. La lounge è carina ma essendo molto allungata manca di calore umano, è una strana sensazione. Insomma un bel posto ma con un carattere architettonico un pochino freddo.

title: Closing bar/restaurant for private parties
text: Booked The James for my wife's birthday and planned a great NYC weekend. Upon arrival I was extremely disappointed in the size of the room . I booked a corner king in hopes of having more space but it was small and the only place to sit was a bench against a window, a wirey chair and the bed. To kick of the weekend festivities we headed to the bar Jimmy on the 17th floor only to find out it was closed for a private party (wait, shouldn't paying guests of the hotel have access to the only bar? Closed by outsiders?) headed to the attached restaurant for plan B only to find it too was closed for a private party. it was raining like mad and our only option was to slog down the street to Il Mulino for a drink (where they were incredibly friendly and welcoming!). When we got back to the hotel after dinner looking for an after dinner drink , everything was still closed for a private party. I complained to management and they brought a container of cranberry juice and some limes. I tried to order drinks for in room delivery but apparently they only have beer and wine. Big disappointment all around--not a cheap room--over $850 per night. I know it's NYC in December but I expected better service and acknowledgment that this was so not cool--I'm fairly certain we were not the only truly disappointed guests.

title: 5 Star Service Across the Board
text: We arrived at JFK very early on a Saturday morning and headed straight to the hotel.  We were several hours early for check-in, but the night manager Shefi was more than accommodating.  He took our bags and stored them for us, so we could relax in the warm lobby on a couch.  He offered us scones and coffee as we relaxed for a while, we were exhausted from the previous days travels.  Another associate named Kenny was just awesome.  He recommended several places we could eat breakfast that morning and for the rest of our trip.  He gave a variety of recommendations and they were all great.  Many places didn't open up for an hour or longer, but he suggested we went downstairs to a local deli that serves food 24 hours a day. In fact, he walked us downstairs, out of the hotel, and into the deli.  He introduced us to the staff and said once our food was ready, to come back into the hotel and enjoy it there.  The food was solid, service was great, both guys were very nice.  Shefi was able to get us our room hours before we had expected.  It made the trip for us, couldn't imagine if we weren't able to get that power nap in, could've made for an exhausting Saturday.  Kenny was generous enough to gift us a couple of drink coupons to the rooftop bar, we used them the following evening.  The room was clean, had a lovely view, and everything we could've asked or. It was a great stay overall and would highly recommend it.  Thank you to the whole staff!

title: Dirty and very noisy
text:
Currently staying at the James Soho. There are a few issues that I believe other readers need to be aware of. Overall the hotel is very well located but I don’t think this is reasonable to call it a 5 stars hotel. 
1. When I checked in there was some chips on the floor. I appreciate that the cleaning ladies can do mistakes but this was very surprising and unpleasant. The room looks quite old. The bathroom seemed clean though. I am staying on the 16th floor so used stairs to go to the gym on the 17th - but the stairs are extreely dirty, with some fruits and insects. This was disgusting 
2. I suffered from strong headache (not the hotel fault unfortunately) and the permanent noise during the day, in the corridor was just too much. I called the reception several times but nothing happened. For people looking for some rest or needing to sleep during the day because of the jet lag - just look for another place. 

I was very enthusiastic in trying this hotel but this came as very unpleasant experience. Too dirty and too noisy.

title: Great Stay
text: I took my wife to NYC for her first visit, and decided to stay at the James. When booking, I mentioned to Kris it was my wife’s first time to the city. When we arrived, there was a complimentary bottle of champagne and fruit and cheese tray awaiting us. The room was clean and had a typical downtown feel. At night, drinks at on the rooftop bar while looking at the skyline was a perfect end to each day. We will definitely be staying here again when visiting NYC.

title: Not as nice as it should be.
text:
Service needs to improve. This hotel is too expensive compare to the level of service provided.
I will not go back until it improves.
Rooms are great.
Lobby is not as great as what you can expect of such a hotel.

title: Great Service
text: Bobby brought us fresh baked cookies right to our room!! They were delicious. Michael was very informative when we checked in. He told us all about the James Club!! Everyone was very friendly & nice!!

title: An below satisfactory stay at a hotel I loved to stay. Next trip to NYC will definitely be looking at new hotel options
text: The james Soho was recommended to me by a colleague about 5 years ago. I visit NYC about twice a year and since my first stay I have stayed at the James Soho. I found the staff to be very helpful and pleasant. Always accommodating when I had requests and went out of their way to make my stay happy. In fact as a regular customer they in the past recognized that and always would give upgrades to show I was appreciated. This trip the front desk staff put me in a terrible room with no view. I told the young lady I am a regular customer and always get a room with a city view. She made no attempt to accommodate my request. I had to change hotel rooms three times because the room was unsatisfactory. I eventually settled for a room with a city view but the locking mechanism because broken. The room was not cleaned properly. I was not satisfied with my stay at all and have always recommended the James Soho to friends and colleagues. I am not certain I would do the same now

title: good location, great staff
text: I stayed here 8 years ago. The hotel seems to have lost a little polish since then, but the location is still fantastic and the staff was very helpful. My first visit I stayed on the 15th floor so we had an amazing view west over the Hudson. This time we were on the fourth floor, so no real view. That was a little disappointing, but bound to happen. Overall it was a good experience, it just seems a bit pricey now for what is offered, but to be fair, I haven't stayed at any other $400+ hotels in NYC recently. The location with the Canal Street ACE stop right on the same block as the hotel can't be beat.

title: Love the James!
text: First time at the James Soho and we had a wonderful trip.  The James is in a great downtown location with easy access to all of Manhattan-and Brooklyn.  The James has a great vibe.  Hip and lovely but not too cool.  Service was great and always friendly and helpful. A special thanks to Bobby and Mike at the desk for their excellent service and great recommendations.  Be sure to spend some time in the rooftop bar for beautiful views of the city.  Loved it! We’ll be back. Thank you!

title: Good Location - Medium Quality
text:
Good Location. Medium Quality
First night I had a corner room. Not properly cleaned. Then i moved to a normal queen room. Higher floor with a nice view. Better cleaned but the bed sheets were stained. Nothing you would expect from a 5stars hotel. I had even a problem with the heating system. I hope next time to be luckier.

title: Nice Hotel
text: Went to New for the weekend w/ another couple stayed at The James SoHo, checked in on Friday afternoon. Young man at the lobby desk was very nice offered 2 locations to eat soup dumplings. Went to one of them and had a nice time, lots of good food/ appetizers. Our rooms were nice, clean, close to the elevator. Expected lots of noise but not to bad. The fridge in the room is a mini bar so if you want to put anything in it you have rearrange things, it worked out but prefer to be able to use the fridge for our drinks and snacks as we were at several breweries and needed space for beer.  Provide coffee & scones in the AM, snacks & drinks in the afternoon, we had the coffee which was good.  At check out time there was a charge on our bill for the resturant, which we never went to, they took the charge off.  There was another guest at the time of check in complaining about his bill, not sure of that outcome. Not sure if we would go back again, don't get me wrong it was not horrible, rather nice but there are so many hotels to stay in that it might be worth trying some other place.

title: New NYC go-to!
text: I will stay in this hotel every time I go to New York now! Wonderful staff, great, clean rooms, close to SoHo shopping. Can't compliment the place enough. The only thing I might warn about is that the DJ in the bar was a little loud, we were hoping to sit in a quiet place and have a cocktail, but at the time we went up, the music was a little loud/clubby, but we enjoyed anyway.

title: FANTASTIC
text: This was my second time at The James Soho. First time was during NYFW. I knew I needed to stay there again. So I took a long weekend with friends and AGAIN, fantastic service. Will definitely be back!

title: Johnny is fantastic
text: Johnny helped us avoid an awkward situation upon arrival. Really appreciate his hospitality! It’s a joy to work with someone who gets it and is willing to put guest needs first. Now we can get to work!

title: Amazing!
text: My sister and I booked this chic hotel for a bachelorette weekend. Upon check-in, the staff couldn't have been more accommodating and kind. We may have been in the middle of NYC, but we definitely received "mom and pop" treatment. Anything we needed, they helped us with - no sign of annoyance or arrogance. Special call out to Leidy, Natalie, Yami, Kris, Kenny and Paul. Every person that worked at The James NY SoHo was pleasant, and helpful, and just amazing. They went out of their way to make everyone in our group feel special. The location is to die for - amazing views of the Freedom Tower - great rooftop pool - great food - great service - we just had an amazing time - next time we are visiting Manhattan and staying the night - we will be sure to book The James New York SoHo.

title: Nice hotel with really comfy beds, but a bit worn down.
text: We had a good weekend stay at The James. The beds were excellent, but the hotel in general was a bit too worn down. Rooms are spacious in New York standard, and ok value for money. Fitness room has an excellent view.

title: Amazing View
text: Wonderful stay, the hotel was very nice and the beds were extremely comfortable. I will definitely be using again if I choose to stay in NY. There is an upstairs roof deck which gives amazing views and also there is a pool but being that it was about 32 degrees and windy, we weren't able to use it. Would be fantastic in the summer months however

title: The James Soho New York
text: Always have a good stay at this chic hotel. Breakfast could be improved with a continental type buffet breakfast.Always stay at this hotel when in New York so would be pleasing if they could tacvkle breakfast for us Europeans.

title: Don’t go
text: They lost my own pillow. My wife sprained her ankle, they did not offer any kind of help. He decided to leave the hotel before we should, some packages were arriving for us, and very rudely they denied information about them

title: Un paseo por NoMad
text:
Buen hotel y excelente ubicación. Restoran con muy buena comida, hacer reserva con tiempo.
La ubicación es ideal para caminar hasta el Brooklyn. Hagan el animo por que vale la pena sobretodo pasar almorzar por ChinaTown y Little Italy, sin antes detenerse en café Fanelli...

title: Weekend trip
text: Great hotel for soho area, very walkable. The staff are friendly and Jonny Houston was a very accommodating. Rooms are small but clean. Roof top bar was a great place to have drinks and views of the city.

title: Ótima localização
text: Localização excelente , bar lindo no Rooftop é uma piscina . Equipe bem preparada , muita simpática . Quarto amplo para os padrões de NY , vista bonita , colchão  e lençóis de boa qualidade . Copiles pela manhã com café na recepção e queijos à noite são mimos do hotel para seus hóspedes !

title: Exciting contemporary room in Soho
text: Hi-tech room with innovative glassed-in bathroom, which makes the bedroom and the bathroom seem open. (There is a privacy screen.) Exemplary staff. Scones and coffee in the lobby in the morning, along with today's newspaper.

title: Such a wonderful stay!
text: I adored this hotel and the location. It's just steps away from SoHo shopping and dining and there's a great coffee shop across the street. The rooms are very modern with excellent bathroom space. You can't beat the natural light from the large windows! I hope to come back soon.

title: Not satisfied
text: When we arrived we were able to get our room promptly,  we went to the restaurant onsite and couldn’t get a Bloody Mary.  Our shower didn’t drain and our fridge didn’t close.  We tried to call down to the front desk and we got put on hold for 20 min.  They removed a resort fee but I paid too much money for that type or service.  Never was greeted by any door man.  Not even a good evening or good morning!
