title: The James Soho
text:
All around one of my favorite hotels.  Fresh coffee and scones in the morning.  A friendly staff and everything in Soho is a quick walk from the hotel. I have stayed at the James on many occasions and I believe it has even changed ownership but that hasn’t stopped it from being one
Of the best in NYC.

title: Perfectly Elegant
text: I found this hotel by chance when the Airbnb was not as described.  I LOVE this hotel and will stay here again and again. Staff was always helpful and present.  This hotel is perfectly placed to get just about anywhere in NYC.  I wish I could have extended my stay.

title: Hotel in NYC
text: Good location, clean, friendly staff and overall a pleasant stay. One disadvantage is the closet and drawer space in the room. Two adults with their respective luggage and clothes do not fit. Other than that it was enjoyable.

title: Location was key
text: Had what appeared to be mold stains on one of the sheets which were not seen until late night tore sheet off bed and dealt with it...restaurant has its own issues and needs to work on it to keep up with the facility

title: Luxury in SoHo
text: The James is in a prime location with access to all in SoHo, Tribeca, and the Village. Very comfortable stay, and Jimmy (rooftop bar) has some of the best views in the city! Family friendly as well. I look forward to staying here again.

title: Great Hotel - Great Location
text:
Many thanks to Mike the bellman who gave us an excellent NY Pizza recommendation!

Walkable neighborhood filled with great restaurants. Gitano’s restaurant was much better than we expected it would be. The guacamole and carne  asada we’re both great.

title: Great location!
text: Perfect location for shopping and eating. The staff are super friendly and so accommodating. Rooms are quite small and a little tired but great amenities and a wonderful staff make up for it. Would definitely recommend.

title: Room was not ready at time of check in and lack of proactive management
text:
Room was not ready at check in. 
Very expensive for the service. There is night close of curtains or open bed. Manual curtains. 
Reasonable good place if you want to stay in Soho. Nice rooftop. Noisy at night but didn’t bother on my room

title: Won't stay anywhere else
text:
The James is by far the best value and experience I have had .
I have stayed at some other , but always end up back at The James .
All the staff are so attentive and helpful .
Without a doubt, the best !

title: Second Home
text: Always good to be back. Great location in the heart of Soho and close to the subway station. Nice and extremely helpful staff. Modern, well equipped rooms with phantastic views. Superb roof terrace and nice lobby lounge to hang out.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Loved our stay, my wife and Iwill be back. Kris and Natalie were excellent with our check in and explaining all the hotel amenities, they were very friendly and helpful with any questions we had!!! Great experience.

title: Fantastic views!
text:
We had a corner King suite the views from both rooms were fantastic!  The rooms were comfortable and roomy, bathroom was large and had tub, separate shower and two sinks.Staff was pleasant and helpful 
We would definitely stay here again!

title: Noisy small room, comfortable bed
text: All king rooms are on the side of the building overlooking the Holland Tunnel exit, so particularly if you are on a lower floor, there will be a ton of honking outside at all hours. The first night we were on the 8th floor, second and third nights on the 15th, which was better (and we set up our phones to the (tinny) speaker in the room for ocean sounds which helped). I suspect the side of the building with queen beds would be noticeably quieter. The property is really cool, there are some beautiful garden/patio areas; the roof/pool deck (club) is a raging party at night, but we did not hear that from our room at all. The lobby is serene but with remarkably uncomfortable furniture (looks so cozy and then you sit down!). It was a fine stay and an excellent location, but we will choose something else next time.

title: Luxury Boutique hotel a memorable stay
text: I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights for a business trip and my mom tagged along and it was a stay to remember!! I highly recommend this hotel. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of SoHo, easy to go to canal street for subway and easy to go to broadway and stores.  Even though I was busy with work, the hotel personnel went above and beyond to make my stay a comfortable, elevated experience. Thank you, Natalie, Kris, Johnny and Maurice to helping surprise my mom with a warm gift and note from the hotel, she loved it! The hotel has modern luxurious decorations, the rooms are big and comfortable, the rooftop becomes a club so if you want to have some drinks and mingle it is great. The hotel is quiet, they offer complimentary coffee until 11 am and small bites for breakfast and every day from 6 pm they offered wine and cheese (delicious cheese btw). The staff of the hotel really made us feel welcomed and cared for thanks and I will for sure book this hotel again when going to NYC.

title: James NY SoHo
text: The hotel was lovely. Great room and comfy bed. Was a great location for my meeting. This is close to shopping also if you want. A little confusing with the entrance but all good. Discovered a great bar to the right!

title: Location good, otherweis disappoinment
text: Chek in to the hotetel was slow and not prfessonal. Location is good if you want to stay in Soho. The rooms where good size and clean. The breakfast area outside was dirty and very slow service. The coplimentary wine hour was a joke. No wine and no clases. If you do that do it well or don´t do it at all! The doormen where helpful and professonal!

title: Tolle Aussicht
text: Super Aussicht auf downtown Manhattan. Die Bar Öffnet ab 17 Uhr ..Es gibt einen Pool auf der Terrasse.Leckere Cocktails und sehr freundlicher bartender. Das Jimmy’s Rooftop  Bar kann ich sehr empfehlen .

title: Fabulos
text:
Excellant, value for money, clean, and comfortable. Quiet location for relaxing, great location for shopping. Friendly staff, helpful and accommodating. Secure, nothing too much trouble.
Great in every way, would recommend.

title: Parfait
text:
Réservé par le biais de Very Chic. Très belle chambre avec salle de bain toute vitrée.
Pour accéder au lobby, il faut emprunter un ascenseur en verre et pour accéder aux chambres, d autres ascenseurs qui permettent aussi de filtrer les arrivées au rooftop hyper prisé. 
L'acceuil est au top. Les différents agents de sécurité qui filtrent les entrées sont tous super stylés, adorables et cherchent spontanément à vous rendre service. 
Nous n'avons pas utilisé le resto ou le rooftop mais beaucoup beaucoup de monde s'y rendait. 
Il y a des bouches de métro à proximité donc très facile de se déplacer.

title: Not a High Class Experience
text:
I have to admit I was pretty disappointed with The James hotel. For the significantly high price point per night, I did not get the experience I would have imagined. I will say, the staff is friendly, and that was were the positives end. I stayed here on business for 3 nights. Upon check in, our 3 rooms were not ready. When we finally were able to get into the rooms, they seem very cool from the looks of it, but functionality-wise were super inefficient. The water guage on both the shower and the sink were inconsistent - upon turning on the water would always be boiling hot and took long while to cool down. I ended up having to brush my teeth with bottled water as I did not have time to wait for the water to become a normal temperature. The light switches did not make sense and seemed to not be connected with anything. There were little outlets - only 1 surge protector/power strip on the floor (with little give). The elevators always took forever. And then to top it off, we were transporting extremely expensive equipment. When we (finally) found the bellman and asked if he can watch our cart of gear for 5 minutes while we grabbed a coffee across the street, we come back to our gear with no one around. No one watching it. We simply carted out our gear on our own, which wasnt a problem, but it could have been anyone who took the gear out of the hotel as no one was watching it. 

I stay in a lot of hotels that are much cheaper than this, especially in New York, and expect a higher level of service and amenities than I received. Likely will not stay again.

title: Great experience!
text: This was my first time staying at the James. Beautiful hotel, great check-in experience with Bobby! Will definitely stay here again. The SoHo location is really convenient to dining, shopping and clubs. The rooftop bar is really cool!

title: The James New York SoHo
text:
Wonderful New York experience shared with many friends. Check in was fast, pleasant, our luggage was in the room quick. The room had a wonderful city view of the 9/11 Peace Tower. 
Variety of snacks and beverages in the lobby throughout the morning to evening. Concierge was extremely helpfully with restaurants, directions and our group photo shoot! Roof top bar was full of energy, great music with a Soho vibe. The hotel is steps away from amazing shopping and tourist attractions. 
Rooms were clean and modern.

title: I’d stay again
text: Here for work so I’m relieved to state that I had an amazing stay. The staff was extremely knowledgeable and helpful the entire stay. Kristina especially was super sweet and welcoming. Hope work sends me back soon!

title: Great location and staff
text: really great experience at the James. The staff was very nice and attentive, we were celebrating our anniversary and it was such a nice surprise to have a note and amenity in the room. Will be back very soon for sure!

title: Overall, Very Good
text: Check in with Bobby and Natalie was GREAT; warm and welcoming. Bobby was new and eagerness, commitment to customer service evident.  Problem solving with Johnny the pm manager was  even better. Room was little worn but clean. Check out team was less stellar, impressive.

title: Gitano was a big disappointment
text:
I agree mostly with the remarks about the hotel generally but it was a shame about gitano bar and restaurant. The staff particularly one female member were quite rude and overall the service was poor. 
As Australian we always tip according to good service, but I don't like having to tip for no service!
Also overall the area was grubby and tired and needed a bit of attention.  We had a very average guacamole which was all that was on offer after 4pm but most plates seemed to be returned half finished. Can do a lot better ....

title: Great stay, great service!
text: I stayed here for one night at the end of my business trip and was scarred from my last hotel room which was very small. Natalie at the front desk did a great job checking me in early and getting me a room that was perfect! She even checked in on me afterwards via text. We had consistent great service from the staff with Bobby delivering us excellent cookies and Kenny helping me with a ride to the airport early in the morning. I would recommend this hotel which is excellently located in SoHo.

title: Cool vibe , great service
text:
My daughter and I checked in today after visiting NYU and we love the modern style,
Relaxed atmosphere and friendly service.
Room is open and airy. Kris at the desk was very personable and accommodating.
Definitely will stay here again.

title: excellent attention and very cool
text: Everything was Excellent. The staff super kind and helpers. The coffe in the lobby wass grate !!!  The rooftop super cool. The view is wonderful, in the room and in the rooftop. Te decoration is nice and modern .

title: Views
text:
Our friend just moved to New York so we decided to show her a few of our favorite places on a Sunday afternoon. 

For our final stop we decided to head over to  one of my wife’s favorite spots the Jimmy at The James. The Rooftop comes with incredible views, well crafted drinks, and a DJ who really knows how to set a vibe. 

After a round of drinks, we decided to book a room where we could view the skyline.

I was able to book a room right from my phone in less than 5 minutes and was even able to pay with Apple Pay.

We headed down from the rooftop to the front desk so we could check-in. At the front desk we were greeted by Kris & Bobby who provided exceptional service. Check-in was really smooth they even offered a glass of wine for each of us. 

Our room was on the 12th floor room 1203 which was top tier, had all the amenities and offered one of the best city views. There was no better setting to end the night which was only lit by the Manhattan Skyline.

title: Nice place
text: Great location. Room are small. Amazing rooftop bar with amazing views. DJ spinning music.  We travelled here 3 times. One waitress on the rooftop was rude. But usually the. Staff is friendly. The food at jimmy roof top really good.

title: BEST OF NYC
text:
Our stay at THE JAMES OF SOHO was the best of any in New York City.  The staff was wonderfully helpful from the moment we arrived.
The location is perfect for a lovely stay in the city.  The proximity to all the super restaurants and shopping and metros makes this our go to hotel.  We could walk everywhere or catch the subway at the corner.
The rooms though small are wonderfully appointed with robes, slippers, big soft fabulous towels and a huge window overlooking the city.  The heat and AC worked perfectly and were both quiet and dust free.  The linens were always clean crisp and fresh.
The bathroom was large with a super shower.  I appreciated the hard wood floors and lack of carpeting as this creates a much cleaner atmosphere.
We enjoyed the mini breakfast of coffee and scones and wine and cheese in the afternoon and drinks in the sky bar at night. 
To me and my daughter who come to the city for a holiday every year, we have now found the only place we would book for sure.

title: Business Travel...Never Felt So Good!
text: The James New York SoHo is the right blend of contemporary elogence and comfort!  This is my favorite hotel when I travel for business! Great hotels and even better vibes!  You will not be disappointed!

title: Fantastic stay - Bobby is the best
text: I had an amazing stay at the James NY - Soho. The staff was amazing, the rooms were comfy with great amenities & views of NYC, and the rooftop was next level. Bobby at the front desk was a huge help at making my stay a special one.

title: Exceptional Customer Service!
text: The highlight of my stay would have to be the staff. In particular, Johnny and Natalie! Not only were they both helpful and accommodating, but even after long work meetings, I could always look forward to warm or even funny greetings. The two are exemplary of what one should expect during a New York Hotel stay and I commend them both.

title: Beyond expectations
text:
After 5 days in a Times Square hotel we were supposed to fly to Miami but hurricane Dorian forced us to change our plans. So we decided to stay in NYC for 5 more days but switch from busy Times Square to the calmer Soho area and we booked at the James Hotel.
The hotel design wise is amazing. Lots of lights come in through huge windows at the reception area and in the rooms. From the rooftop bar you can enjoy breathtaking views on different parts of New York. We personally were on the 10th floor and therefore didn’t hear any music in our room at night. However it does get busy up there on weekends. We felt that the cocktails were over overpriced (+-22 dollars incl tax), this is even more than what we pay here in Switzerland for a cocktail. Waiters get rude when you don’t tip them.

However, the big plus of this Hotel is the staff (excluding barmen). The lobby guys are fantastic. Kenny greeted us and was extremely friendly, kind, proactive and helpful. The James Hotel can be (very) lucky to have a guy like him.. hard to find such friendly people nowadays in the hospitality branch.
The reception team was amazing as well and was very helpful the few times we reached out to them.
All in all I would give 4 stars - but thanks to the reception team and Kenny, I have no choice than to give a solid 5 star review.

See you soon James Hotel!

title: New favourite NYC hotel
text: So far I absolutely love this hotel. Just checked into a lovely room, huge for New York standards with ceiling to floor windows. The hotel staff have all been lovely thanks to Natalie for making our check in quick and effortless and giving us a gorgeous room and to Kris for telling us which room was the best! 1008 btw! We received complimentary drinks coupons on arrival and are looking forward to the wine and cheese and cookies later. Definitely recommend if you want a big, luxurious hotel with friendly staff while staying in New York.

title: Could be better
text:
For this price and the amounts of hotel around, the price is too high for the services provided.
You can get the same quality and services for less if you take time to check .

Make sure to check also your bill, they charge me extra night by mistake....

title: Stunning hotel with incredible views of the city
text: Checked in to the hotel after a long day and Bobby hooked it up with an upgrade to ease my troubles! Lovely hotel with complimentary amenities in the morning and evening. Spacious rooms & nice products in the bathroom.

title: Awesome views
text: We had a great stay at a beautiful hotel. Views from our room were amazing and Bobby was fantastic. We wanted a night in the city instead of a commute home and The James was the perfect location. The Jimmy was a little loud but drinks and views were spectacular.

title: Great boutique hotel, but overpriced
text: The hotel is cute and aesthetically pleasing. The staff was extremely kind and helpful. It was overpriced for the small sized rooms and minimal amenities provided. Also the bathroom lighting needs improvement. Lastly, the rooftop bar is amazing. The views are beautiful for sunset, and anytime really. There is a DJ at the rooftop bar at night on the weekends. My only disappointment with the hotel rooftop bar as well as the restaurant downstairs is price. The drinks are far overpriced and it takes 20 years to get a drink. The food is ok but nothing special. I’d rather pay the same amount for a high quality meal elsewhere in NYC. I understand the rooms are small because it’s NYC and space is limited so that wasn’t too much of a turn off for me. Overall, my experience at the James was very enjoyable. The location was amazing; the hotel is close to all the fun shops in soho as well as tasty restaurants. Would recommend staying here but bring a light if you are a girl because the bathrooms are dark and hard to put makeup on in.

title: Must Stay
text: I was checked in early, but while I waited I sat and enjoyed the beautiful view and ate the most amazing scones I have ever had. From Jimmy on the first floor to every staff member my business trip went flawlessly. I enjoyed a lunch in the Jungle Room that is connected to the hotel. It is a must stop. Perfect little vacation from the city. I will be back to this hotel again!!!

title: Flexability and good service
text:
Large room with view. Very good location. Good service of the staff especially from breakfast resturant, doorman and management.
Need to pay attention for housekeeping. Floor was sticky, no changing of toalet paper and soap.

title: Too expensive
text:
A nice hotel in a nice location, but way overpriced compared to what you get, even for NY.
We got a corner room with supposed skyline view. On the 8th floor. -Which is obviously not high enough for a proper skyline view. Still cost $500+ per night. Cleaning was bad. Don't check under bed or in corners. You might find things left by earlier occupants. Breakfast was mediocre. Pastries dry every morning. And you only get one cup of coffee each. Not that you necessarily want more, but at this price that should not be restricted.

title: Cool place with great amenities in the best location of NYC.
text: Enjoyed my stay here very much.  I loved the pool on the roof and the room size and decor.  The location in Soho is the best in NYC.  The restaurant adjacent to the hotel is excellent with beautiful decor.  The only thing that is a nuisance is that the hotel charges a resort fee of $40 and then adds taxes and fees to this on a daily basis.  I hate being nickled and dimed and just wish that they would have this added to the room rate for a honest idea of one's true cost.

title: Great hotel in Soho!
text: The hotel is definitely a hidden gem in Soho, the staff is very friendly, and very customer oriented. The roof top pool/bar is a lot of fun as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay in Soho!

title: Enjoyable stay
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The James Hotel, the rooms were very clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is ideal for people wanting to explore the city. All staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. Especially Bobby on the reception who helped us to organise a restaurant booking to surprise our family for a special occasion and Paul the bellboy who was always polite and welcoming. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

title: Great hotel
text: Large windows in room give stunning views of city. Loved the rooftop pool/bar and the restaurants outside areas with lovely large potted plants and umbrellas. Little outdoor oasis in the city. Highly recommend.

title: Bobby is the man
text:
Great staff, especially the front desk. Bobby checked me in and started my stay with a wonderful welcoming. I had a room on the 15th floor, with a great view! 

They have a great breakfast and tons of beautiful amenities. Although, I must mention, there was a cockroach in the bathroom.

title: Incredible Hospitality that Matches the High Class Elegance of the Hotel
text: Our stay at The James was one of the best experiences we have had in a long time staying at a hotel. Bobby, Kris and Terrill went over and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Easy check-in process, delicious food, and a fun atmosphere at the rooftop bar and pool. It was so nice to feel "out in NYC" at the chic rooftop then to just take a couple floors down to our room was a perfect escape. If you like modern decor this is the place to stay! I will always stay at this hotel every time we come to New York. It won't disappoint!

title: Great Hotel in Soho
text: Had such a fun time staying at the James! Centrally located / within walking distance to tons of shops and restaurants in Soho / Greenwich Village. Hotel staff was very pleasant and enjoyed the wine hour at the hotel!

title: Great Hotel
text: We had an amazing time.I loved the hotel. Staff are super friendly and helpful. All the areas and the rooms are super bright. View was fabulous and service was great. We will be back next time we're traveling to NY.

title: Disappointing Experience
text:
We picked James instead of SOHO Grand for its modern design and rooftop pool. Hotel charges a daily "resort" fee of $40 and the pool is a useless, tiny pool with no room to walk around or enjoy peace.  At 5pm thru 1am, it becomes a loud congregation of 20 year olds listening to a DJ music that can be heard 16 floors down.  

My wife and I flew in on different flights at end of a hard week.  Her flight got in several hours before mine. Despite same list name and hotel having been paid for, hotel refused to get her in because her name was not specifically on the registration, choosing instead to rudely have her sit in lobby for a long time after 5 hours of travelling until I called the front desk.

title: Raised my expectations.
text: Honesty wowed! By how beautiful it is! It has everything going for it, in walking distance from good restaurants and bars. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Bobby he greeted us with the up most  professionalism.  Definitely will be staying there again.

title: Great quality and clean rooms
text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the james over a holiday weekend and right from when we first pulled up to the hotel we were greeted by the valet who was extremely helpful. We went up to check in and Bobby and Kris were wonderful. They checked us in quickly, verified our reservation, and told us about all the amenities. The hotel room itself was gorgeous. The shower was beautiful with plenty of hot water. The robes are comfortable and the bed sheets are soft. Not to mention the view was exactly what we were hoping for when booking a hotel on Manhattan. This trip was our first time in NYC and it certainly wont be our last. 10/10 would stay at the James again next time!

title: Best hotel ever!!
text: The front desk ladies Natalie and Kristina made my birthday weekend memorable! They were very nice and treated us as if we were royalty! Our room had an amazing view of the One World Trade Center and SoHo. It was super clean! The rooftop pool party was a lot of fun!! The breakfast is delicious! We will be making this our go to hotel for our future New York trips!

title: Great location but pool and rooftop terrace disappointing
text:
Staff is very friendly, rooms are nice and not too small for NY, comfortable beds. 
Rooftop pool and terrace are a joke. The pool is more like a bathtub (ca 3x6 meters). Hotel guests have to vacate the pool area by 4pm (earlier on weekends) to allow for preprations for the bar that opens at 5.
Meaning kids under 21 cannot access the rooftop or pool area after 4!
When we ordered a regula coffee and an espresso in the morning we were handed a 32$ bill, admin fee, room service fee etc. We cancelled the order, which was graciously accepted.
When we asked for an umbrella against the blasting sun we were told that the umbrellas are owned by the bar and that the hotel staff cannot use them fir hotel guests.
Visited the bar almost every evening to check it out, never stayed more than 5 minutes. Cheap, primitive crowd.
If you want to choose the hotel for its great location or decent rooms, go for it, but ignore the pool and bar section in your decision until the hotel management has figured out how to operate a hotel!

title: Top notched service
text: This place is amazing. Rooftop view is stunning, the room was extremely comfortable. I will definitely recommended for a nice getaway. Staff is incredibly, Front desk agents were so helpful and they explained all amenities of the hotel. Natalie and Kris greeted me with a kind smile, excellent customer service, they make me feel like I was home. 5 stars for this place!!!

title: Great stay!
text:
Great stay at The James, perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, spacious and clean rooms. 
Good on site amenities, including the roof deck with pool, lounge and restaurant. You can walk anywhere in downtown Manhattan from the hotel.

title: Amazing location and fabulous service!
text: We had a wonderful stay at The James. We had a suite with amazing views. Even though the room was small the windows and view made it feel so much bigger. We requested a room that wasn’t too close to the rooftop bar - this request was accommodated. The bed was excellent! The service was great and the location was perfect. We would def recommend The James

title: Very confortable stay!
text:
We are at the end of our great stay in this cozy hotel. Firstly, the location is perfect! You are in Soho and feel the quality of the café’s, restaurants, bars and shops only 2 steps away from you. Canal street subway st. is at the corner of the street. Since the traffic condition is very bad in NY you will need to take subway, it’s very convenient. Everything went perfect with the hotel, the room is quite confortable and the other clients were very silent and respectful. Krisnauris, Bobby and all staff are doing their best to make clients to feel happy. So in general we are very happy to stay at the James Soho and hope to come back again in the near future.
Thank you
Murat Gezgin

title: great spot to visit
text: I stayed at this property for one night.  Immediately upon entry I was greeted by Kenny.  Not only was he hospitable but also noticed when the front desk forgot to check me into the open rooms they had.  He went out of his way to bring my bags to my room, offered me a bottle of wine on the house, and a drink ticket for the rooftop bar.  Kenny made up for the front desk’s initial mistake which impressed me.  Not only was Kenny a rockstar but Eric, also at the entry doors, gave great service.  I was already checked in but was waiting for my Uber to head to an interview around 4:30pm on a Wednesday.  I’m from out of town so once Eric knew I had to be somewhere at a specific time, he went the extra mile and hailed me a cab to make sure I was where I needed to be on time.  Eric and Kenny were the MVPs of the visit however everyone at the hotel was kind and accommodating.  Mistakes happen so I won’t hold that against the property or the front desk staff, just pointing out what I noticed.  The hotel was clean and had a beautiful rooftop.  I highly recommend the property if you’re looking to stay in SoHo!

title: Staycation
text: Choose the James for a city staycation coming from long island. The hotel was in a perfect location and has a great rooftop. The best part was the staff. Everyone was super friendly and Kristina had amazing recommendations for local restaurants and midtown suggestions after our Broadway show.

title: Real NYC Treat
text:
My lady and I decided to take a staycation. Since I'm new in the city, both Reddit and my brother told me to go to the James because they have a cool bar and a great restaurant. As soon as I arrived, I was sold. The place is a bit hip and comfy. The beds are big and soft. And don't get me started on the service. Huge shout out to Bobby and Natalie for the extra bit of hospitality. They even saved us cookies because we missed the cookie social. Can't wait to try the yoga tomorrow morning.

Thanks James Hotel. Definitely going to make this our little gem in the city.

title: Unforgettable night with The James!
text:
I had an awesome experience staying at The James Soho Hotel. Kristina Perez, Executive Office Manager was extremely kind and professional, who went above and beyond to provide me the best experience with her personal touch! Kristina also did a tremendous upgrade with a corner king unit room for my 4th anniversary with my girlfriend. The view was amazing and had a very romantic night with big skyline. I would highly recommend to family and friends. 
Thank you Kristina for the unforgettable night with The James!

title: NYC Visit
text: Check-in staff was very nice and accommodating. I had requested early check in, which I understood was not a guarantee. I was texted that my room was ready two hours after 3pm (the normal check in time). The service and help at the pool on Sunday was non-existent. I was not the only person who felt that way because I heard other guests complaining as well. I understand you all do the pool parties starting at 3pm but for paying hotel guests there needs to be service and help at the pool. Lastly, there was very loud construction above my room on early Sunday morning and early afternoon when I was in my room. It was almost unbearable.

title: Amazing
text:
We want to make a special mention of two outstanding employees that made my hotel experience amazing....Leidy and Natalie at the front desk. Best customer service I’ve ever received! This hotel is absolutely beautiful.  Stunning views from the rooftop pool. Looking at the Freedom Tower   was stunning!  Mike at the pool was so great and courteous and always had a smile on his face. 
Can’t wait to come back!! Overall experience was AMAZING!

title: Great place to stay!
text: Loved my stay and was even upgraded to the amazing studio room! I fell in love with the view and the shower.  Bed was quite comfortable and though the room was small but NY small. The lobby is quaint love the coffee and treats in the am and the wine in the evening.

title: Dirty
text: My husband booked this hotel for my birthday and we ended up leaving, we were SO disappointed. The room was dirty, the reception desk is falling apart, the guy behind reception referred to me as 'she' and only spoke to my husband when we were checking in (will 'she' have a key to the room'). The pool, is tiny and the surrounding area stinks of spilt old booze. The lift system is ridiculously slow. Thankfully they agreed to refund us and were able to stay elsewhere to celebrate my birthday.

title: Friendly staff and good location
text: Natalie at the front desk was superb at our arrival, she upgraded us and was very warm and inviting, the pool arrangements could have been better, however, overall we had a nice time..Everybody in the hotel was friendly

title: Oasis in Soho
text: Fantastic position in Soho - near to everything we wanted to do and see. Very quiet room and very helpful friendly staff. Quick to deal with any questions and good on the area. Didn’t eat there so not sure on food, but only because so many outside options that we wanted to try.

title: bad stay
text: great location but poor standards. Badly needs a refurbishment. Serious disconnection with the restaurant. Staff were friendly. Room fittings were a big issue. Security at the entrance was adhoc. I wont be staying there again

title: Great location but needs to correct some kinks!
text: The location is terrific and love rooftop pool. Bellboy was not available upon arrival and departure. Asked for towels and they were never received. Someone charged $200 on my room without my knowledge nor did I sign a receipt. I also received a charged for a candy bar that was never taken from the room bar. It took a while to rectify these charges and I was late for an event. They need to work on better customer service and accountability.

title: Dov
text:
Great stay. Very clean, modern. Super spacious for nyc and can’t beat the area if you like downtown. One of the few cool rooftops in nyc with a pool. 

Bobby at the front desk was super helpful and we could text a number for any of our needs. Definitely staying there again

title: The best Experience
text: Impressive and Super Chic Hotel. The Rooftop Pool becomes an open Bar at 3pm- Booby at Reception was beyond helpful and friendly, one of the best customer service I have received at Any hotel. The Room was simply amazing. Highly recommended.

title: Great SoHo experience
text:
The James is a chic modern hotel right in SoHo and close to TriBeCa. Warmly greeted by Bobby at the front desk who upgraded me to an amazing suite with walls of windows looking over the city. 

Great room service too. 

K

title: The James SOHO Hospitality
text: I often stay at the James in Soho whenever I'm in NYC and I always enjoy my stay. I was able to receive some great help from Bobby & Kris as they were very accommodating during my most recent visit. The place is super lowkey and the location couldn't be better.

title: Great Getaway
text: The James Soho is a terrific location on the edge of Soho, with the plus of a great rooftop bar, Jimmy's, with stunning Manhattan views of the Freedom Tower and the Hudson River.  We arrived late and were thrilled to be upgraded to our corner room by Bobby. There is a small but well equipped gym with that great view and the lobby had coffee and yummy scones in the morning followed by fruit and minty water later in the day.

title: Hotel design ideally located to discover NY
text:
Hotel design with great comfort, near subway downtown or uptown,
Services were good, especially the Internet connection,
Friendly and competent staff,
Situated in the lively district,
Nearby restaurants.

title: Amazing
text:
Excellente adresse à New York - SOHO.
Accueil d’une rare gentillesse, tout spécialement Leidy souriante, aimable et surtout, efficace. Les chambres sont spacieuses, confortables et la vue sur New York époustouflante. A ne pas manquer, la piscine sur le roof top mais surtout le bar au coucher du soleil...gorgeous comme on dit ici.

title: A modern little gem!
text:
Although I now live in NYC, I decided to treat us to a little get away in Soho. 

I was checking out hotels online and came across this little gem. 

Very reasonable price, modern rooms, great location and the roof top pool was a great little bonus. 

Upon arrival Bobby at front desk was great. Very friendly and offered us a glass of wine. The room that was given to us was the 'Stage' room. Lovely as it had views of the Hudson.

When we checked out Bobby and Kris at front desk were extremely accommodating and friendly.

Great stay and well worth checking this hotel out.

title: Website information is misleading
text: Website information is misleading.  There is no David Burke restaurant.  The insulation is horrible.  You could hear the music from the rooftop bar from the 14-17 floors.  The grout at the shower door was not cleaned.  I could hear slamming doors from other rooms and housekeeping closet door.  This location is not classy like the one in Chicago.

title: Is it a hotel or a nightclub?
text:
I stayed here for a long weekend with my husband and two sons (Aged 18 and 20).

The reasons we chose this hotel was its location (which didn’t disappoint) and the roof top pool.  The general daytime atmosphere of the hotel is friendly enough and the rooms and public areas are bright and clean.  

The first disappointment we encountered was that the pool was closed every day at 4 so they coulld prep the area ready for evening when it became a roof top bar area for over 21s only (residents and non-residents).  From 5 pm the vibe of the hotel changed completely with all these bouncers everywhere who came across as quite intimidating.  

This applies to the downstairs bar areas too. I don’t mind an edgy vibe but unfortunately, this was more seedy than edgy.

With regards to the rest of the facilities, as I said room was nice. Housekeeping were a bit sloppy with replenishing cups and other tea/coffee supplies but towels and other guest amenities were well stocked.  Room service food was simple but tasty. 

Gym was good and the complimentary wine available in the lobby during happy hour was most enjoyable. 

They could do with a better breakfast option.  Coffee flasks and pastries in the lobby doesn’t really cut it.  However, they did have a number of restaurants across the road and next door that was part of the hotel but again it just seemed a bit dark and nightclub like. Thankfully because of the location there were plenty of great places to eat within a few minutes walk.

Eric the concierge was very friendly as were the receptionists but other staff members like some of the bar tenders were a bit to cool to be friendly.

title: An amazing place :)
text: Wow, what an amazing place, I saw Quavo from Migos on my way in, so dope! Amazing staff, and beds! Perfect location, absolute dream! Must stay! And Chris was such a delightful host, made my welcoming special :) cheers!

title: New York’s Staycation
text: Best accommodations. Amazing customer service. Clean and comfortable rooms. Thank you sooooo much Natalie for being so amazing and helping to make my husbands birthday special!!!! As soon as I walked into the front entrance the warm welcome and hospitality was amazing!

title: Great service, automatic upgrade on arrival.
text: The hotel is a luxury experience from start to finish. Stunning views of tribeca from the roof top pool. Rooms are chic and well maintained. Staff is 100% professional.  Free wine upon arrival. Great roof bar. Very nice restaurant on 1st floor.

title: We LOVE the James!
text:
We switched hotels at the end of our trip and couldn’t be any more happier! The concierge Bobby, was super helpful when we arrived and offered a glass of wine or water while we waited to check in. The hotel is beautiful and we ended up with a corner room overlooking the beautiful city! We will ONLY stay at the James when we visit SOHO again. 
Thank you!

title: The Groovy James
text: I found several of the components of this hotel to be excellent and others to be disappointing.  The Jungle Room Restaurant is fantastic, the staff is fantastic, but the "deluxe" room was tiny (which is always a risk in NYC).  The bathrooms are sufficient, but the lighting is very low and there is no makeup mirror, the shampoo and bath amenities are very masculine, and there are no extra towels. I must say that the towels are generously sized which is my usual mark of a nice bathroom.  In general, I think the hotel was fine, but there is no breakfast option and it may just be too groovy for me.  The other guests in the hotel did not seem like business travelers.

title: Fabulous Customer Service & Amenities
text: This is our first time at The James and we couldn’t be more pleased! The hotel is beautifully decorated, but the customer service is what sets it apart. We appreciate all Bobby has done to make our stay amazing, from checking us in to providing personalized restaurant recommendations. The hotel has great amenities including a wine and cheese hour (and cookies for my pregnant wife)! Highly recommend.

title: Great service
text: Kris was very professional at check in offered us wine definitely a great expected service. Amenities in sky lobby are very convenient specially wine hour. The rooftop view is very nice. Definitely worth it.

title: Great welcome
text: Very friendly and professional welcome at the check-in. @Kris: you are awesome. Thank you. The room was made available much faster than expected during my delicious lunch next door in this fantastic neighborhood.

title: Magnifique,Magique,extra!!
text:
C est juste un hôtel génial !! Les gens sont adorables, les chambres somptueuses avec une superbe vue,le lit et les coussins hyper confortables et la situation est exceptionnelle : 2 pas du métro, les boutiques de Soho, les restaurants, l ambiance au tour font de cet endroit un cadre exceptionnel pour un endroit de rêve !!
Allez... petit bémol la piscine est très petite mais donne la chance de se détendre, et les horaires trop courts :16h fermeture pour laisser la place au bar du roof !!
Sinon c est sur :j y reviendrais les yeux fermés !!
Merci !

title: Overall good
text: No towels at the pool.. said they would bring one but never did, very small pool with very limited seating. Bartender not helpful or friendly but other than that the front desk staff was great and the room was great

title: Frank C Anniversary
text: The staff here is very friendly and knowledgeable! When we pulled up, Paul was waiting to take our luggage. He was very helpful the three days we were there. The front desk staff is awesome! Thanks again!!!

title: Exceptional service and unparalleled views - Highly recommend!
text: I highly recommend this hotel. Natalie and Kris were wonderful at Check In and made the process easy and efficient. I appreciated their efforts to accommodate my requests. They really went above and beyond to make sure I was happy with my experience. Traveling so much for work, you stay at a lot of luxury and mid-range properties, and not always is it a personal experience. Hence, I truly value the energy of a place where the staff seems genuinely caring and thoughtful. Even the gentlemen who helped with my suitcases where enthusiastic and kind. Great vibe from the whole staff I interacted with which is rare these days :) The property is beautiful, super modern with a design aesthetic a bit artsy and cool. The room has spectacular views, huge windows, and is a great size. Overall I was very happy with my stay and would stay here again!

title: Great customer service
text: Leidy and Yami were amazing my whole stay.  They were able to answer all my questions quickly and professionally.  Their customer service is fantastic and look forward to my next stay at The James SoHo.

title: Amazing Time
text: I had an amazing experience at the James. The staff was so polite and very accommodating, especially Bobby (Thank you). The vibe and location cannot be beat, simply the best! I will definitely be staying here again very soon!

title: Great contemporary hotel in amazing location
text:
I absolutely loved my stay.  It was an extremely hot weekend in NYC so I booked a room to enjoy the rooftop pool and, boy, it didn't disappoint.  Lively and friendly crowd at the pool with witnesses coming around every few minutes to see if you needed anything.  Most amazing views from the rooftop pool was worth every penny!

Upon checking in Natalie at the front desk warmly welcomed me and took it upon herself to upgrade me to a large corner King room knowing I was there for a solo staycation.  She remembered my name the next day which made my stay even more memorable.  

Not only the hotel was beautiful but you can't beat the location!  When I'm back in town next I'll be staying at this property.

title: Great hospitality!
text: Beautiful place - quick and easy check in, large and comfortable room - a great stay! Bobby was a terrific host the entire time - so helpful and welcoming. Beautiful pool on the rooftop. Great view from the room too!

title: Was hoping for better !
text: Somewhat well located, small rooms, tiny pool - always packed, rooftop bar in not such great shape, an expensive service/hotel fee. I can’t say that I can’t wait to go back. One great thing though were the pillows.

title: Great Location, staff and atmosphere
text: The James is located in a great neighborhood and provided excellent customer service by Leidy. The rooms were comfortable and we enjoyed a drink at the Jimmy rooftop bar as well with gorgeous views. I will definitely be back!

title: James Hotel
text: Nice big Corner King Studio.  Close to bars and restaurants and great views. The doorman was very helpful, had a car waiting for us for the airport and when we were out and about even provided an umbrella (without me asking) when it was raining.

title: Awesome place, friendly staff!
text: Love it here. The two girls at the front desk, Leidy and Kris, upgraded me to a nicer room for free- and with a smile! All the staff is accommodating and helpful, would definitely stay here again. And they have a wonderful rooftop bar and pool!

title: never again
text: don't stay there on Saturday nights. they should let you know that the pool/bar area will be a loud packed dance club. it is not worth the money. they need to let the guests know that the pool will not be available on Saturday nights.

title: Average.
text: The James Hotel is an average hotel with above average prices. I would not pay that much to stay in a hotel of this standard. The initial receptionist I had on check in way rude to say the least. The only staff member who was INCREDIBLE was the man who came to give me my breakfast each morning, I must say he was a breath of fresh air :)

title: Never again!
text: Refurbish your bar. Change Bellman. Sort out safe place for luggage storage. We were late to Airport because our car did not wait while your staff was Searching our stored luggage. Very unprofessional. Did cause extra costs to Order new Airport transfer!

title: New York hotel
text: Great hotel. Nice clean rooms. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Beautiful roof top pool with bar. Very conveniently situated right near to canal street and close to downtown shopping and amenities

title: Friendly and convenient
text:
I am really happy with this little hotel in SoHo. Staff are very friendly and helpful and also the valet service is good. Rooms are on the small side but perfectly formed with a small bathroom with “view” from the shower and heated floor that is really nice in the morning. After so many disappointments with NY hotels and the fact that you pay extra money for a city view and the view is utterly disappointing this time I didn’t pay extra and of course I got...an amazing city view!
Location is perfect: Downtown NY and walking distance to the shopping district (Spring Street and Mercer Street and Broadway). I think that I have finally found the right place for me in NYC!

title: Kris and natalie
text: Excellent service. Clean rooms. I’ll defiantly recommend it. Rooftop was very beautiful service was amazing from Natalie and kris. Will defenetly return. Close to shopping areas amenities at the James club very convenient and perfect

title: Great 30th Birthday Trip
text: I had a read a few reviews prior to coming and was apprehensive at first however my experience was amazing. We arrived really late at night just gone midnight and we were greeted by a lovely gentlemen who checked us in and wished me a happy birthday. The hotel was clean on first impressions and although when we got in the lift to go to our room there were two slightly intoxicated guys inside who had mad their way down from the rooftop bar they were swiftly escorted out by staff with no fuss at all. we were on a high floor quite close to the bar and I only heard any noise when in the lift which was to be expected. I was greeted by some wine in my room as a birthday gift and the views were AMAZING. the room was stylish and clean and the bed was so so comfy! I went to the pool next day and it was clean and the beds were lovely. I stayed there for a few hours and it didn't get overly busy! the lifts were fine to use also even in the evening, I didn't find any guests of the bar were prioritised over hotel guests, infact I found they made sure hotel guests got good use of the elevators in amongst the bar crowd. The staff were continuously helpful and very very friendly always making sure we were being well catered for. the hotel location is excellent with a metro to most places right outside. watching sunrise and sunset from my window over downtown new York was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and for the negative reviews I didn't experience any of them.

title: Great experience, very friendly staff
text:
Very good experience. Thanks to very friendly and service oriented staff. This is a nicely designed hotel and comfortable rooms.
The only caveat is the closing of the pool at 4pm to prepare the night activity.

title: Amazing hotel
text: Would definitely recommend The James, loved the rooftop bar although the pool is quite small and can get quite busy - the views make up for the rest.  Great location in Soho, I walked most places.  The complimentary cheese and wine in the afternoons in reception was a nice touch.

title: Great great customer service
text:
Amazing people working there. Great service. I booked 7 nights through booking but had to shorten stay. Was supposed to pay 300 usd cancellation fee when I read my booking conditions. But the manager Terrell just voided them and gave me vouchers for drinks on rooftop because I was engaged this week.
Highly recommend to stay in this hotel.
Great location.
Great rooftop.

title: James Hotel Soho
text: Excellent Hotel in Soho surrounded by great restaurants and shopping. The staff were so helpful and friendly especially the manager Johnny, Bobby, Eric and all the great staff at the front door. Pool was fantastic during the NYC summer and the complimentary rooftop yoga was amazing!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Top-notched customer service! Staff was amazing! View of the rooftop is beautiful. The room was nice and cozy and the bed was comfortable, couldn’t ask for a better hotel! Thank you Bobby, Lamine and the staff at James Soho for the amazing experience! :)

title: AMAZING - best hotel in Manhattan
text: Shout out to Kris - Best customer service I’ve ever received! This hotel is absolutely beautiful and in an awesome location. Stunning views! Refreshing pool! Amazing staff!  Convenient location! Defiantly coming back

title: 50th Surprise party
text: Upon arrive the staff was wonderfully helpful, attentive and kind. They were the the highlight of our weekend stay .  They cleanliness of the common areas were average especially during the nighttime club hours. Definitely hard to keep up with the youth crowd I am sure. Rooms were clean but average ... although we had an amazing view of the Freedom Tower

title: Great stay for work trip
text: I stayed at The James this past week for work and had a room overlooking 6th Ave. The floor to ceiling windows in my room and throughout the hotel made for a bright and open environment. I highly recommend this hotel for those who are traveling for work. The location of the hotel is super convenient and close to many good restaurants (shoutout to the Sola Pasta Bar thats one block over). The wifi was consistent throughout my stay here. I loved the carafe of filtered water and the shower that gets hot immediately. The entire staff at all levels were extremely friendly, warm and welcoming. Bobby and Natalie were super great at reception and texting to check in with how my stay was going. They also have rooftop yoga thursday mornings. The hotel provided mats and the view and the experience was incredible. I highly recommend and am definitely planning on coming back here again!

title: Tourist trip with daughter
text: Really enjoyed the staff, the morning coffee, the room temp, shower, great bed. Timely room clean up and well done. Location was ideal between battery park and Central Park. Soho is delightful with everything you need!

title: Overall. Great experience.
text:
I stay at a lot of hotels in Manhattan, and I have to say, I was pleasantly surprised by the James Soho. 

Natalie checked us in, she was fantastic. Even checking up on us during our stay via text to make sure everything was perfect. 
She was great - As was Eric at the front door.

The friendliness and accommodating attitude was certainly on par with the “real” five star hotels I’ve stayed at in the past.

It is a nice size hotel with a boutique feel. Great location. They do not nickel and dime. Free coffee and scones in the morning ,  chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon ,water and fruit all day , free morning paper - all wonderful touch’s. We even got an unsolicited bottle of wine waiting in a room for anniversary. Classy.

Rooftop Pool is great. Although drinks were get up and DIY. No biggie, just for $20 a drink , i would’ve expected some wait service.  Other than that,  an amazing perk to have in the summer. 

The only tip would be - avoid the noise on the 17th floor due to the workers setting up for the club upstairs. If you are adverse to noise, skip the 17th. 

Corner king was amazing (1708) but I assume there is not a bad room in the house. 

Overall, fantastic stay, pleasantly surprised. Would definitely stay there again. 

James staff. Kudos!

title: Amazing experience and great staff¡
text: I have very much enjoyed staying at the James. It’s a boutique hotel with excellent location -at the core of Soho-. The views are simply gorgeous. The hotel is very elegant and has a fantastic interior design. We have very much loved the experience, The staff has been very kind, helpful, arranging various requests for us. I want to thank Kris, Eric, the pool people. Finally, during the summer the pool and rooftop are highly recommended.

title: Birthday Bash
text: The Staff at The James is excellent, smiles, warm and welcoming - something you would expect at Disney, but not necessarily in NYC. loved it! Great location, so much to do and see.  Only draw back , while it awesome there is a rooftop pool - it's very, very small with limited chairs.

title: Loved The James!
text:
Our family met here for a NYC trip and mini-reunion.  We had 3 rooms. Loved the location of The JAMES, the staff was amazing, enjoyed the snacks, tea & coffee, wine & cheese they provided daily.  Very comfy beds, clean rooms, great shower! Staff provided us with an early check-in & late check-out!
Great amenities and helpful staff! Will definitely return!

title: Amazing stay
text: Me and my girlfriends stayed at the hotel and only went there for the jimmy rooftop pool . We arrived after the guest pool hours however , Natalie was so amazing. She check on us at the lobby and Offered us a bottle of wine for my friends and I while we waited for the room to be ready. Once we went to our rooms she called after to make sure our stay was going well . Thank you for your amazing service.

title: Good times are in the past
text:
We we’re for the I think fourth time during last 4-5 years in the James and were honestly disappointed. Location is still super and it is obviously still quite hip to be there, but I think service has deteriorated a lot and no sign of any renovation in the hotel. 
We had to ask every afternoon again for second blanket, as the one we got in the evening was taken by cleaning away again. I asked for a car to take me to Brooklyn and guys downstairs (wouldn’t call them concierges) got me one and I ended up paying 40% more then with Uber Black (which stupid me as a tourist haven’t considered in the first place) and so on...
Staff is the least not well trained. It seems to me, that the hotel is managed as an asset to be worked out and more emphasis is on the evening parties on the top floor. 
But do you really need to sleep at a party place - we won’t do that anymore...

title: Good Location
text: Hotel was in a great location. It's modern and comfortable. Staff are helpful and the rooftop bar is amazing. My only negative is that the rooms, although tidy and clean, are way too small. Ok  for a professional business trip but too small for a family holiday.

title: The James Staff were Wonderfull
text: The James made me feel at home from the moment I walked in. Natalie checked me and remember my name from the moment I checked out . The front desk managers and bellman was so friendly . Thank again for such an amazing experience .

title: Wedding anniversary
text: Wow the James soho hotel was literally nothing like I expected . I’m a Marriott rewards member and the James hotel exceeded my expectations . I came here to celebrating my wedding anniversary with my husband and it was amazing . Natalie greeted me at check in and she was so friendly and kind offered us a bottle of wine, an upgrade to a corner king skyline view. The pool small but nice . Thanks for such an amazing ‘modern-experience.

title: Natalie
text: On Monday Natalie Lazarus was really great to me she gave me a complimentary drink to go up jimmys for me and my wife’s wedding and made my stay really really sweet ! I will be back soon beautiful hotel

title: Amazing staff and view
text: the jimmys has a nice rooftop bar... I recommend 21 and older...every time I came into the hotel whether it was to go to my room the front door staff was very kind... especially Natalie she smiled every time and asked if I need anything at all and made sure my stay was amazing thanks to her and to the James hotel you guys ROCK!!!

title: Great Service
text: I had to book a week-long reservation the night of and Terrill, Front Office Manager, went above and beyond to make some changes to my reservation and accommodate my needs. I'd previously encountered a relatively snippy agent from the reservations department when met with my last-minute request, for which he was apologetic. Knowing the team is willing to be flexible and work with you has cemented my trust in the property. Thank you again, Terrill!

title: Check your dates before booking!
text:
Everyone at the hotel was nice--there were no issues with hospitality from that perspective, however I got a sense of chaos from the staff because elevators were broken and there was a pool party when we arrived. Upon check-in they told us that the pool closes at 2pm and opens for a pool party to the public at 3pm--I wish this would have been communicated with us prior. We booked the hotel for the rooftop pool, and check in isn't until 3pm. 

That being said they did work to get us in to a room early. Their elevator situation was not handled well and there were no backups in case of emergency. I could even get down to the lobby because pool party guests were in the elevators.

title: Great Hotel
text: This is an excellent hotel and location for us when we visit with family. This visit we did have a small issue with the TV in the room. My husband called the desk and a maintaince person was immediately dispached to our room. He was prompt and courteous quickly resolving the problem (user issue lol). We love staying here.

title: Amazing Stay
text: I checked in an was immediately greeted by an warm and friendly smile by Natalie at the front desk . She was amazing and even offered me a bottle a bottle of wine when I arrive after the wine and cheese hour. I would definitely return. Thank you Natalie for the memorable stay and offering me one of the most amazing Corner King Skyline rooms.

title: Great stay
text:
We stay at the hotel for the weekend .
The hotel location is great the roof top fool is very nice, it was for the hotel guests only until 2pm and then was open to the public.
The room had great view and it was clean.

title: Great Stay
text: Great Stay , very helpful, comfortable stay, great hospitality and everytomd there was kind , and friendly. Somewhere I could definitely see myself staying at once again. Beautiful view and great location.

title: Front Desk Hospitality
text: I had the pleasure of checking in with Natalie.  She was extremely accommodating and kind.  She even remembered me from my first visit to The James.  What a pleasure to arrive to such a warm welcome.  Thank you Natalie!

title: Amazing Amazing Amazing
text: Rooms were sparkling clean, staff so friendly and accommodating the food was amazing. I felt at home the minute I walked in. Was greeted when I walked in by crystal perez who advised me of all the best places to visit and things to do in the amazing NYC. Will definitely visit again in the future and highly recommend to anyone interested.

title: Regrets....I have a few.
text:
I just left The James SoHo and I have to admit, it was not my best stay in New York. First off, I reserved for two other couples and myself and got charged the first night for all three rooms, before we even left home.  Even though rooms were identified by my friends names. Really nice apology by front desk person upon check in, then he proceeded to charge my friends full stay on my card! While she was standing there holding her credit card! 
Nice apology by manager, though. Now I have about $4,000 in charges on my credit card for 3-5 days while they reverse it. 
If you’re wanting your room to be cleaned around 5:00 pm, no matter what time you leave in the morning, this is the hotel for you! Oh, front desk says to ask for someone to come earlier in the day...every day! Guess there’s no guest notes or preferences. 
Nice coffee amenity in the morning in lobby but it’s usually empty. Nice wine amenity in lobby at 5:00 pm but there are no glasses and bottles are mostly already empty. 
If you want breakfast in hotel, it has to be room service because there is NO restaurant here. 
Pillows are like rocks. You can request down pillows but for some reason they will be removed every day so we all had to keep requesting them again. 
If you enjoy paying a lot for great location but zero service this is the hotel for you! And be sure you check out the pay first, stay after policy because they are the winners take all when it comes to this! 
So enjoy your stay! I did not, sadly.

title: Nice, but Not Worth the Price
text: I did like the hotel overall, all the staff we encountered were genuinely nice (except maybe the bouncer). However, for ~$500/night for a weekend night it was just not worth it, especially because we couldn't even enjoy the pool the one night we were there (we did enjoy it in the AM although the water was a little cloudy) and our room view was not that great either. We came back to the hotel late that night and wanted to go up and just enjoy the view, but the bouncer wouldn't let us up as it was 1:45am and I guess it closes at 2am. We were hoping to at least be able to sit in the restaurant/bar area to enjoy the view at night for a few minutes. Oh well. The location is nice and walking distance to some good food and shopping, but I probably wouldn't stay here again unless the price came down.

title: Michell Lyons
text: I would highly recommend going to st James hotel. I was visiting there for one night due to a very bad experience at a previous hotel the night before. My fiancé was visiting me from out of town. And kris the receptionist was beyond welcoming! She not only greeted  us with a cheerful manor but instantly accommodated us to right the wrong of the other hotel. We was only staying o e night and she upgraded our room to s penthouse. This hotel interior and exterior was amazing. I will be staying again real soon . Thank you kris

title: Front Desk
text: Perfect check in ! Natalie a great help to me and guest, she’s awesome she makes the stay more welcoming ! Rooftop bar is amazing with nice views . Wine and cheese was delicious . Thank you for provide me with an amazing upgrade.

title: Not great at changing light bulbs, fixing sink or making sure key cards work
text: I thought the hotel was very pretty and in a good spot.  I had a hard time making the key card work on multiple occasions.  My sink didn't work and told them as I was leaving for work it was not fixed after I came back at 6pm.  There were light bulbs that needed changing in my room that again were not changed and I had to call the front desk numerous times.  Not my favorite place to stay because they seemed like they just didn't care about the guests at all.

title: Misleading Online Marketing
text: Online information regarding this hotel is very misleading, rooms are extremely small, old, dirty.  Pool is 3' 11" deep and the size of a larger bathtub, pool deck is extremely small and not family friendly. Little to no meeting/gathering space or food option, 1 hotel restaurant that is open limited hours without breakfast.  Very odd arrangement between entry to hotel, abandoned floors, etc.  Would not recommend, much better places to stay in SOHO.

title: Just ok
text: Had a 2 night stay- the shower bulb was broken. We reported the issue right away but no help was provided. Requested a roll away bed - turn it had an extra surcharge of $40. Took us a while to adjust - for the amount we paid for the skyline view - we were provided a room on the 10th floor..

title: Great Visit!
text: The James is in the PERFECT location! China Town, Little Italy, & Subway stops right around the corner.  James the concierge was very helpful with directions and recommendations! Stop in the Soho Market on the corner.

title: Dont use this hotel if u need late check out..
text:
Went for a three day mini trip with my 16 year old daughter.
Been here before but hotel has got tired.
Great location as it easy to get uptown or downtown.
Also near major building..empire state, Madison sq garden etc.
Had a 1 bed suite.
The rooms are good size for NYC.
The concierge are very efficient.
We arrived and our rooms was not ready.
The front desk(reception) where quite rude and almost to the point useless.
So we left our luggage anyway went off.
Come back same miserable check girl was there o great...
Anyway got key move on.
So you have a nice room and the shower are good with all normal toiletries you expect.
Didn't eat in hotel.
There is a small lobby with seats which supplies water and tea coffee which is ok.
Like I said didn't eat in hotel so had little day to day with the staff.
But I asked reception if we could check out later as we had a 10 pm flight to make the most of the day.
So the reception gave me a blank no.
I would pay 99 usd to stay to 4 pm. But I needed the room more to 7 pm.
No.
Fully booked.
I checked web site.. it showed available room.
All we need was to have a shower at the end of a steaming hot day.
 I ask if I can use a room or if they have  changing area for shower.
Again no.
There is a toilet downstairs...
Which is used for the bar area customers.
So not ideal. Only sink and toilets. So I had to get changed in the foyer outside. Not great for a 16 year old.
So when I left I thought never use this hotel again 
Terrible attitude and quite rude.
Plenty hotel in nyc to use.
So would definitely not recommend this hotel now days.
Shame.
Going NYC couple more times this year will use hotel that actually help their client's.
Thanks for nothing James hotel.
How to spoil 16 years first trip to New York.

title: Nice location
text: Perfect location and nice area to be when you are sightseeing in New York.  Close to the west side of Manhattan were you can take Morning walk and running. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Specially the door keeper.

title: Such a fun place!!
text: The moment we walked in being greeted by Kenny who escorted us up to Natalia to check we felt at like we were on vacation!!! Have to check out the roof, we lounged during the day and partied at night!! ..... P.S. the coffee in the lobby save us both mornings we were there!!

title: Perfect location- don't expect great service
text:
People are clearly choosing the James Soho for its location and great par/ rooftop pool, and they are right. The bar is really cool and so is the rooftop during summer. 
Location is also very good, in the middle of Soho, near cool restaurants and shops.
That being said, the service is far from being great, the internet connection was terrible, and the room was not as clean as expected, a lot of dust in the corners...
So if you're looking for a hype hotel , well located go there! But dont expect great service...

title: Amazing place to stay
text: Here for our dress fitting with all the girls and the start began with an amazing welcoming at front desk with Kris , great energy , so personable and so detailed going through everything there is to offer at the hotel and surrounding areas! I don’t think she missed a thing and also the front desk manager Terrilll was so welcoming and on top of everything , making sure everything was perfect for us .The hotel is absolutely beautiful and great vibe on rooftop with Dj!

title: Modern Hotel with a Friendly Staff
text: I stayed for one night and was upgraded to a room with an amazing view. The hotel gets the little details right with complimentary water in the room and coffee/scones in the lobby. The staff is also great — especially Bobby who checked me in!

title: Rude employees
text: Employees at the check in desk were extremely rude and disrespectful. Both clearly had no idea what they were doing and were the reason that I will not be coming back/recommending this hotel to anyone.

title: Good location but rooms and corridors starting to look worn out
text:
Our corner studio had nice views of the One World and was surprisingly quiet despite us being only on the 5th floor. The set-up of the rooms are nice and I always prefer a hardwood floor over carpeting. The room itself was just showing wear and tear, bathroom sink clogged etc. 

The Jimmy (the rooftop) is a plus and fun to visit at night.

title: Birthday Stay
text: I had a great time! Had a great night and invited friends up to the pool for birthday festivities. Highly recommend! Drinks are expesnsive, breakfast included with my stay was not noteworthy - but I otherwise had a great time.

title: One of my favorite NYC hotels
text: The James is an iconic NYC hotel I've stayed at several times, but recently I had an especially great visit. I went for a work trip and Natalie at the front desk was INCREDIBLY nice. She looked after my bags, let me order room service to the lobby when the room was taking a while to be prepared, and then upgraded me to a much nicer room on a quieter floor with striking views of NYC. Big thumbs up for service and for natalie in particular.

title: Do not bother
text: this place is a mess.  unorganized.  not clean.  check in process is a nightmare.  nobody has one clue as to what they're doing.  they do not change the beds daily.  it's overpriced.  the lamp shades are falling apart.

title: special escape
text: Great atmosphere, super clean rooms, very decorative and modern and staff are very friendly. there is a pool a roof top, great breakfast. we got a full package for great price. We will be definitely coming back.

title: "Fun" appearance on the outside. Uninhabitable on the inside.
text:
I regret not reading through other reviews outside of five-stars lucky enough to receive night-and-day service from what we felt was very absent service, and terrible value.

As others have noted experiencing, our main issues were: sound, price, value, and issues with guest staff.

We looked forward to having a great time at the pool and bar, especially since we paid the SoHo fee they said enabled them to provide complimentary cocktails. No one we spoke to could give us a straight answer on how to get them. One gentleman (we'll call him G, since providing names isn't one of James Hotel's strong suits) said we'd have to purchase a platter. Nothing in the booking said we had to purchase anything to receive the free welcome cocktail. In fact, the $40/night fee was paired with them saying we'd get a few things in return (that we never did).
Funnily, G was standing right next to another person (manager?) after we brought it (and other items) to their intention. The manager said we were misinformed. When we noted the person standing right next to him literally just told us about the required pre-purchase, G just looked away and shrugged his shoulders.

For the price, the room is very small even by NYC standards. While it notes floor to ceiling windows, they mean feet-above-the-floor-to-ceiling. Which is probably a good thing, considering they have the worst sound insulation (if any) of any place in NYC.  The old surge protector on the night stand and randomly unplugged devices (lamp, iHome) were a nice touch. Do not go by what you see in the pictures.

We were excited about the idea of hitting the pool. Maybe we accidentally booked on a birthday for teenagers, but it was hardly possible when even getting to our *room* was met with battling the crowds of teens / kids? on the elevators. There was a female apparently trying to operate the elevators, and she let us on eventually when the pool party attendants were set. So nice of them to let guests into their rooms!
Had hoped for a more mature, fun bar pool setting versus what felt like an open pool in the middle of the day for teenagers, but that's not necessarily the hotel's fault. I understand that the pool/ bar area aren't the responsibility of the hotel (they made that abundantly clear when we addressed some of the issues with them). 

Ultimately, the noise became unbearable. We tolerated the first night because we checked in so late. The noise was especially intense late evening. We recorded what sounds like grinding and shifting. The second night added sounds of glasses dropping and scratching. Hoping it was just from construction or the bar and would fade, it actually woke us up the next morning.

When we brought some of the issues we had in the evening, the manager said he was sorry, that they couldn't control what happened with the bar or other noise. During construction, hotels usually provide earplugs or a warning. At the James, it's apparently just not their issue. To the manager's credit, he did offer to upgrade us when we said we planned to leave (we were scheduled to stay for 3 additional days). But at that point, the noise was only one of a variety of issues. We checked out first thing the next morning (thanks, early AM noises, for making sure of that!).

I almost raised the review to two-stars, because our last experience with the hotel was with a doorman we hadn't seen at that point, who was polite, prompt, and helpfully opened the doors for us and assisted with our luggage as we left. We told him that alone was night and day from everything else we'd received.

The total cost for two nights was almost $1000. For that much, we could have stayed on Park Ave. with better food, better bars, no kids, no noise, and better entertainment. In fact, we got all of that at the next hotel for (much) less near Park Ave!

If it weren't for the room making such a terrible first impression, and various staff (especially G) giving us the runaround, we might have stayed through our scheduled booking. Of course there will be weekends where noise and non-guests will be a factor in any hotel, especially one that's open to the public. But the cost, lack of ownership by (most, not all) of the staff, and lack of amenities just don't add up.

title: Good location but not a real rooftop
text:
The hotel is very well situated but it has a big default and it was a big disppointement  : the roof top and the pool close very early (2pm in the we and 4pm in the week) for "parties". When you have children and teens you have no access it's really a pity for the price and because the view is beautiful from there. 
No breakfast service only room service expeansive and not taken over quickly.

title: Horrific
text:
Not worth the money.  Horrific check in process; careless front desk staff with little knowledge of who can access where (rooftop pool parties) and when (guests should have first dibs).  

The rooms are not well kept.  The lamp shades are falling apart and they do not change the bedding despite your requests to.

title: Nice clean place to lay your head
text: Nice place, very clean, professional staff. Affordable and within walking distance of several great places to eat and shop. Roof top bar and pool are very nice. Pool is a little small but wasn’t crowded. Nice views from the roof top bar, good drinks.

title: Amazing Staff
text: I checked into The James recently for an overnight business trip. During check-in, I casually mentioned that I had been having one of those travel days where nothing was going right. Kris and Bobby at the front desk immediately sprang into action offering me a complimentary upgrade of my room and a glass of wine to take the edge off. It was a very pleasant surprise. It is service like this that will have me coming back. On top of that, the bed was extremely comfortable and the location was in close proximity to everywhere I needed to be. I will definitely be returning to The James if my travels bring me back to the area. Thanks again, Kris and Bobby.

title: WELL
text: The hotel looks nice on the inside and the views from the a Penthouse are breathtaking. However, they may still be completing construction renovations, as a loud disruptive noise kept us awake. Also, the food service is slow and of poor value, if you can order at all. We received cold food after waiting over a hour and were told the next morning room service would be over a hour wait. This establishment really needs to make sure the staff and service provided matches the rates they’re asking customers to pay for rooms.

title: Wonderful staff, conveniently located
text: When we arrived we were immediately greeted by Johnny and Bobby. We had such a wonderful check in experience, these guys were extremely genuine and helpful, they made us feel right at home. We were given an upgrade, which was completely unexpected, but highly appreciated. Our room was a beautiful corner room with amazing views of the city. The gym was a bit small but it had everything needed for a great work out with great views of the city, I truly enjoyed my morning workouts. They provide cold water and fresh towels. The roof top has a pool with amazing views. Overall our stay was great, we were there for 6 nights and we did not want to leave.

title: Concierge praise!
