text: The hotel was cool, small, quiet, chill vibe. The concierge/bellhop, Eric, truly made a difference for us.  Great attitude and appropriate recommendations regarding Uber, taxi and restaurants.  Very helpful

title: no concept, bad service, confused staff
text: we stayed at the james,when we arrived our room´s air conditioning was leaking, the hotel made us wait 1.5 hours before we were transferred to another room, ok if they at least inform you that there might be a wait !!  on arrival in the new room the sink was blocked and did not drain out water- the staff also said yes we will send somebody right away. which never happened. The rooms are run down , its not really possible to close the curtains as the tv is drilled to the concrete column in the room, the tv remote control was broken too. The hotel bikes were run down and in need of repair. The staff were rude and pretty confused, they did not know what the other was doing. in general HUGELY over priced and by the n if you pay extra for a high floor- donway that rooftop pool which is advertised is tiny and only open for hotel guest part of the day, the other part becomes a party nightclub space, so even if you pay extra for the 16th or 17th floor, don't as you won't be able to sleep. Go somewhere else - the choice in new york is huge.

title: Fabulous modern hotel
text: In the heart of soho ultramodern and fabulous the roof top has a great lounge with little pool room are very modern clean and light The lobby are is very nicely decorated and offer computers coffe and snacks I enjoyed my stay very much

title: What a great find!
text: I was so blown away with my stay here.  I found the room to be decent sized for NY with great views.  The location is awesome with access to the subway and the greenway.  I didn't get a chance to try the onsite dining but there are some great food options not far away!  Great night sleep - will return!  (The front desk staff were super nice - always a plus.)

title: Fantastic housekeepers
text: Angelique and Leslie were so very helpful when I stopped them to ask for information! They were kind and helpful and I was so thankful for their kindness! Even when seeing them again in passing, they made me feel so welcome and at home! What a great experience for my first time to NYC!

title: Great place
text: Had an awesome experience thanks to Bobby and Kris for making everything so much easier! ❤️❤️ The hotel has great amenities and an awesome rooftop! You have to check this place out if you’re in New York

title: Great Staff
text: Traveling for business but brought my wife along for evening in the city.  The staff here was amazing.  The bellman down stairs, I think Kenny and Wayne, could not have been friendly and helpful.  We unfortunately had to drive in and they brought our car up early to prevent us from being charged another day for the extra hour we were there.  Natalie at the front desk was also wonderful.  We had a corner king room and the view was amazing.  The room was small but typical for NYC.  The shower was really nice though.  The roof top pool and bar are an added bonus.  The chairs up there are comfortable and it was nice for my wife to hang out there while I was working.  On the weekends they have a pool party starting at 3PM.  My wife and I went up and had a great time, but if you are not into that scene you may want to avoid and request a room on a lower floor.    You could hear the music down the elevator shaft several floors.  It didn't bother us, but I could see how some would be bothered.

title: Ask Eric for killer restaurant and activity tips
text:
The hotel is great in all the ways that count. Clean, great service but the extra touch was an awesome dude named Eric working there. Apart from just being a nice guy to talk to for a few minutes, he gave me great and most of all honest recommendations to places to eat and things to do during my 2 day stay. 
All in all a great place to stay but the great service from Eric made it a tad better than the competition!

title: Awesome staff, Great location
text: Such friendly staff in NYC is almost impossible to find.  What a gem!   Johnny the manager is great.   Super location, great rooms.  Close to metro - Quiet & great amenities like roof bar, outside patio/seating under trees.

title: Home away from home with a great time
text: I am not sure where to begin....This place is amazing and with a professional staff and a great atmosphere. Let’s begin with the staff, a huge shoutout to Yu-On, Sasha, Mavis, Christina, Shefi, Johnni and even the pool boy, Michael. Wow what a team they have. These guys went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable even thought I was there for only 2 nights. The room was clean and pretty spacious for SoHo. This place has everything that one needs, a great rooftop bar, Jimmy’s, great staff, clean rooms and is closely located to the train. Thank you guys for a great stay and see ya soon!

title: The only place to stay in NYC
text: As a frequent traveler to New York for business and pleasure, I've found many hotels that I love but The James is my favorite. The rooms are huge, the staff was extremely helpful and the location is ideal. I appreciated the many extras the hotel provides to make your stay comfortable like complimentary coffee, wine hour, and mini bar credit. This was my third stay at the hotel and I  plan to return again  this year.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Had another amazing stay at The James, SoHo! The location, views, and rooftop pool at this hotel are unbeatable. Hotel staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and we could even talk to the front desk via text message. Will definitely be back again!

title: Very Cool, But Should be Better
text: Cool location, modern, good food, well meaning staff.  But this hotel is  not at the top of its game.  Room was not well policed before I moved in, toilet missing a part, front entrance is not well staffed, took 2 days to notify me that I had a FedEx delivery.  Staff is pleasant, but it all seems sorta of haphazard. A great hotel is about attention to the details.  The James needs to sharpen up its game and focus on the details.

title: Amazing Location! Helpful Staff, Annoying Pool party.
text: This hotel has a great location in Soho. Bellmen were so helpful and friendly! Beds were very comfy! They throw a pool party open to the public that starts at 3. from 3 on the pool is a mess. I would recommend this hotel for families or couples.

title: Stay at the James
text: Great week at the hotel, staff accommodating, roof top was the extra treat with great views, music and staff. Rooms are spacious enough, some rework was done on the top floor and the gym needs some attention but overall great stay

title: Hip hotel, outstanding service
text: Just back from a night at The James. The location is terrific and the hotel is the same - clean, modern, minimalist and stylish as hell, The rooms are comfortable and remarkably quite given the area. But the service is above and beyond. We had an unusually high numbers of special requests and Johnny (manager) and Natalie (reception) could not have been nicer and took care of us wonderfully. We will be back when we return to NYC. Highly recommended.

title: Great location and rooftop.  Don’t stay for anything more.
text:
We travel to NYC with some frequency and love to stay in the SoHo area, so thought we would give The James a try.  It is in an excellent location, has amazing rooftop views, the beds are very comfortable and the heated bathroom floor is a definite bonus.  We had a 6th floor corner king, so, while the sunlight was great, we weren’t able to take in the views the higher floors offer.  (We requested a higher floor but none were available.).  The wine and cheese are a nice touch and the cookies and scones are amazing!!!!   

Unfortunately, this is where the greatness seems to end.   For a 4-5 star hotel, they miss the mark on service.  The hotel is VERY focused on the rooftop bar and almost seems to let the hotel and hotel guests take a back seat.  After 5 pm it is near impossible to take an elevator to your room - especially if trying to catch one on the lobby (2nd floor).  You are better to go to the ground floor to go up and hope you aren’t pushed out of the way by rooftop patrons.  The hotel seems very understaffed with one person working the lobby area/registration desks, rarely a doorman or concierge to be found.  The room was small, but to be expected in NYC.  We had a very slow sink drain that was finally repaired after repeated requests - on the third of a four day stay.  Worse, housekeeping never cleaned the residue from the slow drain.  Walls are scuffed, curtain stained and a lot of dust and dirt build up on floor boards.   There was a nice floor lamp - if you wanted to plug/unplug as needed.  We could hear the guests above us every time they walked across the floor. tv would occasionally lose cable/satellite connection and you couldn’t access guest services etc.

Unfortunately, this one did not live up to our expectations.  Perhaps they were too high given the website and our past experiences with James hotels?  Go for the location/views/rooftop party.  Don’t stay for the attention to detail of a finer hotel or to expect top notch service.

title: Stylish Hotel with Awesome City Views
text:
The James Soho is a conveniently located, stylish, modern hotel. You can walk to the West Village, Greenwich village, Downtown, Lower East Side, and many subway stops. My wife and I are walkers so the location was a huge plus for us. If you want to shop till you drop, there are many many places nearby to spend $$$$. 

The hotel: Enjoyed the views from the rooftop. There’s a bar, indoor seating area, wading pool, and outdoor seating as well. Hallways and public areas look well maintained and clean. Large windows surround the lobby which brings in a lot of light. The design throughout the hotel is definitely modern but there are lots of warm tones that add a “homey” feeling to the spaces. 

Service: The door guys are really helpful. When we checked in they held our bags until our room was ready. Every time we needed a cab, they got one for us in a jiffy. Need an umbrella? They can also get those for you. Front desk staff were quick, efficient, and friendly. They gave us complimentary drink tickets so we went up to the rooftop bar and had some drinks while we waited for our room. We didn’t do room service or needed a valet so I can’t speak to those services. 

The room: We booked a suite with a separate living area and bedroom. It was very spacious and well appointed. The view from the 16th floor was stunning. Although we enjoyed our stay, there’s definitely room for improvement. On arrival, there were several issues with the room (housekeeping and engineering related). I won’t list them here because it was properly dealt with. I would say the room could use a refresh - couch pillows look worn, the bed was too lumpy and soft, and power strips behind the side tables are not efficient (don’t like reaching behind to plug things in!)

Overall we really enjoyed our stay but we did encounter various issues with the room (which were acknowledged and resolved by the hotel staff).

title: comfortable and private
text: amazing location! walking distance to my favorite soho streets - lots of high end shops (and low end), as well as cute brunch spots. i loved the wine, cheese and cookies the hotel provided for guests each night. it was very comforting and the hotel seems to attract cool guests

title: Great hotel, awesome service to cap off a perfect weekend
text: It was a short trip and unfortunately did not take advantage of all the amenities (sad).  However, the room was really nice and the heated floor was an AWESOME touch.  The only issue I had with the room was the lack of visible/available plugs. They were buried/invisible behind heavy curtains so you didn’t have the option of plugging it in comfortably by the bed/on both bed stands. Small thing that certainly didn’t take away from the overall experience.  Most importantly, I was there for a post engagement celebration and Kris at the front desk was very accommodating to help us celebrate, she was awesome and I’m very appreciative she was able to work with me on such short notice (there was a miscommunication so we had to act quick).  It really added to the whole weekend and I couldn’t have done it without her.  It’s reasons like these that will bring me back to the The James Soho. Thank you!!

title: Poor service
text:
Check in process was ok. Lifts in the hotel extremely slow and at busy times the number of lifts isn't sufficient. Room size was ok and the bed was ok. Didn't like the glass bathroom/toilet wall. You could close this using a curtain. 
In room dining was a different experience. The in room dining team was too busy to answer up my phone call. Got transferred to guest relations and they would ask in room dining to call me back. After 30 minutes still no call back so called in room dining myself again. This time they did pick up. After 30 mins food was delivered but the geniuses provided me with 2 spoons and a fork. Not very handy if you want to cut your food. Called them again and after 10 minutes the knife was brought up. By that time for was cold. Upon check out the receptionist asked me whether I wanted a printed copy or an email version of the invoice. I asked for the invoice by email. Despite numerous chasers and my PA calling them, I'm still waiting for the invoice. Overall the facilities are decent, but the service levels are at the level of the hit series "Fawlty Towers". Wouldn't stay here again.

title: Best Staff! Only Adds to the Beauty of the Hotel.
text: Love the James soho! It is a beautiful hotel—the amenities are great and Gitano’s is such a fab addition. Definitely recommend if you’re looking to stay in the Soho area. If you’re lucky, Bobby will be at the front desk to assist you—he’s a gem! So happy I stayed here.

title: Nice hotel, pool bar can be loud occasionally
text: Good location but difficult to get to due to one-way streets and limited parking.  Room are very trendy but a little small.  Bathrooms enclosed by glass and it limits privacy in room.  Nice staff but you have to navigate bar patrons trying to get to rooftop.

title: super thoughtful staff
text: This was my first visit to the James, and though it was a bit hard to find initially, I loved the hotel and location was great. However, the staff really made my experience there. The James provides glass bottles of filtered water instead of the usual plastic throw-aways (thank you for being green!), and housekeeping noticed that i liked to keep my water cold in the mini fridge. So when I emptied a bottle, they would make sure to put the replacements in the fridge for me. I thanked her and asked for an extra handsoap/lotion (amazing bath products there too),  and she hooked me up. Whoever she was, she was my angel for the week while I was working in NYC. Oh, and did I mention they have happy hour and warm cookies for guests??? Would stay again.

title: Weird experience
text:
Dishonest pricing with initial
Booking and final billing. Same goes for breakfast included? We did exactly what they said and ordered the breakfast they offered but they only comped part of it, that was not explained. The price is not worth the quality at all; the only reason we stayed was because of the pool and the pool staff was rude and inconsiderate the whole time and treating us like we were just random people not paying customers probably because we didn’t look rich enough.

title: Great location, clean, minimalist design & helpful front desk staff!
text: I've been staying at The James about once a week for the past month or so for business. I am always warmly greeted by Natalie at the front desk. If late in the evening, she points me to a complementary glass of wine and cheese snacks in the lounge area; if in the afternoon, she reminds me about the cocktail hour, complementary late night cookie snacks and always offers tips on where to go for certain things (which I appreciate since I am not a local).  The rooms are a decent size, for NYC, and always very clean. I like the minimalist design approach -- no clutter, nothing that is "too extra."  Location is perfect for SoHo and that general area. The deli on the same block of the hotel has GREAT breakfast options like veggie omlettes and good coffee. They are open 24/7 if you miss room service at the hotel. Business travel isn't great -- but staying at The James makes it better!

title: Memorial weekend
text: Stayed at The James for 5 days and it was amazing. First, they had our room ready when we arrived at 8am. This was huge because we wanted to shower and start exploring. The staff was really friendly and went beyond to make you feel at home.

title: Lovely modern hotel with rooftop pool in the heart of Soho
text: Excellent location, with luxury amenities, rooftop bar and pool. Staff friendly and accommodating. Complimentary coffee and snacks all day. Complimentary wine served 2 hours in the evenings nice compared to 1 hour at similar hotels

title: Horrible hospitality
text: This hotel is an absolute fraud. We paid 450$ for an upgraded room and at the front desk the “front office manger” wouldn’t spend  more than 1 minute speaking to me. Johnny Houston (if he gave us the correct business card)  the desk manager on shift Sunday June 2nd at 8pm told us we were not good enough to stay in his hotel. He was more than disrespectful, judgmental and rude acting like we weren’t trying to pay him $500 for a room here. I except to be treated with respect. Graduating with a  hospitality degree myself, I know what is expected and I’m disgusted by this property and will never in my life let another person I know stay somewhere under the same ownership. I work for a hotel developer myself and Johnny would never in a million years be allowed to speak to any guest of my hotel ...He has 0 customer service skills and does not care in any way, shape, or form about what’s best for his property. Shame on you for hiring and Training your staff  to have such little respect for high paying customers. Do better.

title: Slow service, inexperienced staff, too much attitude.
text: This hotel need a remodel including its staff who let the phone ring endlessly at guest services. Everyone is slow and requires multiple calls to get anything done. Everyone acts bothered when you ask for something. And don’t both getting a drink in the roof. You’ll be greeted with nothing but attitude.

title: Great service at the James SoHo
text: Bobby was great at the front desk! Very attentive and great attitude. Also hotel is great:). The staff is very kind and friendly. The views were terrific! Gitano and jimmys are restaurants at the hotel that are very cool as well.

title: Great amenities and service
text: Great location with awesome amenities (morning scones, evening wine and cheese). Also love the rooftop bar. Stay here every time I come in for work. Service is phenomenal, they go the extra mile - Kris & Bobby are legends!

title: Oh James
text:
Thank you so much for the amazing hospitality and the wonderful accomodation! Super location @Gitano and @lobbythejames!
Kris and Bobby are the best! 
We’ll be back here 😊. 
Although the rain, sun is shining @thejames 😎

title: Terrible rooms - very nice staff.
text:
We were so dissapointed by the rooms that we actually checked out after the first night and checked in to another hotel. 
The suite/ room was not maintained and seemed old and shabby. It was dirty in the bathroom, there was no duvet cover and stains at the duvet. The windows was bad isolated so we woke up several times during the night. We expected to pay around 900 for the room with taxes, but endes up prating 1350/ night because of all the extra they say is «complementary», invluded one breakfast. Thank god we only stayed there one night, or else the bill after five nights would be a big suprise. 
The staff was really nice and helpful, but the suite was just so far from the pictures and our expectations.

title: Terrible Rooms & Noise
text: The service here is exceptional but the rooms need to be completely renovated. We were woken up at 8:00 by banging on the floors in the room directly above us which is ridiculous why we were put in that particular room to begin with. It was a Wednesday night so it wasn't sold out that's for sure. The location is great and they have a wonderful rooftop bar but this was the second time we tried this place and both times we were very dissatisfied.

title: Perfect downtown location close to everything shopping and restaurants
text:
When visiting New York you should absolutely consider Soho or The Village as your "Base Camp" The James is perfectly located in Soho very close to shopping, restaurants and everything downtown New York has to offer. A clean hotel with friendly staff and the view from #902 was spectacular. The rooftop bar was very busy and we never tried the restaurants, but this hotel is all about location, location, location. 
Btw, when we asked about a delayed check-out Terrill was very positive and gave an extra two hours without additional cost, thank you!!  👍

title: Disappointing client that will never come back again
text:
Disappointed stay with poor service 
No effort to make client happy
Very small gym room for such a big hotel
Even no umbrella while it was raining and the personnel claiming the management knew the day before that it will be missing...
Amazing and surprising way of welcoming clients
Would unfortunately never come back again

title: Fantastic Stay as usual
text:
I have stayed at The James now a number of times; Chris and Tyrell at the front desk always making my stay glorious, as well as Kenny downstairs taking care of the car and my bags. 10/10 would stay again
Thanks guys!

M

title: Best Hotel Service I’ve Ever Received
text: Staying at the James was truly a comfortable and pleasurable experience, the staff and the building itself are very nice! Especially to kristina! Thanks again to Kristina for helping me and my family out!

title: Aussie traveller
text: Fantastic hotel.Staff very exceptional and friendly.Check out the roof bar (Jimmy’s)Wont be disappointed.Great location.Bar food at Jimmy’s also tasty.Easy walk to local bars and restaurants.Giving a true feel of the non tourist New York.

title: Family visit
text: We came to visit our family members who live in the City.  This was a perfect base for shopping and sightseeing in the SoHo and Tribeca areas.  Great service and clean rooms with great views over the City made it a place we will come back to soon.

title: The James New York SoHO
text: Fantastic hotel, great location, excellent value for money would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.  Friendly staff who couldn't do enough for you checking in process was very easy very happy with my overall stay.

title: Horrendous noise from roof top bar
text: Rooms are OK. The hotel overlooks a very busy road hence traffic noise in lower rooms and upper rooms have VERY loud bar . You get charged a $40 facilities fee each night which is a hidden cost and apparently to cover free coffee/wine that's offered early evening, neither of which I had but was still made to pay this ridiculous charge. There are much better hotels in the same area.

title: If you have to come to NYC for work, stay at The James SoHo
text: This hotel is the complete package: well-appointed rooms, excellent restaurant, fantastic rooftop bar, perfect location, good coffee in the morning and great WiFi access. But what really sets it apart is the staff. Shout out to Tyrel who gave my co-workers and I the white glove treatment - he made us feel like the James was a home away from home! I would definitely recommend to anyone traveling to NYC.

title: Great hotel with excellent staff
text: I had 3 days here for work, it was a great location, lovely rooms. Most of all the staff were incredibly helpful. Special shout out to Yu-On who helped me print stuff, and generally made me feel like nothing was too much for him. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Traveling on business? The James New York SoHo is a great place to stay.
text: Had a wonderful relaxing stay at the James New York SoHo. The front desk, valet and all the staff was very helpful. Shout out to Kris, the attention received from Kris was impeccable. Rooftop views were spectacular; picture perfect. Will be coming back soon.

title: Red Carpet Treatment
text: Took my wife into the City for her first Mother's Day. Natalie and her team rolled out the red carpet and gave her an incredible VIP experience. It was very relaxing and such a wonderful experience. Can't wait to be back.

title: Lovely staff and amenities, walls paper thin
text:
The staff here is amazing and so welcoming. From the moment I checked in to getting extra wine during their free happy hour, their staff is SO friendly. The beds are super comfy and the rooms are nice and updated. There is even a facemask in the mini bar! They also offer free coffee and scones in the AM and free wine and cheese during happy hour. All lovely.

However, it pains me to knock off stars because of the above aforementioned positives, but the walls in this hotel are so thin. I know it’s NYC, but I kept hearing random doors slamming and loud building noises all night long. Early in the morning I could hear an annoyingly loud dude screaming into his cell phone for a half hour, not even sure if he was in the room next to me or above me. You can hear every single person walking by your door at all hours. 

If you are a light sleeper/easily bothered by noise, this likely isn’t the hotel for you. If you love amenities, a cool location with awesome dining/rooftop bar, and can sleep through anything, you’ll be in good shape here.

title: Great service!
text: We had to find a hotel room on short notice and everyone, especially Kris at reception, was very helpful and accommodating! The atmosphere in the lounge is very welcoming and relaxing, loved the wine and cheese hour. Definitely worth a visit!

title: Great Hotel!
text: The hotel and room were so nice, and the staff was incredibly friendly. I stayed for a quick work trip, and had a great time. Eric was amazing and so helpful with his restaurant recommendations as well as his help navigating the NYC subway, including walking me over to the stop so I could find it easily! Bryant at the Jimmy rooftop bar was also so friendly and awesome!! Highly recommend!

title: Awesome hotel and roof top bar
text: Chris & Natalie offer amazing service and great hotel with amazing roof top bar and swimming pool and great corner room at hotel. Roof top bar serves awesome cocktails with great bar snacks and service from all staff

title: Mr. Al Branch
text: As frequent business traveler. It feels good to stay at a hotel without being a Bon Voy member that treats its guest like Titanium members regardless. Kris, and Natalie treated me great. Will be back soon!

title: Hotel
text: Me encanto la estadía, es lugar es muy lindo, tuvimos un retraso en la entrega de la habitación pero Kris y Natalie fueron muy amables y lo. Solucionaron rápidamente , el hotel está muy bien ubicado. Lo recomiendo 100%

title: Natalie & Kris
text:
The best hostes! Really nice ! Will really go back.they drinks to the rooftop for me and my friends. Excellent service
Natalie and kris were very welcoming bellman were friendly and very helpful

Overall anytime I visit New York this will be my to go place

title: A Gem in NYC
text: Always love staying here, our 4th stay in NYC. Smart, well presented rooms, and great service. The front desk is ready to accommodate requests , in particular Jose Martinez.  Tea coffee in the morning and Wine and cheese in the evening is a great touch in the buzzing Lobby.

title: Mrs.
text: We really enjoyed our weekend at The James NY in Soho. The staff was very accommodating especially Terril Kris who went out of his way to make sure we were happy. Great views, great neighborhood and great roof top bar.

title: Kris is so AMAZING!!!
text:
I was so confused traveling from outside the city, but kris was able to direct me to the best places to eat/drink in SOHO, my trip would have been a bust without her. If i could give more stars I would.

THANK YOU!!!!

title: whenever I come to NewYork This is where I stay
text: had a great stay  sleep with the windows open listening to the sounds of the city. The front desk staff member Kris she was very sweet. The manager Terill was very helpful when I ask to change my reservation

title: 50th birthday weekend with college friends
text:
Ideal location, great price, exceptional hip hotel, and genuine warm welcome from a superior staff.  

Kris was especially charming and authentic. She checked us in at the lobby with glasses of wine, asked about our travel experience driving in, and upgraded us (as we had purchased through a hotel app).  She connected with us on Mother’s Day plans that she had and we had; her mom should be as proud as her boss. Such a great person. 

Room: clean, bright and sunny, well arranged. 

Service: everything you’d want. Nothing excessive. 

James is a dependable hip line. Soho location adds super warm welcome to a great stay.

title: Home away from home in NY
text:
Whenever I come to NY for a shot holiday or a long week- end I stay at the James. 

The rooms and the facilities are great and the staff goes a long way to make you feel at home. 

Terrill and Kris have been great un taking care of me last time  I was  there in May.

Thank you!

title: TheJames, Soho, New york
text: A very clean hosting a very friendly staff wonderful catered to all our needs and jumped to open the elevator for us when our hands were full carrying food or luggage.  Nice restaurants close to the facility and downtown China town within walking distance.

title: Awesome hotel in Soho
text: Loved our stay st the James Soho. Rooms were well appointed and positioned in a great spot in soho. The rooftop bar (jimmys) was awesome aswell. The staff were always willing to assist and super friendly.

title: Style over substance
text: There are elements of this hotel which are great - it's in a great location, it's nicely designed, some of the staff are very friendly..However, the receptionists seem to be chosen for whether they look cool rather than how efficient they are...I was waiting for packages to be delivered which one particular lady swore blind hadn't come when they had - a simple check with the post room would have clarified this so I had to check out of  the hotel without them having waited for an hour and half in reception for a courier who had already been..The same lady was actually standing next to deliveries when I arrived and also said nothing had come..The shower also smelled unpleasantly of damp ..To credit the hotel they have sent me the deliveries but since I live in another country this is not ideal..For the prices of this hotel charges I would expect a far higher level of service and I will not be back...

title: Amazing stay
text: We were hesitant to book at a hotel that we hadn't stayed in, especially because we were traveling with our 2 year old. We were absolutely blown away by the staff and the hotel. Everyone was friendly and always willing to help or give our little one a treat. We had one very minor incident with the air conditioner and it was resolved immediately and we were even compensated for this. We will absolutely make this our go to hotel in NYC. The location is amazing too, short walks to Soho, Little Italy, Washington Square, etc. I think the one minor detail I'd suggest that they change is that their comforters aren't very thick, but we didn't even bother to try calling to see if they had something else - it was no big deal.

title: A wonderful hotel!
text: Kris and Terril were terrific at the front desk.  Wonderful views - a must stay while in NYC.  Close to Soho and great italian restaurants.  The rooftop bar is lots of fun and we really appreciated the help from the staff.

title: Excelente estadia
text: Excelente ubicación, seguro para entrar y salir de noche. Limpio, ordenado, muy lindo, desayuno rico en el lobby. Leidy de recepción nos recibió con mucha atención, y todo el resto del personal tambien muy amable y atentos. Sin dudas volvería!!!

title: Excelente atención del personal
text: Natalie y Kris nos ayudaron con todo lo que necesitábamos y fueron muy amables todo el tiempo. Nos recomendaron el roof top del hotel y nos encanto. Gracias por las atenciones durante nuestra estancia en Ny

title: excelente hotel y super buena ubicación
text:
las recepcionistas super amables en especial Kris y Natalie muy buen servicio los cuartos muy cómodos y los bares increíbles en especial el roof top música muy padre 
todo increíble definitivamente regresaria

title: Customer service
text: Check in was quick . We were offered wine at check in. Natalie and Kris were amazing at the front desk! Views were beautiful ! Thank you Natalie and kris for making our stay memorable . We will definitely be coming back

title: horrible
text: First they couldn't find my reservation. I had to wait half an hour, though they knew I was coming around 11 PM and that I had been travelling from Europe, tired and with a kid. Then my room wasn't ready. I had requested a room for 2 adults and a kid with enough space, the extra bed wasn't there , and there was no space to circulate in the room at all, we had to jump over the beds. We had to wait till 1AM to go to sleep. then no breakfast restaurant, only in dinning poor breakfast...But no space to eat in the room, we sat on the beds...Room not even correctly cleaned...staff not helpful. Horrible experience we left after 24 hours. Do not go this is  terrible place pretending to be 4 stars, must be a joke.

title: Always a Great Spot
text: I have stayed at The James Soho on many occasions and it’s always a good time. The hotel is in walking distance to Tribeca, Soho and Chinatown plus it’s a short walk to the subway. So many great restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel.

title: Great Experience!
text: Great experience and very friendly staff!  The coffee was excellent and our room was very clean and simple.  The location was central and felt safe.  We did not get the chance to enjoy the rooftop bar but it has been highly recommended for the atmosphere and view!

title: A MUST STAY!!!
text: If you are traveling to NYC The James is an absolute must. We travel to the City often from upstate NY, both for business, and pleasure. We used to stay at another place in town, until we found The James. We decided on a whim to give this place a try, and had no idea that we would make it our new home away from home.

title: Very enjoyable stay
text: It was a very enjoyable stay. The staff was great in every department. All the receptionists were super helpful and very polite. Leidy the receptionist was remarkable and super sweet. The Gyms nice too!

title: Overall great stay
text: From check in to check out, everything was great. The property has a chic and elegant feel with lots of things to do within one building. The cafe, restaurant, and bars are all great places to hangout depending on your mood. The staff is very kind and helpful. Kris was great during my check in and stay! I will definitely come back here and encourage my NY friends to visit the rooftop and restaurant.

title: The James Hotel SoHo is one of New York's best hotels for business stays
text: We book often with the James Soho for business trips to New York and we will keep going back because they always make sure they go above and beyond to make sure that we are taken care of. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly and are always willing to address any special requests that we have in the most professional and courteous way. Special shoutout to Leidy for always making our stay so amazing.

title: Good Hotel, fun place and great staff
text:
Omar, Paul, Eric, and Kenny did a great job making us feel at home away from home.
The rooms were clean as well as the bathrooms.
The Room service was on time and available.
Concierge services and staff did their job and were very courteous.
They arranged a ride to the airport 
Central location to Sho and other good spots in the Area.

title: lovely boutique hotel
text: the james soho is gem in new york.  The rooftop deck is spectacular with views of the lower end of manhattan. The rooms are clean and modern yet very comfortable  I have stayed in many hotels in the soho / lower east side/ village area in New York and found the james to be one of the few I would recommend to others

title: Great
text:
Has been a great experience.The team was nice and trying to solve issues.Also a great location.Close to restaurants,Hudson jogging area,subway etc      
Will be our first choice if we return to NEW YORK   Thanks to KRISTINA

title: The james hotel new york soho
text: A big shout out for the most welcoming person ( KRIS)FROM the front desk @ the James new york Soho hotel. She upgraded our room to a corner queen with an amazing view !! Infront of the freedom tower.! Complementary drinks before the wine hour . She is truley a friendly warm person . Highly recommended if you  are looking for an amazing quality of service & good location!! Value for money . Book with confidence.

title: Great hotel option in SoHo
text: The James remains a fresh new option, even though it's been around for years now.  The gym is outstanding, the rooms comfortable and spotless and service/courtesy very, very good.  Their new coffee shop is hidden well enough that it's surprisingly quiet and provides great service.  The doormen and as helpful as any in the city.

title: Great location and friendly staff
text:
If you looking for a stylish hotel, it is the one suitable for you. It is located at the soho area where close to the canal st subway exit and easily reach by taxi. 
Super nice view from the room. Quiet at night and you can completely relax and fall sleep in the bed quickly

title: Kenny!
text:
Kenny, every hotel needs a Kenny at the door but only the James has him. He made our stay so good, arriving a bit traumatised he made
us so welcome, sorted everything out and we felt like he was really looking after us. He had the weekend off and when we saw him again he remembered our names. The hotel is very good, quiet and with friendly staff. The room was comfy with nice bed, kettle in
Room, air con, decent shower room and a great view. The rooftop bar is astounding. When we return to NYC, the James will likely be our first choice. By the way, did I mention Kenny...?

title: Stayed at better places in Soho
text: Party hotel. Jimmy rooftop can be annoying when you're staying as a hotel guest. Waiting for elevators up to your room because of roof top guests coming in and out so having to ride it packed every time. We were on the 15th floor and could hear the DJ to 2am and then parties above us. Had the worst sleep here. We also found little things annoying like they didn't restock our bar fridge , we had no coffee in the room, phone didn't work and didn't have a TV remote. It was constant nuisances .

title: The James
text:
The staff at the hotel were exceptional! They went above and beyond for us at all times. Rooms are tiny but the view was great, and the rooms were very clean.
We were surprised to discover there wasn’t a restaurant to eat in. Room service is available and you can eat in the lobby but the seating isn’t quite set up for eating up to a table. 
Rooftop was not open for children until pool season. Which we discovered was sometime at the end of May.

title: Business Trip
text: Excellent location.  Efficient room layout.  Great amenities including surprisingly spacious and well-equipped exercise room.  Great friendly front desk and bell staff.  Tasty morning and evening treats in lobby.

title: Brilliant hotel to base ourselves from for a week
text: We stayed here in August 2018 and had a fantastic time in a corner suite with amazing views across to the Freedom Tower. Room was modern, moderate size, cool bathroom and good amenities all around.  Very clean, friendly service, we loved the breakfast cakes, proximity to the subway and riding the hotel bikes.  Didn’t really spend much time at the rooftop pool as we had expected we might, but couldn’t fault it. Thanks for a great stay, we’d certainly recommend it to friends and family

title: Quick Work Trip Stay
text:
I stopped over for a conference in NYC for a few days and stayed at The James in SoHo. The complex was clean and had a great vibe to it, fitting nicely into the block and making use of a larger third(?) floor as the main lobby to service customers more fully. The rooms were nice and modern, with all that most would need and a nice set of room comforts (eg robes, mini-bar, etc).

The rooftop bar was a nice place to snag a drink and hang out and overall I found the entire staff at the hotel to be attentive and friendly.

title: Easter 2019
text: We had a good stay but on reflection this wasn’t the best hotel for a family. The bars are geared to couples and facilities are light. The location was good for Soho and Tribeca and the subway(A and C) was right outside on Canal.

title: No sense of urgency
text: We checked in at 11 am. He asked for my ID and card. And he asked for my phone number so that when the room is ready they would call since check in time is 3pm. I also told my partner to give his phone number just in case my phone dies. He didn’t explain any of the amenities of the hotel. We NEVER got a call. We came back to the hotel at 4 pm. The girl at the desk said our room was ready. I asked her “aren’t you guys suppose to call when the room is ready?” She said “ it was booked through a 3rd party so we don’t have that information.” (your phone number given at check in has nothing to do with booking with a third party or not- in my opinion and so a fact! ) she then said “I hope to see a smile on your face before you leave”.very professional. Later that night we were getting ready when the sink was not draining. I called guest services and they said they would send an engineer up after we have left the room. No one came... they also had white deuce tape on the wall to cover a hole (cover up problems instead of fixing them?) the whole time we were there we had a clogged sink and did not receive housekeeping or turn down service either (and no we did not have a DND on the door)... speaking of DND- on our full last day I came to the hotel at 2pm to take a nap and took medication that makes me drowsy For an injury that I have. Housekeeping came in when I had a DND on the door while I was sleeping naked in my bed and left towels next to the bed. I called and spoke to the manger named Jonathon or Johnny and said he would investigate and get back to me. I gave him my cell phone number. I never received a call from him. we had a great time enjoying New York City, but over all a horrible experience at the hotel. I would not stay again. The staff do not care and have a very “go with the flow care free vibe”.

title: Stay at The James SOHO
text: Great views and generally nice accommodations in lovely SOHO.  Front desk staff varied in their attitude and helpfulness.  The gym was nicely equipped and had an amazing view on the 17th floor.  Fabulous scones in the morning available in the lobby.

title: A small personal hotel
text: I used to stay at the James for several years but have not been back for about four years.  It is not quite as good as it was before, and needs refreshing in several respects, but it is still very good.  The good touches are the scones, fruit, cheese and biscuits in the lounge at different times of day; and the corner rooms are very pleasant indeed. Now the poor aspects of which there are far too many. I don't think that there are enough staff: when I arrived, the doorman was nowhere to be seen and so I had to lug my luggage up to the Reception.  I was early for check in and so the desk staff told me that they would call me when my room was ready - but they didn't.  One had often to ask the staff to replenish the coffee or the cheese and biscuits in the lounge area.- they tended to ignore it.  The windows of my room were dirty, which spoiled one of the views.  The outside terrace was not particularly inviting: they should have prepared it already for Spring. There is a roof top bar which attracts lots of younger people - not a bad thing but it meant that the lifts were irritatingly slow in the evenings.  But worst of all was that I received an email on my very first evening from management inviting my comments - and despite the fact that I responded with some of the above, they never condescended either to acknowledge my email or to provide me with a substantive reply.  That tells one something about the general approach in the hotel.  So, a long list of irritations (above) but, fundamentally, still a very good hotel. Yet far short of how good it used to be.  Will I return? Not sure.

title: Kris was awesome!
text: Amazing customer service coming in, especially Kris at the front desk! Made us feel extremely welcome and comfortable as soon as we came in! Even familiarized ya with the area so much that we feel like locals already! Service with a smile really pays off! :)

title: Sub par experience for business trip
text: From a business perspective - the internet was down. Quality and speed was very poor. Confirmed by their IT company that they had purchased the lowest speed. I lost 2 hours productivity as a result. Phone was out of order. TV was down due to HD not working. The "working area" of the room was sub-par. Only 1 plug several feet away from the desk so couldn't plug in phone and laptop. There was NO desktop lamp and as the overall lighting in the "suite" was very poor - this became a problem. I literally had to turn the desk around to get light from the bedside tables. Quite simply I would not stay here again as it is not set up to support a business professional. The biggest PLUS however is the staff. There was a significant difference in the caliber of the people and the interest, care and concern they took with you. I was very impressed by the staff across the board and cannot say enough good things about everyone -- from the engineer, to front desk, to the hotel manager.

title: Perfect location!
text: Location was key!  Loved the look of the hotel! Very hip.  Staff were helpful specially Kenny the bellman.  Complimentary scones and coffee in the morning and , wine and cheese at 6pm was a nice touch.  Lobby is just the right size.

title: Nice property with POOR management.
text: Unprofessional management. Too many things went wrong.  Size of bed of deluxe king room is not king bed, they have their own standards of sizes of beds.  The whole floor did not Have a working telephone so communication with front desk or room service was not possible. Bathroom had a leakage they could not fix.  Their suggestion was that I find a different hotel and they will not charge a penalty for early departure.  Requested a written explanation of king bed sizes and they refused.  On departure they withdrew the facility fee as compensation. Got charged for a bill at one of the hotels establishments I never set foot on.

title: Truly great modern hotel
text:
I’ve been coming to NYC about 7 times a year and have stayed all over the city for many years.
This hotel is always my first choice if I can afford it. I never get stuck in a dark room on a courtyard. 
I think all rooms face a street and have lots of light, and are so clean with wood floors. It’s in a great location with many little restaurants and shops.  Although I don’t bring my dog, I love that you can, and it makes an atmosphere that is relaxed.

title: Loved the hotel
text: Corner room was amazing.  The staff was very kind and aimed to please.  The rooftop lounge was fun with great drinks. Loved the room.  Very clean.  Service is impeccable.  Loved every moment of my stay and especially the location.  Soho is just a great location.  This hotel is the best hotel in the area.

title: Solid with nice perks
text: Great staff and a cosy small feel.  Love the coffee and scones in the morning. Wine and cheese at evening. Staff is friendly and helpful. Wonderful large towels. Housekeepers were always quick and efficient.

title: Sweet 16 Celebration
text: The staff at James Hotel SOHO outdid themselves- we had a fabulous celebration weekend staying at this Hotel- my niece turned 16 and was not permitted to view the Jimmy Rooftop, but Kris and Terrell gave us a special peek and allowed us to enjoy the fabulous view for a bit before it officially opened for the evening! On my nieces birthday, Kris, Terrill, Natalie, Julian and Johnny presented her with gorgeous balloons and cheesecake pops! This will always be our Hotel of  choice- cannot find a better staff and service! Also fantastic location!

title: EXTRÈME GENTILLESSE
text: j'ai passé une semaine dans cet hôtel et  le personnel était d'une extrême gentillesse, Kris, Natalie et Tesril étaient toujours à l'écoute de clients, Toujours aimables et souriantes, prêtes à donner l'information demandé ou à offrir un verre du bon vins de l'hôtel.

title: Great location, Wonderful service
text: Our family enjoyed our weekend at the James. The Soho location is perfect with shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The staff was incredibly welcoming and responsive to all our needs, especially Kris, Natalie and Terri. The hotel does become a bit of scene with The Jungle and rooftop bar. Overall this hotel met and even exceeded our expectations and we will look forward to returning.

title: Needs a Refresh
text: I've stayed here in the past and remember it being cleaner, more modern and well-kept than it was. It doesn't appear to have been kept up over the last couple of years. The mattress was lumpy and the room seemed didn't seem very clean. The food options were also very limited, we had to walk to another close hotel to have breakfast.

title: Amazing staff
text: This is a really nice hotel. The room is beautiful and the neighborhood is excellent but the staff are what make this hotel absolutely wonderful. I stayed here with my boyfriend for his birthday and they went above and beyond to make sure that we had an excellent experience. Kris, Natalie, Mavis, and Terril thank you so much for everything!! You guys rock!

title: Perfect! I recommend!
text:
The hotel is clean and stylish, conveniently located near the prime Soho shopping district. The staff is kind, attentive, efficient, willing to help, and personable. The manager on duty, Johnny, took note of my interest in a room with a view and change my room assignment to accommodate (room 1202). And the view was JUST WHAT I WANTED! 

My sleep felt safe, sound, and luxurious.

title: Great Service
text: Kriss was amazing at the front desk.  We had a late flight on the way back and she did everything possible to accommodate our late checkout.  The rooms were impeccably clean, very ample bathrooms with floor warmers.   Great location in Soho

title: Very chic and trendy hotel!
text:
We stayed at The James for 7 nights.
The hotel is located in the soho area of Manhattan.  
Canal street, Chinatown and little Italy are all just a short walk away.  There is also a couple of subway stations nearby. Which helps you to get around the city.
The rooms are small but functional, with all the necessary amenities needed.
There is a rooftop bar/pool area which is small but very nice, which offer great views of the city.
The staff are very friendly and attentive.  Special mentions must go to Erica, who provided us with excellent housekeeping service.  Mavis on the front desk who organised for us to have a late check out and Kenny who organised our airport transfer with the greatest of ease.
We loved staying at this hotel, it is a great base for exploring this wonderful
City.  We would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you want to escape the manic-ness of times sq.

title: Perfect weekend stay
text: We came here for our 1st anniversary and really loved this hotel! Upon arriving we were given an upgraded room as well as a bottle of wine and 2 complimentary drinks to celebrate our anniversary! So nice! Our room was spacious and the bathroom was big as well, great windows and view of the city. So many hotels give you a view of another brick building or a courtyard, this was a nice treat. $10 per day to use in the mini bar, that was cool too! Our first night was rainy and cold so we tried to go downstairs (w/o reservations) to Gitano, and unfortunately they were booked, it was a cool trendy place, I would have made reservations had I known. Our second night was beautiful weather, so before dinner we figured we'd head to their rooftop The Jimmy for our free drinks, before we got into the elevator we could hear loud music coming down the shaft, the elevator going up was packed, once we got up there, we realized we were at a pretty popular rooftop w/ a DJ etc. at 6:30 pm. It took a bit to get our drinks, but the view and sunset was gorgeous for our short stay before dinner. We had ordered room service breakfast and that was probably the most disappointing- waffles were too cold and rubbery for butter to melt . Not a huge deal, but for $70 just get ready and go out some place near by in soho or tribeca. Also if you want a late checkout, call early, they couldn't accommodate us because they had given out too many already that morning. Otherwise awesome stay and location!

title: True Boutique Hotel
text: Checked in tonight for a one night stay on the seventeenth floor. This is a true boutique hotel with a lovely, sort of hidden away-feeling entrance (you ride up a glass elevator out of what feels like a residential entry foyer) to a cozy lobby decorated with some truly spectacular art — love the Lindsey Adelman chandeliers throughout! We were exhausted and starving after a day of delayed travel; front desk employees were polite, laid back, and lightening fast (think they sensed we wanted to get up to the room as soon as possible & were very accommodating.) They made sure we were able to get onto the wifi before we headed upstairs to our room. The room itself feels classic Soho: floor to ceiling windows, very efficient use of space, industrial touches mixed with rich dark chocolate tones, very well thought out. The complimentary glass bottled water, hardwood floors, fast & efficient 24-hour room service, heavenly smelling en-shower amenities, and lack of street noise all add up to what feels like a true 5 star boutique hotel. Will be back for sure.

title: A great little spot with lots of charm
text: Nice sized rooms for lower Manhattan, the staff is great and very friendly/helpful. Definitely making will consider making this a regular home away from home when I'm working in NYC. Excellent view from the bar and pool on the roof.

title: Friendly staff
text:
Want to take a moment to thank Kris for her warm reception upon check in. 
Her smile was infectious and she gave us a great start to our unplanned staycation in NYC. 
Hope you continue sharing your enthusiasm as a guest it was much appreciated.

title: Great service
text: Great location, very near shopping area in Soho. They offer unlimited wine from 6-7pm. Loved their room, great view, very spacious and tidy. I would stay here again next time I visit New York. Thumbs up to this property!

title: Last minute stay!
text: My husband and I last minute decided to stay over at The James. We were greeted by two very friendly and helpful young ladies Natalie and Chris. Natalie had a great personality and after a 2 hour drive in traffic she immediately brought a smile and an upgraded suite to us!  Great short visit ,in a great part of NYC. Would definitely come back.

title: Excellent service, friendly, clean beautiful hip hotel
text: I love the James. The staff is so service oriented and wonderful. Nice and so accommodating, it puts this beautiful and chic hotel above the so many chic hotels in New York. Leidy and Yami were wonderful.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Stayed here 3 nights with my wife. Great location near Canal and Sixth. There is this amazing coffeeshop across Grand Street from it. Greeting by friendly doorman Dennis - great conversation. We showed up a little bit early but they let us store our bags, and had our room ready before 3 PM. As above, a smallish type room but very comfortable and very cozy. Would have liked to have caffeinated coffee packets but that's about all I can complain about!

title: Great staff and Excellent Location
text:
We had such a comfortable stay in NYC at The James New York. The staff were always more than happy to help and give advice on places to visit and eat. In particular Terrill Kris and Natalie who were so friendly and helpful. 
Great central location and stylish hotel.

title: Kris and Natalie Service
text:
Pleasant service, easy check in, great hospitality. They provided a room I had in the past and I enjoyed the experience. 

Great location for bars, gyms, and people who want to head to the meat packing district.

title: Love this hotel!
text: Offers a lot. Cool rooms great use of space. Awesome baths, rooms are awesome open modern but still private and quiet. Great views. Staff at Check-In very welcoming. 2 great restaurants and a cool rooftop bar/pool. Nice gym with views. Location is perfect centrally located downtown in soho.

title: Review
text: Check in was exceptional! Very informative. Gave us two free drinks after we booked reservations at the Jungle restaurant downstairs. Natalie & Kris at the front desk were terrific. Great service all around. Will definitely be staying here again.

title: Great Rooms with a View
text: This hotel was quite a find. First stayed here b/c of a Gilt City deal.  It is in a great location on Grand Street.  The roms are lovely (typical NYC size, maybe a little bigger), comfortable bed and sitting area, and a view of the surrounding downtown area.  You are close to Brooklyn, and itis near a subway stop.  It is also centrally-located in SoHo, making it an easy walk to shopping and restaurants.  The staff are very accommodating, and they are all extremely friendly.  My husband and/or my husband and two daughters have now stayed here three times, and I think this is our go-to if we want to stay downtown.  I've always been a Marriott girl, but The James may make me switch, at least for NYC purposes.  Who can argue with a complimentary wine & cheese happy hour every evening?  Cheers!

title: Good stay but some room for improvement
text:
Overall a very good stay. Starting with the positives:

- Rooms and bathrooms are clean, light and well appointed. House keeping did an excellent job each day. Bed was very comfy
- Receptionists and those on the desk on the ground floor were all very friendly
- Free wine each evening was very nice
- Great location, close to main Soho and easy access to Subway
- Good value for NYC
- Views from Rooftop bar were stunning

The not so good:

- Requested a quiet room but was told the only room available was close to lifts ( this was after check in time). I said I would take it as I didn't want to wait for another room to become available. The lift noise was fine - however the noise from Jimmys was unbelievably loud on the Saturday evening and this wasn't mentioned to me at check in.
- Welcome cocktails are only given if you book dinner at the restaurant . We didn't want to eat at the hotel as we had already made reservations for our stay so we didn't get these drinks. As your welcome drinks are supposedly included in your resort fee they should be included regardless of whether you have dinner or not
- There is free coffee and biscuits provided each morning. They should provide tea for any non coffee drinkers. Personally I think mini croissants or something similar would be more popular than the biscuits as there seemed to be a heap of them left over each morning
- There is 10 dollars credit for the minibar each day of your stay. There was no price list in my room so I had to ask at reception. Items that I took weren't replaced - is this to make you buy the items that cost more that 10dollars?
- Staff at Jimmys were not friendly at all with the exception of the girls that did table service. 

Overall, I would stay here again as I loved the views, the bedrooms and the location is great.

title: Perfect weekend get away!
text:
Great stay! The staff was friendly and accommodating (every evening, they serve wine and cheese in the lobby. On our second night,  we went downstairs around 7:45 and sadly there was no more cheese on the serving tray.  I asked a young man at the desk if there was any left and he said sadly they ran out...I said OK and went back to my room... the following night, when we got back from a play,  on the table was a big platter of cheese, crackers and grapes sitting there waiting for us - how amazing!! I’m still wondering how he found out which room we were staying in!
All that to say,  that the room was clean and bed comfortable, lots of restaurants and shopping stores nearby, subway is within walking distance and finally, many of the streets were paved in cobblestones...
Can’t wait to stay there again!

title: My birthday stay!
text: The staff was super friendly and the suite was perfect for 2 other girlfriends. The bathroom was big enough to get ready in and the decor was just right! They have a great rooftop bar called the jimmy with spectacular views of the city. It’s perfexrly located from all the great shopping on broadway. I highly recommend this hotel and would come back!

title: Canon!
text:
5 jours business pour l’un et tourisme pour l’autre. Hôtel parfait pour les deux : localisation (pour ballades ou accès transport), ambiance (lobby chaleureux et roof top à la hauteur de la ville), chambre impec. 
On reviendra.

title: Ok for toursim, not for business trip. 47USD/day mandatory extra charge is a shame, should be included in normal price.
text:
The fact no breakfast was possible outside of rooms is an issue. 
The prices and quality of in-room breakfast are an issue. 
The few cakes and fruits served in the lobby are miserable considering we pay 47USD per day for this. 
No late-check out, even a paid one, except for poor 30 minutes, is an issue for a business traveler who has a late flight. 
Pool is not heated and only symbolic.
Rooms were very clean and ok.

title: 5 Star Rating!
text:
I had to stay at the James because of my job for a night but wow! I was really impressed with the multiple amenities (wine and cheese hour!) along with the different bars/ restaurants in the building. We had a blast! Will be booking with the James again 

P.S special shoutouts to Yuon for helping us make our stay extra special with the drink vouchers!

title: Lovely week
text:
Had a great stay at the James Soho for a week - we stayed on floor 14 and the view was lovely. The location is great for a more quiet and genuine NY experience, streets away from fantastic restaurants (Carbone, Cipriani's etc) as well as shopping. 
Very close to canal st subway which is very well connected. 
We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and biscuits fresh every morning in the lobby so we could get going quickly!
There is a club in the hotel so lobby and lift is quite busy near the weekends but couldn't hear any noise in the room. 
The king deluxe room was great for 2 people, shout out to our maid Camille who went above and beyond even organising makeup!

title: Très bon emplacement
text: Situé sur Grand Street au cœur de Soho. L'hôtel est extrêmement bien situé pour se balader dans Soho ou autre. La station de métro est à côté ce qui est appréciable. Hôtel spécial car vous arrivez dans une sorte de hall et l'on vous indique la réception qui est à l'étage. Décoration design et très épurée. La réception est un simple comptoir entouré de grandes baies vitrées avec 1 ou 2 personnes y officiant. Dans le lobby des canapés et fauteuils toujours dans une ambiance très design. Nous avons beaucoup aimé les lampes et la baie vitrée offre beaucoup de clarté et sur les buildings environnants. Ordinateurs et imprimantes à disposition. Le matin café to go et différentes muffins, scones disponibles. Très agréable si l'on ne veut pas prendre un trop gros déjeuner. En fin d'après-midi vin blanc et fromages avec crackers également à disposition. Super quand on rentre de notre journée avant de repartir pour l'apéritif qui peut se prendre soit sur le bar du rooftop au 17e étage avec une vue panoramique incroyable (d'un côté la Freedom tower et de l'autre l'Empire State Building) ou autrement le bar du jungle room est absolument superbe également par contre à l'intérieur et sans vue. On peut également manger au jungle room. Les chambres sont belles mais pas très spacieuses. Un grand lit double (180 cm). Literie extrêment confortable. Grande baie vitrée également. Mini bar bien fourni - par contre il faut demander la liste des prix à la réception. Café, thé et eau toujours à disposition. WIFI gratuit dans tout l'hôtel. Salle de bain surprenante. Toute vitrée donnant dans la chambre mais rideaux que l'on peut baisser pour notre intimité (ouf c'est mieux :)) Personnel de l'hôtel sympathique et de bons conseils. Juste un seul couac pour notre transfert de départ pour l'aéroport. Nous leur avons demandé de réservé une voiture pour 3 personnes avec 5 valises. Coût USD 150.- relativement élevé mais nous l'avons quand même pris. Le jour J à 18h00 le chauffeur n'était pas là. Il est arrivé 15 minutes plus tard (ouf!!) Entre temps nous discutions avec le portier qui ne comprenait pas pourquoi cela était si cher car d'habitude c'est lui qui fait ces réservations. Il aurait pu nous réserver le transfert pour USD 75.- soit demi-prix même voiture… couac ou mésentente entre les filles de la réception et le portier nous ne savons pas. Dans tous les cas, parlez avec Eric le doorman… il est extra, très serviable et plein de bons tuyaux. En cas de questions demandez Eric !!! :) Je recommande volontiers cet hôtel. Par contre il est un peu cher… mais bon comme beaucoup d'établissement à New York. 4 nuits en chambre double sans repas USD 1600.- !! Mais bon un bel extra qui en vaut la peine :)

title: Big Thanks
text: Great stay.... very cool spot with great service. High quality all around. Great location in SoHo. I had a snafu in my travels  and arrived at hotel off a red eye from Seattle at 8:30am... they shuffled things around and got me into a room so I could shower before my first meetings. Huge thanks. Kenny in the front set me up with rides when I needed... super friendly and helpful all around. Highly recommend.

title: Perfect location, perfect view, perfect staff!
text: Having had a dreadful flight, including luggage being sent to Tel Aviv instead of NY, I was very much in need of a fabulous hotel, and I certainly found it! As a frequent traveller to NY, I have stayed in many hotels in Soho and Tribeca, and the James is now my new favourite.  My beautiful corner room with floor to ceiling windows had the best view  of downtown - waking up to the Freedom Tower glittering from the sunrise right from you bed is an experience not to be missed, so comfy with a great bathroom.  The staff are amazing. A special mention to Kenny, (an absolute legend!), Johnny, Rebecca and Yu On.. What a great team.  They all made my trip so special, and could not do enough to help.  Great gym, great food , and love the wine and cheese hour in the lobby - a great  addition, met some really lovely people there.  The location is perfect for whatever you are planning to do, with many of NY's best areas within walking distance, and several subways stations on your doorstep.  Can't wait to go back when the rooftop is open! Have already booked my next stay :)

title: Beware of hidden resort fee
text:
The hotel is clean, nice and in a great location. Rooms are a good size for New York. 
My problem was that I was surprised with a $45 daily resort fee which I wasn’t aware of. The fee is supposed to be for pool and other services (it was freezing outside, impossible to use the pool). 
When I complained they showed me that the fee was stated on the original booking, it was there but after tons of information and in small letters, it’s clearly a scam so people wont see the charge when comparing prizes. Beware.

title: Best hotel in Soho
text: I would highly recommend this as the hotel is spacious, modern and lots of light and I loved the wall to wall windows in the room. The staff is friendly and were always available to help with recommendations.

title: Best hotel experience ever. Beyond excellence.
text: We will never stay at another hotel in NYC. The James Soho can’t be topped. We arrived not knowing what to expect and left with memories and new friends. The staff at the James made this trip perfect. Terrill, Natalie, Johnny, Julian, Eric, Maurice and Paul were amazing. Natalie from the start was warm and welcoming. She was helpful and eager to make our stay perfect. Terrill and Johnny were the managers we encountered. They were attentive and caring. They went overboard to make us happy. Julian helped us with providing a rollaway bed and became a fast friend.  He was helpful and kind and best smile ever!  Eric was a breath of fresh air each day upon our return from long days of touring the city. Each person mentioned was so kind, caring and became our friend on this trip and we can’t wait to get back to see them again. My son celebrated his 6th birthday while we were staying at the James Soho. They made his day special and went far beyond the call of duty. He felt so special and connected to these amazing folks at the hotel. We can’t wait to return to NYC and stay at the James Soho!  Beyond the amazing service and people - the location can’t be beat and the rooms are awesome. True hospitality here. ❤️

title: Best location. Great views
text:
Thanks so much to the reception staff who helped make our stay so great with a room upgrade. The views were fantastic. 
Location was perfect as we walked to all our Soho, TriBeCa and West Village dinner reservations. So easy! 
Will definitely be back.

title: Nice Hotel!
text:
I stayed at the James Hotel for a quick overnight to NYC. What you need to know when making reservations--If you want a view, I suggest you call the hotel to define what they consider a "view". Rooms that claim "city" views I believe are the 1-7 floor (I may have the floor incorrect). You'll be looking into the buildings across the street. Skyline views are on the upper floors. City view refers to "tribeca" while skyline is of NYC. 

We stayed on a corner king on the 10th floor. Which has skyline views out both windows. The room is small, typical room size for a NYC hotel. The little bench seating and table make it fine for two people.

The customer service was what you would want from a 4-star hotel. 

The only down side to the hotel is that the lobby, which is cute has what feels like "older" furnishings. Would be great if they upgraded.

title: GIRLS TRIP WAS AMAZING ...Thanks Terrill
text: During a much needed girls “getaway” Terrill was a gem! He made sure our accommodations were top notch and even went above and beyond with recommendations for sight seeing! He even followed up to make sure we were happy with his suggestions. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

title: Not a five star hotel
text: Staff was friendly. That was the highlight. Everything downhill from there. Room was apparently upgraded to a king but was tiny with a large double bed. I cannot imagine a lower grade room. It was actually dirty- sticky stuff on light switches. Marked up walls. I felt entirely deceived by the ratings on Booking.com. The room was dated and tired and not clean. Hallway was dated and worn.

title: Kenny is the best
text: I've stayed a few times here on business and the hotel is quiet and has what you need with a modern flare. That said, Kenny, the front door man is the reason you should keep coming back. He knows where to get a bite to eat, he is always welcoming and inviting and you need anything - he is your man! Thanks Kenny.

title: I loved The James and already can’t wait to go back
text:
This is a lovely hotel, in an amazing location with plenty of great restaurants very close by. As a solo female traveller I felt very safe and comfortable at The James. The door men were particularly welcoming and helpful, especially Kenny. Thanks guys.
The only downside was the difficulty I had contacting the hotel by email prior to my visit, I tried a few times from the contact page on their website and had no response, I ended up having to call. I’d also suggest they add a page on their website about options of how to get there from JFK, as an international traveller that would have been very helpful for me.

title: Money would have been better spent elsewhere.
text: We've stayed in much nicer rooms, in more desirable locations in the city, for the same money. Budget materials (and a gross stain on the wall) at a premium price. The lobby is depressing, and the overall feeling of the hotel was cheap. (Very friendly staff, however.)

title: AMAZING SERVICE!
text: I just wanted to say THANK YOU to Yami and Natalie at the front desk! They were absolute angels! after a LONG hard and exhausting day they welcomed me with a glass a wine at check in and THEN when i left and came back from dinner there was a surprise bottle of wine and a super sweet note! I will never forget their generosity! Thank you two! <3

title: Great staff here!!!
text:
The staff here are just so nice! Especially Leidy and Natalie, they are extremely friendly, even my English is not that fluent as the native speakers, they are still being patient, helping me for my questions and requests. So it's recommended for both the natives and foreigners to stay here for your trip in NY!

P.S. The staffs in the front door are also awesome, Kenny and Jimmy!

title: Amazing Service & Staff
text:
Absolutely loved my stay at The James! I would come back to NYC just to stay at this hotel. Even though the room wasn't ready until 45mins after check in time they went OVER and beyond to make it up to us.  The lobby is so chill and if you have to store luggage, it's such a relaxed place to hang out.  The bar on the rooftop is also SO fun on Saturday - def go.  Corner store a couple doors down is great for some water and snacks. 

The Staff was so lovely as well. Natalie, Mavis and Johnny - thanks for everything!

title: Perfect stay!
text: I had a great experience staying at this hotel the hospitality was spectacular! The the room was immaculate, we got lucky with a stunning view and a great upgrade! The bathroom was nice and big and the designs were nice to look at. I suggest everyone to stay here!!

title: Amazing hotel with outstanding customer service
text: This is without a doubt one of my new favorite hotels to stay whenever I am in NYC.  The staff was very professional and accommodating.  I had the pleasure of speaking with Christina at the front desk who helped me check in, she was super friendly and very knowledgeable and recommended the Gitano restaurant on site which has a very tasty Mezcal drink which I particularly enjoyed.  My room was a corner room which was nice and clean and had an amazing view of the freedom tower.  I will definitely be back and will recommend this hotel to all of my business associates.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is in a great location, with beautiful views. Clean, well appointed with friendly staff. Would recommend this hotel. Amazing customer service from all staff that we encountered. Visiting NYC is great, but a stay here made it all the more special.

title: Amazing Hotel with Outstanding Customer Service
text:
If you are staying in SOHO, The JAmes Hotel is right smack in the thick of it. Its surrounded with eclectic /hip restaurants and shops. It all starts with the Ladies at the front desk! Leidy, Natalie and Mavis are super helpful with any requests and knowledgeable about the neighborhood.  Its like having your personal concierge with these ladies!

The views from the corner skyline units are NYC alltime and the beds are as comfortable and snuggly as they get at any high end hotel of the JAmes's caliber.

title: Wonderful Accommodations and Absolutely Amazing Customer Service!!!!
text: We travel a lot for and stay at many hotels throughout the country as well as internationally. The James New York, really stands out as a hotel that puts the customer first and really cares. The Manager went above and beyond to take care of every need. The kindness of the staff is amazing and of course the accommodations are terrific. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who has to be in the New York area for business or pleasure.

title: Great place on a great location
text:
The hotel is on very nice location. As I requested a high floor room, the view was beautiful. The hotel facilities are new and the rooms are clean as they should be and very well maintained. Staff is very helpful and is always willing to make your stay enjoyable.
Good choice if you want to stay in SoHo.

title: Great Hotel ran very well Special thanks to Terrill
text: Stayed here for a romantic getaway with my girlfriend. Had a bit of a hiccup at check in. "booked through a third party site". However after this issue was passed to Terrill, he handled it for us in a very timely and professional manner. He even provided us with drink tickets which was a very nice touch. All in all I would go back or recommend this hotel in a heartbeat, It's very nice modern and well maintained. The customer service put it over the top for me and made this hotel stand a cut above the rest.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
I stay here 4 times a year for work and Johnny Houston, the manager has always been more than accommodating!  The rooms are almost always comfortable except this last visit my bedsheets were more stiff/crunchy than usual.  Johnny looked into this for me and it was due to the sheets being brand new --LOL.  He made sure room service swapped them out for more "seasoned" sheets :)

Needless to say my visits at the James Soho never disappoint!

title: Johnny is the best!
text: We have stayed here several times for our work trip and Johnny has taken such good care of us! From the hospitality to the comfortable tempurpedic pillows, I would highly recommend this hotel to a friend/family member! Also - they have happy hour wine & cheese daily! :)

title: My go to NYC hotel!
text: Love love love The James Hotel. Rooms are super comfortable and the staff is so nice, especially Johnny! He is the best and always makes sure I have enough wine and cheese during daily HH in the lobby ;) Can't wait to go back!

title: Very cool. Very nice. Great location.
text: This is one of the cooler hotels I’ve stayed in. The lobby and lounge are so stylish and warm. The attached restaurant and bar are cool AF!! I booked this on pretty short notice. And for a Great price. I’ll be back!

title: Great stay
text: This was my second time at The James. I usually do not write reviews however they deserve it. The staff is amazing! The hotel it self needs a few touch ups however the service provided makes up for it. Yuon checked me in and remembered me from my last stay. At check out I believe the persons name was Jami.
