She was super sweet and Christina was nice enough to get me an afternoon coffee before I left. I forgot the housekeepers name however she was fantastic and left a thank you note in my room. I look forward to returning.

title: Great airy rooms with fun bar!
text: Stayed at this hotel for business and it was awesome. The location is walkable to great restaurants and shopping. I loved the large windows, makes any small new york hotel room seem big. I also loved the reusable toiletries vs individual bottles. Only problem is there is no light to do your makeup.

title: Weekend getaway to the city!
text: Great view looking at various landmarks of the city.  Located in one of the iconic neighborhoods of the city, this hotel was great including the service. Tyrell helped out great with information and complimentary late checkout!!

title: Favorite NYC Hotel
text: I travel a lot for work.  I have been staying at The James, since discovering it for a week long trip in 2015.  The staff is incredibly eager to please and the energy in the whole hotel is nothing but positive.  Wine hour is the best and cookie time at 8 pm never disappoints.  Not sure how they make those things, but they are incredible. Thanks for another great week last month.  We will see you again soon:)

title: Perfect boutique hotel
text:
Clean, simple, upscale without a fuss. Great location.
I was upgraded upon arrival, which was a nice surprise.
Heated bathroom floor was so nice.
Rooftop bar was great - friendly bar tender.
The sushi was insane.....so good.
Thumbs up!

title: had a Great Time
text: Had a very good time made possible by all the employees that worked their. Not one day went by that I was not asked on how I was doing and if I needed anything. it felt like a home away from home. The accommodations where excellent. the room I stayed in had the most beautiful view of the city. Cant wait to return.

title: Great staff and amenities
text: The staff were all very accommodating and friendly.  The member who really stood out was Kenny.  Right from the start, he made me feel welcome and was extremely helpful.  He provided me with a great first and last impression of my stay.  Additionally, the room was nice and the hotel restaurants/bars made for a stress-free stay.

title: Great Views in Soho
text: Excellent service, lobby, rooms, views...this is all around an amazing spot. Really attentive service from the whole team, starting with Kenny who is a rockstar. Love the whole team. Looking forward to staying here again.

title: laid back vibe, friendly staff, beautiful rooms, solid location
text: i never review anything, but my stay at The James Soho this past weekend was impressive enough that I wanted to. The staff is outgoing and kind, personable and friendly. The grounds and rooms were immaculate. The rooftop bar is stunning and lively. Some of the best views in the city. I'm looking forward to staying again in the fall!

title: Family vacation great!
text: The James was a very nice hotel for my family to stay. I came very early because of early flight but I was able to check in early into the suite thanks to Yuon.  The room was very comfortable and I had a very good view. My family enjoyed it very much. Everyone is very nice and helpful. Thank you very much!

title: Best service ever
text:
So we came from another hotel that we cancelled the order because of bad service and found this lovely hotel.
Natalie heard that we had a bad experience with the hotel before we came to them and talked with John the hotel manager.
John came to us and said that he is sorry about what we went through and that he decided to upgrade us not once to the king size room but twice to the king corner room with a view to the amazing sky scraper's.
The room was amazing, the service was amazing, the hotel was beautiful, the area was perfect.
Thank you John and Natalie!!!!!!!
We definitely will come back!

title: Clean, Convenient, Helpful, and a Great Scene
text: This is my second stay at The James Soho and it’s truly a lovely stay for such a great price in the city. The rooms have huge windows (I had a great view), the staff is super pleasant (Kenny is the best and made sure I had a car service to JFK with my bags already inside for my flight home since it was snowing and Uber would be challenging to get), and the room service hits the spot when you don’t want to go to yet another expensive fancy restaurant. There’s a very convenient subway stop around the corner, and it’s overall a great place to stay as a young professional if you need to stay in the city for work. Also, the shampoo/conditioner brand they have is amazing!

title: Birthday Weekend
text: I loved everything about the James! The staff was extremely friendly and curious, especially Kenny the doorman. The wine and cheese in the lobby was also a fantastic plus! They also had coffee and scones in the morning for their guests. The location was fantastic and I cant wait to come back and stay there again.

title: Fabulous location.  Some quirks.  Overall very good.
text:
The location was fabulous.  Easy access by subway.  SoHo is hopping, great food and shopping!  City view room was spectacular.

There were a few quirks we would not have expected in a high end boutique hotel.  Internet didn’t work for the 3 days of our stay.  Poor informational materials in the room.  Overall very good experience.

title: Kenny is the man!!!
text:
Great location middle of Soho, lots of restaurants, bars, shops and galeries. Great views from most rooms, especially the corner rooms and rooms facing One World, nice rooftop. 
The James Soho has the best concierge ever....Kenny!

title: Such a great time!
text: My husband and I stayed here for a night away from our kids and had a fab time!  The rooms are very nice (not huge, but they will do) and the beds are comfy.  The hotel has a wine and cheese hour which was the best I've ever been to.  It was about 3 hours and we just got to chill in the cool lobby before dinner.  We also ended up getting a few comp drinks at the Jimmy (thanks Terrill!) The drinks were delish and the views are great up there!  We will DEFINITELY be coming back for our next staycation. Especially when it warms up and we can enjoy the pool.

title: Very good Location, could do with some improvements
text:
My partner and I stayed here for a few days last week. The location is great, walking distance to shops/ bars restaurants, canal st subway. 

Upon arrival, we were a little underwhelmed by the service we received after seeing previous reviews about the staff being great. Very slow service and we were told we would be called if a room was free before 2pm and we did not receive any call and ended up coming back and checking in at 3pm. 

The rooms are nice but small. Lovely bathroom, heated floor and lovely robes and towels and toiletries etc. Good blackout curtains (we had a corner room so the views were great when it was sunny.) 

Housekeeping did an OK job, unfortunately each day we got back we noticed the floor was still very dusty (especially under bed and table) So our socks / feet etc became very dirty each evening just walking around! This is the main reason for not giving 5 stars. 

Lovely roof top bar too but I can imagine this is better used in the Summer.

Overall, decent hotel for the area, little overpriced for what they offer though.

title: Great Service
text: Hotel is nice,  but the staff was amazing. From the team at check-in to the woman in housekeeping this morning with the great smile to Kenny and his "can do" attitude while organizing transportation to the airport... the staff made all the difference.

title: Very good location and rooms - plus rooftop
text: Stayed at James for a week in January and enjoyed it a lot. Fresh and quiet rooms in a not too big hotel with nice service. Small lobby on the second floor with a couple of sofas and chairs leaving room for a chat before going out. Coffee and scones served complimentary too. The rooftop bar was nice but of course the pool was not really enjoyable in January. Looks good though! Location is good, with rather quiet streets and still close. I can really recommend it.

title: Nice location
text: The hotel was in a perfect location and the beds were really comfy. But the hotel haven't been updated in a while, and it looked a little run down. Also there was a lot of dust in corners and the cleaning was only surface cleaning, the floors, the bed and nightstands had stains from some kind of liquid that had been there for a while.

title: Fantastic Customer Service
text: Not only does this hotel have quiet, nicely appointed rooms, but their customer service is second to none. Johnny the Front Office Manager and Terrell were funny, friendly, and super helpful during some travel snags I ran into. I can not recommend this property highly enough.

title: So comfy. GREAT staff.
text: I am staying 9 nights for work. Moved from another hotel. The location is amazing, of course. The beds here are so much more comfortable than the other hotel. This makes a huge difference in my trip. And the staff has been so nice. I called the front desk with a small issue with my room. Leidy was on it! She had it solved so fast I almost couldn't keep up (she arranged to move me within minutes, even though it was way before check-in time and I was fine waiting).  Be aware that the room floors are wood and quite slippy in socks. Take advantage of the rubber-soled slippers in the rooms!

title: Best kept secret...
text:
Having booked a week away in
NYC we had originally gone for a well known hotel in Times Square. We lasted one night! 
After a quick search, we found The James hotel. How lucky were we, they had availability for our stay. 
The staff were amazing, especially Natalie, she went above and beyond. Our suite was warm, clean and cosy! The views were exceptional. Bed was sooo comfortable. The only reason I have given 4 stars is because the lack of magnifying mirror or any place to sit and do your hair and makeup. 
Breakfast each morning was exactly what we ordered and cooked just how we asked.
The area Soho was so much nicer than being in the centre of Manhattan. Short walk to Broadway and so many quaint boutiques on the way. 
This certainly is our go to hotel, when visiting NY. 
Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable ...x

title: "Mavis Hernandez - Front Desk - Exemplo of Good Service"
text: I´m a small TMC from Brazil, Personal Travel, and we had a very nice and simpatic service from Mavis Hernandez. We would like to thank very much for her help. She was very profissional e efficient. Exemplo of good and excellente service ! Thanks very much indeed Mavis !!

title: The perfect disaster!
text:
I wanted this hotel so bad for the big bay windows
and the view! It was my birthday and I wanted to be amazed. I even payed the extra fee for a king corner suit to ensure I got a view, told the lady on the phone I wanted to be high enough to see the city. However we arrived around 5pm on a Monday night and were put on the third floor. $380 for one night on the THIRD FLOOR. It was a beautiful room very small but nice. Bath robes, slippers, fully stocked mini bar. Nice but on the third floor 😩 when I called within 5 minutes of walking in the room to ask if we could be put up on a higher floor as previously requested, the lady at the desk offered me a better room for an extra $200(about). I asked if it was too late to leave and find a better place to stay. She said we would be charged a full nights stay. Nice ! We just left and stayed out all night doing stuff. In the morning I called 3 times for breakfast menus that didn’t come until almost 10:45 am. They do not offer complimentary breakfast you have to order from somewhere else and the prices are rediculous. We had brunch elsewhere.  Nice hotel disappointed with the service!

title: Finicky traveler
text: Centrally located, close to many restaurants. Staff go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are decent size. It is a plus to have the floor and walls of the bathroom heated. The complementary scones and coffee in the lobby every morning is very convenient and nice, too.

title: Incredible staff, felt taken care of the entire stay!
text: When we first arrived our room was close to the staff elevator which made quite a bit of noise in the night. The next day thanks to the hotel staff of Johnny & Natalie we were immediately relocated and upgraded to a better room. Johnny who is one of the managers actually moved us himself and was extremely kind. Also thanks to Jimmy and Kenny at the front door we never had issues with parking our rental car and they went above and beyond taking care of us. Can't say enough about the hospitality of this already exceptional hotel!

title: Emplacement top
text:
Nous avons passé 1 semaine dans cet hôtel et nous avons été ravi.

Accueil agréable
La situation de l’hôtel est top (quartier Soho/Tribecca avec pleins de restos et commerces proches + bouche de métro à coté), la vue depuis le rooftop et depuis la salle de fitness vaut le détour, le free wifi est de qualité.
Nous avons testé le bar du rooftop et avons passé un bon moment
Petite attention: dégustation gratuite vin + biscuits le soir entre 18h et 20h au lobby, appréciable, mais il faut arriver tôt car c'est vite vide et non rechargé.

Parmi les seuls points négatifs: bcp de bruit dans la rue (mais c'est propre à New york), les vitrages ne sont pas très bien isolants du coup c'est bruyant dans la chambre (nous étions au 5eme étage coté ruelle arrière).
Et c'est vraiment très dommage qu'on ne puisse pas accéder au rooftop avant 17h (heure d'ouverture du bar) pour faire des photos

title: Luxurious
text: I had the pleasure of staying 3 nights at the James hotel Soho. My favorite hotel experience this year and I'd definately stay again. I was checked in and helped by Terrill C who provided amazing service during my stay. Even though the hotel was full and busy, I still felt prioritized. The rooms are beautiful with extraordinary views - very clean, comfortable, and quiet. I can't wait to get back.

title: James soho needs a facelift and watch out for hidden facility fee
text: Rooms need serious renovation and updating very tired. Compulsory facility fee charged for  “complimentary” perks like drinks, coffee and minibar credit good location in west soho easy to walk soho or west village. No view.

title: A So So, SoHo Stay
text: We usually stay in Mid-town when we visit Manhattan so on this occasion we thought we'd try SoHo as it's such a fun area to explore. The James came to us with a solid recommendation and with so many choices for places to stay, we hoped that we'd picked a winner. Let's just say we were less than impressed. The property is tired and not especially clean. Elevators had fingerprints all over them and debris on the floors. Room itself was tired, a little banged up, lights that were dirty and hardwood floors that were noisy (especially when our neighbours above arrived home at 1AM in the morning). Seating in the room itself was a wire chair with some fabric on it and a bench against the wall. The shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. Terrible pump bottles for soap and shampoo did not fit properly in their holders. Staff seemed more interested in their computer screens than their guests. The one exception was Paul who was at the front door when we arrived - friendly, helpful and had a great smile. The bar that seems to be part of the hotel and rocks the weekend evenings can make for an unsavoury welcome back to the property with an entrance full of rowdy party people and noisy music. The complementary drink that we had as part of our package could only be claimed if you made a dinner reservation at a restaurant attached to the hotel. A "designer" hotel that does not have the guest's comfort in mind and only seeks to attain an aesthetic. And it's a tired "designer" hotel which makes it even less attractive.

title: Amazing location, even better service! Thanks Leidy!
text: Stayed for 2 nights, weekend getaway and could not be more pleased with our stay. The hotel was fabulous,  perfect boutique hotel with great location. Close walk to everything in Soho and Tribeca. BUT!!!! Leidy helped us out in many ways and was the best. She made extending our checkout time seamless. Will definately be back

title: Typical, underwhelming, overpriced, NYC Hotel
text:
First I must share that I did not book this hotel for a weekend getaway and be in SoHo for dining and shopping or anything.  I had a dinner in SoHo and a work meeting the next day.  All I needed was a place to leave my belongings while I went to dinner, a quiet place to sleep, and work for a few hours the next morning.  To their credit I was upgraded from a queen room to a king room upon check in.  

I would never book this hotel again.  Once I was in my room the first low point was no desk.  But rather a tiny little circular table.  Beyond that the room layout was hip/modern.  Only problem was that a few of the light switched were broken.  

Then the sounds started.  I have no clue what was going on but at 6pm in the evening it sounded like a bucket of marbles was being dumped over my room every 3-4 minutes for about an hour.  I literally have no clue what it was:  Weird guest up above or, what seemed more likely, elevator noises echoing through air duct systems.  Anyway, I left, went to dinner, and upon my return did not hear these noises.  

But then at precisely 6am it literally sounded like a tea kettle was whistling / screeching in the hallway.  I figured it had to be outside of my room but after it persisted for over 5 minutes I crawled out of bed and closer to the door to investigate.  It was screaming in directly from the vent in the ceiling of my bathroom.  Clueless as to what caused this.  Hot water early morning showers and old pipes and water heaters?  But it was LOUD.  15 minutes later it stopped. 

45 minutes after that it was the sound of footsteps on hardwood in the room above me.  At first I dismissed it as "this has to be above me" but actually had to look around to make sure there was nobody in my room.  It was that loud (and yes, I realize that at this point a reader of this review could possible ask "maybe this reviewer is nuts and is hearing things?".

Bottom line, spent a sizable chunk of cash for a small room, with some broken fixtures, and the craziest sounds I've ever heard in a hotel which stopped me from sleeping.

title: Rooftop bar
text:
This is an outstanding hotel with a very accommodating and friendly staff. The rooms are clean and modern looking. The only recommendation I have, as an ex-NYC bartender, is to eliminate the measured shots at the rooftop bar. If you get a drink on the rocks, you can barely see the drink in the glass.
Instead, free pour the drink and increase the price, if necessary. I for one would not mind paying more for a drink if I got a real drink instead of a puddle at the bottom of a glass.

title: Small rooms, great location
text: Rooms were a bit smaller than expected, to the point that the tiny desk/table/chase were able to seat maybe 2 people if they were friendly.Hotel was also louder than expected-- windy outside but didn't seem that bad, yet it was howling winds outside our room.Other than that, well, this is New York, tiny hotels are expected. The location is great tho!

title: Love corner rooms
text: I stayed here in a corner room and was pleased with the comfortable room and bed. The views are amazing!!!!!  The experience t the Rooftop bar and Gitano was excellent too. This hotel feels like a mini resort. It's unfortunate that no rooms have 2 beds but overall great stay.  The restroom was quite large and the shower has great water pressure, especially for Manhattan standards.

title: Appalling experience
text:
The James New York - SoHo is the first place I have ever reviewed. However, I just saw J4506KUnickl's one-star review from Nov 15, describing almost the same experience. For me, I am so appalled at the James and the behavior of the manager that I had to share with others.

In November, a surprise snow storm hit NYC. I spent hours in a taxi trying to get to the airport when my flight was finally cancelled. With so many flights being cancelled, hotel rooms were selling out fast throughout NYC. I booked a room at the James on Hotels.com for the night, and arrived about 30 minutes later. However, when I did arrive, reception claimed they did not have my reservation (even though I showed them my confirmation number). The manager came out and said there was no way I could have booked a room in the last half hour as the hotel had been sold out for several hours. From the other review, it appears that about 40 customers were told the same due to a "computer glitch." However, I was the only one in the lobby trying to check in at this point, so wasn't aware this was a larger issue at the hotel. So, with no other options, I booked another room on Hotels Tonight. (As a side note, Hotels.com showed no rooms available in all of Manhattan at this point!).

Fast forward a month and I see a charge on my bill for over $500 at the James New York - SoHo. I tried to resolve with Hotels.com to no avail. And here is the rub -- they called the manager who was on duty that night at the James. Even though he spoke to me in person and said they had no rooms, he told Hotels.com that I never showed up for my reservation, and so they billed me as a no-show! I have my booking confirmations, I have Uber reciepts showing I was dropped off at the James and picked up again 20 minutes later (to go to my eventual hotel that night), etc. And now, there is a comment from the manager confirming this was happening for many customers in response to J4506KUnickl's review! And yet, the manager continues to tell Hotels.com that I was a no-show. I'm still in the midst of resolving the bill with Hotels.com (another disappointment after years of being a loyal and frequent customer), but remain appalled that this hotel will fabricate stories in order to secure billings, all at the expense of the customer. Be cautious before booking a room here.

title: Brilliant!
text: This hotel is brilliant! Loved it all, from the staff to the location, the rooftop bar and the newly opened restaurant. Location is fantastic in the heart of Soho and very close to Downtown (to visit the 911 museum and local attractions). Do yourself a favor and pick this hotel for your next trip to New York, you will be very pleased. Thank you for taking great care of my family.

title: "Guaranteed" room promised for early arrival
text: We had booked into The James in December and were told that since we would be arriving on an overnight flight we should reserve (and pay for) a room that would be "absolutely guaranteed" on our arrival in the early hours of the morning. We arrived at around 5:30am and were told by the night manager that they were sorry but were unable to hold on to our reservation, despite the promise of a guaranteed room. We were given $15 to get a taxi to another hotel, The Wagner, near Battery Park (quite far away). There had been no attempt to contact us prior to our arrival and there were no apologies (even by email) following the incident despite the fact that we have stayed at this hotel many times in the past. Never again. The upside was that we far preferred the Wagner!

title: Great location, but drastically in need of an update.
text: The hotel is in a great location and is convenient to multiple subway lines.  Unfortunately, the rooms really need to be updated.  They are worn and tired.  Multiple items didn't work (lights) or were missing from the room (tv remote).  I've stayed here in the past and loved the hotel.  Unfortunately, they've done nothing to keep things fresh.

title: La vista impagabile
text: L hotel The James ha tre  pregi enormi che sono la vista,  perché nelle camere le finestre sono a tutta altezza e nell intera parete, il personale che è’ gentilissimo e la posizione a soho che ti consente di andare a piedi a chinatown, a little Italy e al west village. Per il resto c’è la metro a 50 metri e anche gli autobus sono vicini ( per chi approfitta della lentezza per guardare fuori). Sono 3 motivi importanti. Per il resto mi spiace osservare che la manutenzione e la pulizia lasciano a desiderare. Infatti per  un problema di trascuratezza mi hanno cambiato la stanza con una più bella e di fascia più alta. La sensazione che ho avuto è’ che magari stia cambiando la proprietà. Non ho menzionato il bar all’ ultimo piano molto alla moda e la piccola piscina scoperta.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text: Stayed only one night. Rooms are clean, reasonably sized and quiet. It is in a great location near restaurants, shops and transport. The rooftop bar has amazing views and great for a cocktail before heading out.

title: Great Hotel, Great Service
text: This was our second stay at The James over the Christmas holiday and it was wonderful, just as it was for our stay two years ago.  The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, the location is convenient to the subway and SOHO restaurants and shopping and, most importantly, quiet and removed from the masses further uptown.  We particularly liked Kenny at the front door on Grand Street who could not have been more friendly and helpful!

title: Overpriced, noisy and poor customer service
text: Double charged me and staff were argumentative when I queried unauthorised charges on my bill. Noisy on level 16, given there is a late night club on level 17. Overpriced given standard of rooms and overall experience. Better hotels out there.

title: Best trip !
text: This is my second time staying at The James. I was impressed with my first stay, that I knew I had to choose this place for my second. Once again, I’m left impressed with everything. The hotel as always is stunning. The staff is welcoming making the stay even better. Rebecca and Mavis were friendly and gave us the best advices on things to do.

title: An easy and fun location in Soho
text: I liked the hotel and its location so much that I intend on planning a getaway with the entire family(multiple rooms) for a weekend in the summertime.  I have all adult children, so the rooftop pool and open air bar would be a lot of fun for us.  The restaurant in the hotel looked great but we already had dinner reservations elsewhere. Great location away from uptown.

title: So personable and easy going atmosphere
text: Great staff. Very helpful in assistance with many different needs. Including a surprise cake for my daughters birthday. Kenny the valet Parker was phenomenally helpful. Directions and helpful with baggage. Great stay

title: Amazing Experience
text: My stay at the James made my trip to NYC even better. Excellent location and stunning lobby. The staff went above and beyond to meet my somewhat pesky needs. Employees like Rebecca and Jonathan were extremely warm and welcoming throughout my stay, and went out of their way to make sure I was happy and content with my stay. I would love to stay at the James again the next time I am in New York.

title: Beautiful but sloppy service
text: Gorgeous lobby and the rooms have huge windows. The location couldn't be better. But our bathroom sink didn't drain, our phone didn't work and our housekeeper took our hand towels and left her own cleaning rag. Our bill was also incorrect. The service didn't quite match the property.

title: Outstanding Customer Service!
text: My stay at the James was excellent. It’a a beautiful venue and the staff is extremely kind. Every night we had a woman named Miriem wait on us. She made the stay 20x better!! She was very accommodating and went about her job with high spirits making sure we were satisfied at all times.

title: Mariem/guest services
text: I recently stayed at The James Hotel over the holiday weekend for New Year’s and I just have to say how astonished I was by a guest services worker named Mariem. Mariem was so diligent and great at her job and so incredible warm and kind. She went above and beyond her jobs duties and my friends and I who stayed at the hotel decided to stay for another night because of how welcoming and kind Mariem was. I will absolutely be coming back to The James Hotel and hope we have the same wait staff!

title: Grateful experience!
text: The hotel staff was exceptionally nice. The concierge at the ground level went above and beyond to help park our car and take our bags each time we requested without a problem. The hotel staff also without a blink of an eye let us extend our check out time. I definitely will stay there again and will recommend it to others. Overall customer service was outstanding!

title: Great service & stay!
text: One of the best hotels I’ve stayed at. Not to mention they had the most friendly staff i have ever encountered and were able to accommodate for all our needs! Employees like Rebecca and YuOn were the most helpful, and i will surely visit again.

title: Amazing stay at a beautiful hotel
text:
I'd stayed at the James once before and thought my room was quite nice. But on my recent stay, I lucked into a suite, and it was quite possibly the nicest room I've ever stayed in, anywhere. The views both downtown and across the river were outstanding, and every detail was perfect.

The staff is helpful and unfailingly courteous. The James is also quite convenient to the subway if you're looking to see more of Manhattan or even jump over to Brooklyn. 

Overall, this is one of the nicest hotels in the city and a great option no matter why you're traveling.

title: Excellent service, amazing room
text:
Wow. I’m the first to say I’m particular based on being from hospitality industry for many years and traveled to NYC many times and my review—wow. We chose this place among others for weekend getaway with husband without kids for my bday. We used Chase credit card points to book this place—had many options but chose this place based on location, reviews which honestly were mixed. But they exceeded expectations by long shot. Why? First tip—utilize your concierge services. (As former concierge, I know this) my NYC friend couldn’t get reservation at Italian place she liked. But one call to Leidy at The James and she nailed it. I talked with her, told her our desires and she called me back next day with reservation no one else in NYC could get. Win! 

That was just the start. Then Terrell helped us-on my terms- get to Times Square for theatre tickets on time. He texted me how to most efficiently get there with step-by-step instructions via subway to avoid traffic vs taxi/Lyft/Uber. We easily arrived with time to spare. Lovely. Some other places say “I can write down instructions or just look up”. He accommodated my last-minute request with ease, sent me text with info. Perfect, lovely accommodating guest in mode I wanted vs “how I was told or how we do it”. Thank you 🙏 

Then, when we needed to shift reservation for meal at Union Square Cafe (my fav restaurant in NYC) and husband could not get reso when we wanted, Leidy, once again called and worked her magic to get us a reservation that more accommodated our needs. And proactively called us to let us know. 

The room—amazingly big for Manhattan standards with lovely view. Heated floors in bathroom is biggest thing that comes to mind, along with view. Attention to detail in the room re: shading, heat, privacy, etc.  Didn’t have ton of ammeneities but if you ask—they will bring makeup mirror, extra mint tea, toothpaste. All quickly, easily. Thank you. 

Just ask, these people want to help make your stay pleasant. Really appreciate the empowered advice culture. Also coffee and wine appreciated. And loved the rooftop bar, even in winter, was beautiful, fun and added a different experience to calm, quite, zen-like feeling I t eh hotel. Just look these lovely people in the eye, ask for what you want and they will go above and beyond to help make your stay excellent. Really lovely 4-night stay. One suggestion? Look at Kimpton and let people know of amenities with small sign in room so they know to ask for extras if they need. Will stay here again next visit due to extraordinary service.

title: Getting Worse
text: Visited with my wife for the weekend and this was our 2nd time here. It is deteriorating quickly. They seem to have a small staff unable to service guest requests quickly. We asked for extra blankets before bed and they were not delivered for almost 2 hours. We asked for our room to be cleaned before going out for a walk, came back 3 hours later and it was not cleaned. Electrical sockets were broken. Just not very good overall. Love the location but probably won't go back.

title: The James at the Soho and it's crew

The hotel is in a supreme area with many shops and acsses to Subway.

title: Lovely Hotel in a Great Neighborhood
text: I spent a very nice weekend in bitter cold NYC at The James SoHo. Overall, the room was nice and warm, the amenities were great, and the service was excellent. I especially enjoyed complimentary coffee and scones for breakfast and wine and cheese hour in the evening. John was especially wonderful - helping me get a cab, taking care of my luggage after I checked out, and getting me a car to the airport. This was my first time staying in SoHo and I loved it. I would definitely stay here again. I probably wouldn't stay on the 17th floor again though (right below the bar and a little noisy at night). Other than that, it was wonderful.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Had a terrific stay at the James this weekend. Wanted to especially thank Johnny and Yami for being complete rockstars in helping extend my stay to take a call. Love the James! It was a wonderful experience, really appreciated the accommodation by the staff.

title: Belle vue
text:
Nous avions une chambre panoramique au 5ème étage, l’hôtel va jusqu’au 17ème mais c’était bien quand même. Bar tout en haut avec super vue et piscinette pour le fun, c’est une grande baignoire!

Hôtel très calme et literie parfaite

title: Fantastic Honeymoon in New York.
text: Stayed at the James hotel for a week.It could not of gone any better, Fantastic staff and location, everybody at the hotel where so friendly and couldn't do enough for you, would definitely stay at this hotel again, The hotel has all the amenities you could ask for, but it's the staff that make it what it is.

title: Disappointed

title: Fantastic Penthouse suite.

title: Hip but let go
text:

Hotel owners should know that to charge these prices they should also invest in renovation and not just try to milk every possible penny from aged structures.
Hopefully this place will soon undergo major reno, so it can become again a nice place.

title: James
text: Great room, had the corner king suite. Good bed. Great location. Good service.  jimmy at the James was a cool restaurant, but the drinks we’re expensive and not that good. I would recommend the hotel anyways.

title: Amazing!

They view is stunning! The staff is cool  but on their game 
and there’s free wine! I’m living :) it’s a cool spot and so close to so many shops. I would suggest going to the Felix as well. Enjoy your stay!

title: Great hotel & Great service
text: We stay at this hotel 4 times a year for work and it is always a wonderful experience.  Most recently the assistance of Johnny Houston was AMAZING.  He made sure to go above and beyond in accommodating us as regular clients of the hotel.  5 stars for sure!

title: great!
text: Great Staff ..fun Vibe.. Terrific location. Beds are only queen size but if you get a room on a high floor the views are amazing. Wonderful complementary drinks and casual breakfast. I would stay here again.

title: Great location - funky decor!
text: Lovely staff and great location in SoHo. Close to everything!Rooms due for renovation, which is said to be happening early 2019. Would look forward to staying here again next year. Great gym and nice, cozy lobby.

title: Great location and cozy rooms
text:
I stayed in The James for almost a week as a first time NYC visitor. First things first, the hotel was not cheap and certainly amongst the top 10% or so in the city. Therefore I did have high expectations and for me, a great hotel is very important when I'm on holiday. Overall my stay was very good but i'll summarise all the details below.

My resort fee was included in the package I booked with my travel provider but I would have felt VERY hard done by if I had to shell out the $48 daily otherwise. I have read that only a small selection of NYC hotels charge this and it's a ruse to advertise a lower room rate, it's completely unjustified. It covers local/national calls, use of the gym, some minor amenities like free water/wine/occasional snacks in the lobby as well as a $10 daily minibar credit. To be honest, that daily credit barely covered one bottle of water or a chocolate bar. Perhaps I shouldn't moan as my fee was waived with the deal but most will have to pay this and it's extortionate for amenities that should be included as an absolute basic in a luxury hotel. Covering some phone calls, a gym which any decent hotel should have etc, for $48 daily?!

When arriving the first notable thing was the amazing location. Super easy to get to from the subway, particularly useful for a total stranger to the area, it's literally surrounded by all the different lines for Canal Street. As I got to know the area it was even more evident that it was excellently located, great restaurants, places for breakfast and world class shops very close by, all in a very safe feeling neighbourhood.

My room was pretty high up with an amazing view, I was exhausted so didn't take too much notice of the room. However, by the morning I did notice some real basics were missing-no hand soap, no glasses by the sink, the electric privacy blind between the bathroom and bedroom didn't just not work, it didn't actually exist-it must have been removed. Some of the lighting didn't work either and I just didn't think this was good enough. To their credit, without me even drawing a breath to explain the individual problems, the staff immediately offered a replacement when I asked the next morning. My belongings were moved over and the new room was great.

The rooms themselves (I was in a king size room) are surprisingly small but not overly so. There is plenty of storage, great floor to ceiling views too. The bathroom is very good, luxuriously decked out, great shower and I loved the Appelles toiletries provided-this luxurious touch made a real difference. The bed was one of the best I've ever stayed in, very comfortable and they also offered a pillow menu so I got a few extras to my taste. I would not recommend going unless you're either by yourself or in a couple, the rooms are intimate and the 'privacy blinds' in the bathroom probably aren't fully effective.

The housekeepers were super friendly and did a great job daily. I did notice though that some basics were missed, I cannot fault them and would not personally blame them as I fully expect they have very sharp turnaround times and will not be earning mega bucks. However, amenities weren't replaced properly-if I used a product it just wasn't replaced and I also had to use the same dirty soap bar all week. The sink was left a bit dirty daily. When I used the minibar (although extortionately priced I had a $10 daily credit as above), the items were never replaced-so I soon ran out of water and other snacks. Was this a ruse to get me to start using the other products in there? Saying that, you did get a large daily bottle of free filtered water so it wasn't like I was desperate.

The only real downside of the room is the noise-mainly from above and the surroundings. With wooden floors and less than ideal soundproofing, I had to use very sturdy earplugs each night. Additionally, the huge windows were badly soundproofed and even from the equivalent of probably 15 or more floors up (the whole hotel is above an elevated lobby) I could easily hear traffic noise.

TV was good and could be controlled via an app to make it easier. Also noticed a bluetooth speaker/alarm clock which was handy.

Tried the gym once and it was perfectly good with state of the art cardio machines, also amazing views in there. Small though but I doubt many people use it. Didn't use the pool as it was November...

The James has a rooftop bar and it seems to be privately owned, so many members of the public would be wandering into the hotel all evening. They would also use the lifts to get there (it's top floor) which I didn't think was that secure for guests, nor did it make me feel that special-more like we're just getting in the way of customers trying to get to a swanky bar. Having to wait for lifts because of random external guests was frustrating.

The building itself was nice, I think it's about 7-8 years old. Very nice lobby but my weird personal view of the hotel itself is from the outside it looks pretty awful, no interesting architecture apart from the aforementioned lobby (and rooftop) and it could be a holiday inn from the outside, not a luxury hotel.

Staff were always very helpful so no complaints at all there.

Tried the David Burke kitchen a few times, once for breakfast which was fine but nothing that special, once for lunch which was a very well cooked meal but very expensive indeed for what it was (I'm talking about $40+ for a chicken breast and french fries). Loads and loads of decent alternatives only moments away, you do get a 10% discount at the DB Kitchen apparently but they never actually honoured it for me! I didn't take this any further.

All in all I would recommend it and the location is spot on, especially nice to get away from the really crowded areas after a busy day. I did get a decent package but paying the full advertised rates I definitely wouldn't be doing. I feel like they could add a few more luxury touches to make guests feel special, even if really basic-how about chocolates or a little treat left in your room daily? How about a special deal with some local restaurants? What else can they think of to make guests feel more special? I'm only being really fussy based on the prices they charge but that's a good thing as there's not many negative things to say!

title: Amazing Hotel , great staff <3
text:
We spend 4 amazing days . Thanks  AKouavi for your notes and care when I were ill and thanks Jimmy and Eric for the continuos help with our bikes and the last time taxi when we were about to lose the plain ! ❤️ 
Hope see you soon 
Julieta y Luis

title: Would definitely come back!
text: Amazing stay at the James.  Thank you to all the staff for amazing service, with special mention to Johnny.  He went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed and more...incredibly kind and considerate.  Thank you for making us feel at home in NY!!

title: Great service
text: It starts and ends with Kenny at the bell desk.  He is the best at getting what you need.  Thanks Kenny.  Room was just what I needed and the restaurant downstairs is good.   Location in soho is perfect with hip shops and restaurants all around

title: Just terrible
text:
I shall try and avoid any extraneous comment:

1. There are people in the lobby who booked a week ago, many people, who are being told they have no rooms because “computer glitch”. According to hotel staff, 40 guests without rooms. The hotel staff just repeat “computer glitch”.

2. My laundry has disappeared. No one knows where it is. A real frustration as I fly out first thing, with no clothes.

3. The food and drinks are massively over priced and, at best, average and a lot is terrible. I don’t know who “David Burke” of their kitchen is (what their restaurant is called) but he should be embarrassed.

So don’t ever stay here if you want the room you booked (or any room at all), you want your laundry again or you want average quality food.

title: Great for Groups!
text: I worked with the James on a 15+ room block and they were amazing to work with! With all of the last minute changes, restaurant reservations, last minute deliveries they went above and beyond to make sure everyone was perfect and all of our guests were happy.

title: Fantastic!
text: We stayed at the James hotel - Soho in a corner King suite - very clean & spacious. Beautiful view from our room. Hardwood floors, we also had an in room tea pot that I really appreciated. Kenny was fantastic & incredibly helpful! Would absolutely stay here again - wonderful location!

title: Kenny was very helpful
text:
The hotel was comfortable, within walking distance from broadway. The hotel was very accommodating. We ordered some stuff online and the hotel was happy to receive and hold our packages before we checked in.
On our last day, Kenny, was particularly very helpful by suggesting best ways to go around the city and taking a black car instead of a taxi (cheaper at $65 to JFK)
Thank you, Kenny.

title: Lovely Soho hotel
text: We just spent four nights at the James hotel and loved it. The location is excellent being within walking distance of Soho, Greenwich village, Brooklyn bridge and the freedom tower. We booked a room with dual aspect windows and we were not disappointed, the view downtown was stunning - we loved it so much we slept with the curtains open. A nice touch was the coffee and pastry in the lobby in the morning. The rooftop bar was also a fun venue to visit. The service we received was great. If we come back to New York we will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent location and great roof top bar
text: We spent 5 nights at the James Soho and really enjoyed our stay in this establishment. Our room had a good size for the New York standard and all the staff was very professional. A special thanks to Brian from the Front Desk who helped us manage our reservations problem in the most dedicated way, before our arrival.Kenny at the Front Door had also been very helpul the day of our departure, paying attention to every details and giving us great recommandation for ourt last lunch.Thank you to all, we will definitely be back !Laurent Luber

title: Hip and Happening Hotel in Soho
text: Stayed here with a girl friend to celebrate her Bachelorette party weekend.  Super hip and happening hotel with a lively rooftop pool and bar scene. Room and bathroom were clean.  Great location in SoHo.  Definitely fun place for those looking for a scene, but not too over the top that you can't fit in either :)

title: Kenny @ The James in Soho
text: This review is strictly about Kenny at The James hotel in Soho - hands down some of the best customer service I've ever received!!  He is so personable and does a great job making you feel appreciated.

title: Amazing Staff!
text: This place is the best! The hotel is amazing - very clean and comfortable and in a great location. The staff really made our experience incredible, especially Johnny who was extremely personable and hospitable!

title: World class hospitality
text:
Friendliest most welcoming staff in New York City.
Unparalleled customer service.
Clean, chic, quiet.
Special mention to Johnny who goes over and above to make one feel at home.
Would highly recommend.

title: Great hotel with a great location
text: The hotel is spot on for a visit in SoHo and is very nice :-)I you visit the hotel - remember to check out the RT - Rooftop Bar, great view and drinks.Every morning there is scones and coffee - in the afternoon wine and chees - GREAT !

title: Amazing
text: Amazing place to chill,with the best location. everyone it’s so nice and helpful. And they have a lobby, my favorite place to chill and drink wine, taste some cheese, and the best thing is: it’s free!  RECOMENDED!!

title: Nice location
text: Its there in the middle oh Soho in Grand street. Location is perfect, to visit village, downtown. Very quit area and the view of my room was the world trade center. Rooms are very spacious for NYC standards, they are clean and comfortable, shower os good. Just make sure is the james Soho and not nomad. They give you complimentary coffee and scones in the morning. Room service os not that good, but now with ubereats you can have any food delivered to your room and with 2 kids and a cold weather that was a life saver. Very nice hotel I will definitely  stay there

title: Hidden charges
text:
Just be aware of the hidden charges in this hotel $40 a day facility charge, for things your expect to be in the total room charge.Your charged for the gym and wifi even if you don't use them.we were on a city break so we are hardly going to sit in the hotel all day !!!,also this charge was never once explained to my wife or myself.I actually thought for the amount I paid I'd get everything included we didn't even get a breakfast.average breakfast $50 a day for a couple.better breakfasts in pret.
Emailed the manger to explain our bill no reply,they only answer if you put a review in,and it's buzz words I've heard time after time from classroom mangers.
Best thing about the hotel was our chamber maid she did a brilliant job 
The rest is overrated and overpriced 
Would never look at this hotel again

title: Great stay incredible staff
text: I had the most amazing three day weekend here my bed was so comfortable cleaning staff could not do enough even with the tight space they rearrange our room  to fit a extra bed and make it more spacious for New York City this hotel was very quiet and at the same time not far from the major attractions will definitely stay here again

title: Unacceptable noise from the rooftop bar and related storage areas on same level as guest rooms.
text: The hotel might fine if you can avoid getting a room in the top floor, but my 14th floor room was a horrible experience due to the amount of noise from the rooftop bar (through the ceiling) as well as from the bar staff carting drinks and supplies to and from their 14th floor storage room, past my door, until well past 1am. The staff sounded sympathetic when informed, but didn't have any other room for me, and the lack of rest until way to late into the night ruined the stay.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Excellent place to stay! Spacious considering it is NYC! Great little complimentary happy hour and coffee and scones in the morning!  Vasylyna welcomed me when I arrived and was just a charming person. Eric and Kenny who both greeted me in the morning and evening and provided me with a wealth of suggestions where beyond helpful. I will definitely return here.

title: Amazing stay at the James
text:
Loved this place! Great location and amazing view. Stayed in room 1103- high enough up that I didn’t get a ton of traffic noise. Extra bonus, euro-style windows actually open. 

Super friendly receptionist, Brian, was extremely helpful. 

Only regret was only 1 night stay.

title: Great experience
text: A great experience at James New York Soho. Good evenings at Jimmy rooftop bar. Appreciate the services of Kenny at front door. In general the staff is one of the best of the city. The room was always clean and perfect.

title: The James Soho - Exceĺlent Service
text: 5 stars to the crew working at The James in SoHo, with a particular shout-out to Michael Daniels from In-Room Dining. My fiance and I had an exhausting trip and Michael really cheered us up with his prompt service, professionalism and incredibly pleasant personality. He not only delivered delicious food but pointed out some incredible sights from our incredible 11th floor view. Very impressive service all-around at this hotel.

title: Another great experience.
text: The support staff were friendly and helpful, especially Kenny. The room was clean and comfortable, and the rain shower is always a plus. Housekeeping did a stellar job, which was just like my previous visit.

title: Can’t wait to come back!
text: Love love love this hotel! From arrival to departure it really felt like my home away from home during my weekend getaway. From the complimentary drink at check-in to the amazing rooftop bar views, the stay was one of the best I've had in all my visits to NYC. Brian at the desk was my saving grace helping me with directions and helping me navigate my way around the area. I really can't thank him enough! 10/10 would recommend this place if you're looking for the best of the best when it comes to hotels.

title: Solid, hip, clean, relatively quiet
text: Staff made sure we were happy. Thank you Johnny H, Kenny, Jim. Large windows bring in much light. Windows open too!. Sleek modern design. Outdoor restaurant and bar, on terrace separated from typical street noises. A block away from the Jackie Robinson museum, 3 blocks from "Cro-nut" originator Dominique Ansel Bakery.

title: Great hotel in a good location
text: Loved this hotel, very stylish, great room and very comfortable bed. The rooftop bar "Jimmys" is a fab venue, with amazing views, drinks a bit pricey but worth it. One of the best features is the location, there are 3 subway stations nearby and it's walking distance to the World Trade Centre. There are lots of small, atmospheric bars and restaurants within walking distance. I'd definitely stay here again. The only disappointment was the food service, which was slow and the breakfast was overpriced for what you get

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
The James Soho is conveniently located in Soho, right off 6th ave making it accessible to all of Soho shops and restaurants, and easy to get to midtown.  The rooms are smaller but well laid out and very comfortable.  There are only a few rooms per floor which also helps keep noise to a minimum.

The door staff and front desk staff are very well educated and courteous. Friendly environment.

The restaurant on site is a real gem with great selection of well prepared items.  Lots of options with high flavor.

title: Loud doors
text: Hotel clean, staff great, Kevin and Eric made sure that all our needs were met only complaint would be that doors from adjacent rooms slam shut making incredibly loud noise, Rooms are a little on the small size.

title: Bad times at the James
text: Checked in 10/06/2018. Quite simply one of our worst hotel experiences ever. Dirty room,,,,crumbs and paper on a scratched up floor.  The dresser was chipped in two places with the veneer peeling off. There was a small cheap looking table that was warped and stained. Only one hard chair and a hard bench to sit on. They switched our room to a cleaner one but forgot to bring up a bag. Totally screwed up our afternoon. One towel, no bath matt, NO TOILET PAPER! Had to unplug the bedside lamp to to plug in the charger, not enough outlets. There was no attention to detail and needless to say would never stay there again. And it cost $700.00!

title: Great Hotel, Friendly Staff
text: Fantastic location, close to all shops and restaurants. Hotel is in great conditions, very clean rooms. Great amenities, and beautiful roof top bar and lobby area. Overall very comfortable stay. Staff is very professional and helpful. Particularly Johnny in the Lobby is exceptionally friendly and welcoming. I met a friend in the lobby prior to dinner. Johnny's hospitality made us feel right at home. Thank you Johnny!

title: Amazing Hotel and great location!
text: I recently stayed at The James in Soho, Manhattan. I enjoyed my stay very much, especially the location. So many great shops and restaurants in the downtown area.I was a little turned around by all of the street names (I am used to the number system, since I usually stay in midtown). I met a young woman named Christina in th elevator. She asked how my stay was going and when I mentioned that to her she was very helpful and oriented me with the Soho and Tribeca area. She told me to contact her if I needed anything. This was a great touch to an already amazing stay! I will be back.

title: Outstanding Experience
text:
Location is prime! The bar and the service overall is outstanding. Size of the room is ok (nothing out of the ordinary). Would suggest better service at the Treehouse restaurant.
Would suggest security at the restaurant door to the Street. I went to the bathroom once while having breakfast and a homeless walked out of the bathroom. It was not something I was expecting. Love how the bathroom and shower are "mixed" with the bethroom with a see through glass… but I would recommend a drape or something that could go down so when you are in a real need of going to the bathroom there is a bit of privacy with your couple  

Yu-On at the Lobby is very profesional and with great disposition.

title: Girls in the City
text: Loved The James. While waiting for our room to be ready we were given coupons for free drinks with lunch. The room was very clean and quite, the beds were comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly especially Percy!

title: Hip and quaint secret soho
text: I love coming back to this hotel – you will almost pass it when the Uber driver pulls up. It’s cutely tucked away on Grand Street and when you settle in for a drink (or great meal - hello Branzino or caviar and eggs) at the garden bar or the rooftop – you’ll know why you came.  They do one of the best jobs of taking a small space and making it comfortable and stylish that I’ve seen in New York. The bathroom is even functional and roomy. The windows are big and so are the views (at least mine) and they still have a mini bar – yay!   The handsome manager’s name is literally Johnny Houston – how could anything go wrong? I think they had me at check-in cookies :-)

title: Great one night away at The James Soho!
text: From a lovely check in with the friendly staff to the pretty modern lobby with fun design elements to the clean and comfortable room with updated modern bath to the complementary wine and cheese hour, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Fast elevators, modern lobby, dog friendly, A close walk to Soho shopping.  I walked to a nearby studio for a trampoline workout (fun), there were coffee shops and restaurants nearby and we even managed to find a free overnight parking space across the street (there seemed to be many). The James Soho was great and we will 100 percent stay here again (I have never said this about a NYC hotel!). Thanks to staff Rebecca and Brian for their kindness!

title: the best hotel for a soho nyc holiday
text:
Our stay at THE JAMES OF SOHO was the best of any in New York City.  The staff was wonderfully helpful from the moment we arrived.
The location is perfect for a lovely stay in the city.  The proximity to all the super restaurants and shopping and metros makes this our go to hotel.  We could walk everywhere or catch the subway at the corner.
The rooms though small are wonderfully appointed with robes, slippers, big soft fabulous towels and a huge window overlooking the city.  The heat and AC worked perfectly and were both quiet and dust free.  The linens were always clean crisp and fresh.
The bathroom was large with a super shower.  I appreciated the hard wood floors and lack of carpeting as this creates a much cleaner atmosphere.
We enjoyed the mini breakfast of coffee and scones and wine and cheese in the afternoon and drinks in the sky bar at night. 
To me and my daughter who come to the city for a holiday every year, we have now found the only place we would book for sure.

title: Great time at the James
text: The rooms were clean and nice, our room had a nice view. The staff were very welcoming and attentive. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and lounges near by so there was plenty to do. We will stay again.

title: Una experiencia maravillosa en SOHO
text: Decidimos visitar este hotel en un viaje corto desde Miami. Nos encanto! Lo mejor de todo es el personal tan amable que trabaja acá. Todos son muy agradables y dispuestos a ayudar al cliente, aun cuando no hablamos ingles.

title: The James
text:
This modern, trendy hotel in SoHo is perfectly located, clean and has excellent customer service. Like all hotels in NY the rooms are small but all facilities are provided.
The reception area staff, Mavis and Laidy, could not do enough to help us. Always available, happy and helpful they were first class.

title: Accommodating Crew
text: Johnny and Leidy  were examples of two great managers who work at the James Hotel.  They were super accommodating and professional.  The hotel is at a great location, although I believe the rooms/restaurants are over priced and needs some technical maintenance.  I believe the crew is very friendly and they will help in any way they can!  I highly recommend staying at this hotel and enjoy the roof-top bar/pool and view!

title: I liked this hotel but...
text: After the first day I came back to my room at 4:10pm to shower and relax before dinner and I could not because the room was not cleaned. Had to call to get cleaned and leave for an hour....this was totally unacceptable.  About 30 minutes before leaving for dinner the room became hot and I noticed the air conditioning was not working. Engineer was quick to come to room but took another 15 minutes to fix. There was some problem earlier in the day and I guess it did not occur to hotel to check everything was working.

title: First time at the James Soho
text: Cool, modern, great service, laid back vibe, great food. Doesn't feel like our staying at a hotel. Will stay at the James every time I visit NY!!! Hotel huts it out of the park on every aspect. Two thumbs up.

title: Rooftop pool.
text: Perfect for the hot summer days this hotel has a nice pool with fantastic views.  Walking distance to everywhere in Soho and the lower east side.  Rooms are small and no king size beds.  Great restaurant all around the hotel.

title: A Summer Night Away
text: We arrived at the hotel, handed them our luggage, and were taken upstairs to the main desk, passing an amazing mosaic made from computer keyboard keys. Honestly we booked through a third party so you never know what type of reception you may receive. We were greeted by the friendly staff, dressed in simple blue jeans and shirts, and discovered they had upgraded us, at no charge or request, to a king high floor city view room. They even verified our rate was through a third party and the resort fee was included. But here, take 2 drink vouchers that can be used at our outside garden bar at your convenience too. What lovely treatment! As we got to the elevator, we wondered if they were going to chase us down to say they had us confused with another guest. But no! The room was small, as expected since this is NYC, but very hip and modern, with crisp white linens, full length draperies, large expansive windows and a small sitting and coffee area. And the view was out of this world! You could see all the way to the to the river and beyond to New Jersey. There were no other buildings blocking this 16th story view. The nicely appointed dark tiled bathroom was actually a glass walled room, with a functional tree patterned screen for privacy. Pretty funky! What a wonderful place. Don't forget to visit the outside bar for nightcap and check out the view from the pooltop deck as well. It's lovely! Thanks to all the staff for making a quick stopover a real treat. We will be back!

title: Amazing front desk staff!
text: The front desk staff are all exceptional, any questions I had, they had answers too. They were overly accommodating and professional. Leidy and Mavis in particular were beyond helpful. Any time I saw them they both had a genuine smile on their face and were ready to assist in any way possible.

title: Hip and fun
text: I had a great experience at the James - i recommend for anyone coming to NYC and wanting a hip place. The rooms are cute, and the beds are extremely comfortable - one of the best nights of sleep I've gotten! A hot spot for sure.The young gentleman at the front, Brian, was extremely helpful in getting me situated and pointing out some great neighborhood spots. I really felt like I belonged in the city, which is hard to do! The drinks were very good - some a bit strong, but delicious.

title: Great Spot!
text: Another amazing stay at The James! If you want to be in the SoHo area this is THE place to stay. Amazing views from JIMMY and the best in room dining I’ve had in a while. The free drinks from Vasilynna at check-in were also a nice welcome! Shout out to Brian and Yuon for being so hospitable and also for getting me in early on a Friday. Will definitely be back soon!

title: In the heart of Soho, a hip jewel!
text:
The location, the comfortable room, the hip rooftop bar, the service all added up to a transformative stay!!
The staff was extremely helpful, from Brian and Maurice at the front desk, Robinson, the engineer (I was locked out of my safe and he quickly resolved it), Mark, one of the household crew, Omar and Eric at the front door were all gracious and accommodating!

title: Great room, super friendly staff, freaky rooftop pool
text:
This is a really great hotel. It has a fantastic location in SoHo, and our room was really nice and modern with an amazing comfy bed. The view was superb as well. You're located by so many great restaurants, bars and shops, and Chinatown is a short walk away as well. The staff here are beyond friendly and professional, and they accommodated our early check in and took care of getting us a black car when we were ready to leave to JFK.

This place gets a lot of exposure for the rooftop bar and pool, and we did go up to check that out. That was pretty freaky. First, I thought it was strange that the pool closes at 2 p.m. on Saturday and Sunday. Well, we found out why. We went up to check it out, and the elevator doors open to a super loud club DJ and a packed bar and swimming pool area. There were a couple of bikini girls in the pool, and lots of fancy Jersey Shore-dressed types of people packing the perimeter so you couldn't really get to enjoy the view from the roof. the bar was crowded too, so we didn't try to get a drink. It was way too much for such a tiny space. And at night, they have a velvet rope bouncer entry process, so if you want to go up there at night you have to pass muster there.

All that said, it didn't negatively impact our stay. We thought that was pretty funny, and I'm glad we went up there to see what it was to see we weren't missing anything. We just went to other spots out in the neighborhood and had a great long weekend stay. But hey, if you are into that rooftop scene, maybe you'll like the hotel even more. Nothing wrong with that at all.

title: The best hotel that Soho has to offer!
text: This hotel has it all, great rooms, fast reliable internet, amazing location, great downstairs restaurant, amazing rooftop bar/restaurant/pool but most of all the best staff you can encounter. Thank you Maurice and Yu-on for making my stay that much more enjoyable!

title: Best boutique Hotel ever stay in NYC
text: Love the personal treat.Hope it stays the same .The personal is great .The cookies are great.Bar tender the best. Always helping everybody .I will defenetly come back soon and use more the pool and

title: No recomendable
text:
No volveria a este hotel ni lo recomiendo. El precio es carisimo para lo que es, con ese mismo dinero o menos hay mejores hoteles 5 estrellas. 
Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas y con detalles de falta de cuidado. No cuentan con lo necesario si el hotel esta lleno. Por ejemplo, te ponen pocas toallas, algodon, cargador del celular, almohadas extras erc. Se quedaron sin..... no puede pasar en un lugar donde dice ser de categoria y donde cobran semejante precio.
El staff del hotel muy desagradable, poco colaborariva y grosera.
La zona en la que esta tampoco es recomendable....
Mucho mejor Greenwich y el West Village

title: The best hotel experience
text: Rebecca and Yu-on were tremendously helpful during my stay. Whenever I had a question or a recommendation, it was always delivered  beyond expectation. I had an overall great experience because of the customer service quality from them. I highly recommend booking a room here and I look forward to lodging at his hotel whenever I visit New York again.

title: Above Average - and that's all you need... According to The James
text:
It's our third time to The James in a span of 7 years. 
First time it had just opened, second time was a few months after that, and the third was exactly 5 years later (to the date).
All in all, its still the same James: minimalist, good enough but they don't spoil you in anyway.

Areas for improvements:

1. Rooms are too bright, the moment the sun comes up, you're going to wake up (unless you don't mind sunlight)
2. Housekeeping is good, but it's a bit like housekeeping at home; if you don't follow up and remind them to refill certain amenities/ mini bar, they might not. If you don't inform them that you're leaving, they may forget to make the room (happened a couple times).
3. Concierge service is friendly, but don't expect to get that "impossible booking" through your hotel, might as well book yourself.
4. If you're in a room that's close to the elevator, expect to hear every single time the elevator moves - very annoying.

In terms of location, probably the best (for me) in NYC, and their AC system in the room is pretty good (if you like to sleep in a cold room, you'll love theirs).
They also have coffee and muffins in the morning (complimentary) as well as wine and cheese in the evening; though the fact that they moved it down to the restaurant as opposed to the lobby is a bit of an annoyance; particularly in the morning.

Next time I visit NYC, I would hesitate to go back, not necessarily from any shortcomings on this side, but if you're like me and you enjoy being spoilt rotten on a vacation, this may not be the place for you - if you like things simple and to the point, they do that very well.

title: I'll be back.
text: If you have never been to NY before here's a tip stay in SoHo, not mid-town.  And the James Hotel is beautiful, luxurious, and perfectly located.  The views are spectacular and access  to the subway (multiple lines) restaurants and shops of SoHo makes it incredibly desirable from my point of view..

title: Great boutique hotel in fantastic area
text: Nothing to complain. Great location food is great everyone very helpful. Will return and recommend this hotel.   Rooms are nicely decorated and spa like bathroom  hotel has a rooftop pool with great view of manhattan

title: Très bien situé avec une superbe vue
text:
J’ai séjourné dans cet hôtel 1 nuit avec un de mes amis. Notre chambre se situait au 15 ème étage, la vue est époustouflante.
La literie est très confortable et la salle de bain toute vitrée, très plaisante.
Nous avons profité de la piscine sur le rooftop mais Petite déception sur la décoration au niveau de celle-ci, peut faire mieux pour le standing de cet hôtel.
Et les ascenseurs ne sont pas très rapide.
Le personnel est très sympathique et serviable.
Cet hôtel est extrêmement bien situé à quelques pas de SoHo.
Je le conseille pour de cours séjours à NYC.

title: Very Nice
text: This is a really wonderful hotel and it is a good thing there are a couple in NYC though I’ve only stayed in this one.  Really solid service which is calibers above the competition at this price point.

title: Nice Stay
text: Overall, we enjoyed our stay here.  The Deluxe King Bedroom was modern, comfortable and clean.  We felt a bit discombobulated with the reception area.  The Lobby is not on the ground floor/main entrance and there no clear signs as to where to go to check in.  There was a desk at that entrance but it is not always attended.  The rooftop pool is not fully accessible on weekends as they open in the afternoons to the public for young crowd/partygoers with very loud music.  I was a bit disappointed because I chose this hotel for the nice rooftop outdoor pool.  We did use the outdoor patio on the second floor for drinks.  We also liked the location as it was close to neighborhoods like Soho, West Village, LES and Battery Park City.  Lots of restaurants and shops nearby.  We didn't really have much interaction with the staff but everyone we came across were pleasant.

title: Dreamy Oasis
text: Last night was my second stay here. Just extended for another night. Such a beautiful space and staffed by attentive, lovely people. Rebecca, Jonathan and Brian are amazing. I love it here, rarely leave the property. Art, green space, beautiful lobby, pool and amazing food. Grateful for this city retreat!

title: Anniversary Celebration
text: The James Soho hotel staff was more than accommodating. The staff was extremely helpful and ensured that my wife and I enjoyed our stay. The room, the service, and the food was great. I highly recommend the hotel to anyone. In-room massage, pool, restaurant and bar. It was all worth it. Not to mention the hotel provides a great view of lower Manhattan. All around, a great deal.

title: Horrible Rooms
text: Don't waste your money, it's overpriced and the rooms are trashed. Rooftop Bar is GREAT but other than that stay elsewhere, they need a complete overhaul and they are aware yet they advertise as if this is a 5 star, it's a 2 at best. I've stayed in 100's of hotels in NY and this is by far the worst. I actually could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton again for what they charges here. So disappointed and basically ruined my Birthday weekend.

title: Supernöjda!
text: Superfin personal, väldigt hjälpsamma med alla frågor vi hade. Fina välstädade rum! Fin pool med underbar utsikt! Bra läge på hotellet, lite störig trafik men så är de i stan som aldrig sover. Vi är jättenöjda och kommer tillbaka!

title: Perfect Hotel for a weekend getaway
text: Stayed at the James for a night to check out the neighborhood and all its amenities. From check in to check out, everything was flawless. Complimentary cheese and wine was a great start to the night. The room had an amazing view and perfect size for what we needed. Love the rainfall shower. Complimentary drink tickets were given but we did not have time to use them. Instead we opted to check out the Jimmy rooftop lounge Great views of the city. Drinks were tasty and perfect for a nightcap. We will return sooner than later.

title: Wonderful rooftop in Soho
text: Beautiful location in the heart of soho with amazing view on the Town. The staff is really welcoming and professional, always ready for your needs. The rooftop is really enchanting and the restaurant is very good! Thanks to Brian for his cordiality and for the upgrade in an awesome room.

title: Trendy hotel in Soho!
text: Love the modern decor!Service: Requested towel twice and it took 40 min to arrive to our room. We needed to store our bags in the closet but bell man was absent for a while. Recommend 2 bell men for better service. The beds were fair. Overall, would return! These things can all be solved. Loved the vibe!!

title: Exceptional Front Desk Team and Beautiful Hotel
text:
I stayed here twice this summer. Once with my girlfriends for a Girls Night Out in the city and another time with my boyfriend. Both times were phenomenal thanks to the exceptional front desk team. Everyone was so helpful and personable, they definitely went above and beyond to make us feel welcomed. Elmo and Vasalyna introduced themselves when me and my girlfriends stayed and they were so friendly and accommodating to our large party of 7 girls. I met Jonathan during my stay with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed our time talking with him. 

The rooms here are impressive, well-lit, and immaculately clean. The mini bar is well kept and offers a great selection. My favorite part of the room was definitely the heated floors in the bathroom though. My girlfriends and I couldn't stop talking about how amazing they were. We also had a great time at The Jimmy upstairs and David Burke Kitchen, both of which have thoughtfully-crafted cocktails. The Garden is such a beautiful escape from the busy city, and they allow dogs too! I had a fantastic time both times and would definitely recommend it. The atmosphere is so fun and lively. 

Special shoutout to the front desk team who made our stays so memorable! Maurice and Yu-on were hilarious and recommended us to go to San Carlo for dinner, and it was such a special and romantic dinner. That meal definitely has a special place in my heart. Also, Rebecca, Mavis, and Brian were wonderful, and so sweet and helpful always! It's the people that make the place. I'll be back! :)

title: Such a great place!
text: Maurice, Mavis and Johnathan were exceptional! Such great staff. Super cute hotel. Definitely coming back! Awesome rooftop pool and fun bar. The corner rooms were really neat. Amazing view of the city. And the staff was really good looking haha.

title: Great Location
text: Hotel sits in a great location. Restuants and shopping are right outside the entrance. Right in the heart of Soho. Upon arrival both the doorman and Rebecca made us feel extremely welcomed. Small but quaint rooms that are immaculately clean. Large open shower was convenient as we ran around in the heat all day long. Nightlife is also right up stairs. After the pool closes at 4 rooftop bar opens which was awesome. This allowed for us to mingle with the locals who come to enjoy the cocktails and the views of Soho which looks out at Jersey city. We will definitely stay at this hotel again probably with the month as it was that great of an experience.

title: Great Service and Location
text: The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and exceeded my expectations. The rooftop bar is fun and popular among the locals. I was visiting for business and this hotel was perfect for my needs.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: The James Hotel is a beautiful boutique hotel and our room had an amazing view both walls were all windows.  Room was very clean with a modern vibe.  Plenty of space for two people, large bathroom too and comfortable bed.  I will say I was a bit turned off when we first checked in because the lobby had curtains that were torn and stained.  The bathroom in the lobby was dirty and a bit outdated.  Hotel staff is very nice.

title: Great stay made even better by staff
text: Spent a night at the James to celebrate my birthday and was not disappointed. The hotel itself is in wonderful shape and the location is perfect, but the friendliness and 24/7 assistance from staff made it even better. Special shout-out to Yu-On for going above and beyond to make my stay enjoyable. I'll definitely be back.

title: Great staff and amazing view!
text: First off, I would like to commend Johnny and say how much of an amazing person that he is. He is very professional and caring to all of the guests staying at The James. He also assisted us through email to get our next trip booked for Fall Fashion Week. I can't say enough great things about him. Kenny was also very helpful with the things we needed when checking out as well. The whole staff were ready to help with any and everything we needed throughout our stay. The rooftop pool is amazing and Jimmy was so much fun on Sunday night! The view is amazing all day, but so beautiful after the sun goes down. The James New York - SoHo is the only place I will stay when I come to New York.

title: Warm Welcome from Staff
text: It was so nice to receive a warm welcome from the staff after a long bus ride from DC. Maurice, Johnny and Yu-on made sure we had everything in our room to make it comfortable for us. We went downstairs to have drinks at the David Burke Kitchen and watching how kind Martin was while training Brian was so heartwarming. I wish I had Martin to train me how to make some of the yummy drinks we had!
