Restaurant manager Percy recognized us from walking on the streets to the hotel and was glad we had chosen this place to stay. This will be our go to place when we come to the city to visit our daughter while she lives here. Thanks to all the staff that go out of their way to make this a place to feel like home.

title: Amazing views in chic Boutique
text:
I have stayed in the James Hotel three times now and they have consistently given exceptional and personalized service. The rooms are decorated in a very chic modern clean look and the rooms have incredible unobstructed views. 
The views from the rooftop pool area cannot be beat. This is now my go to hotel in New York and I could not recommend more highly. 
It’s been a wonderful area walking distance to so many stores and shops right in Soho and a short walk from the West Village.

title: Awesome for a fun time !
text: I stayed here on Sunday for a night out with my best friend. I live in CT and wanted to have a fun night out in NY. We each got our own separate room, both of which were beautiful and very clean. I had a corner room on the 5th floor . . what a view!! My favorite part was the rooftop pool, which was small but had a really live party from 3pm-1am. It was a very mixed crowd of attractive adults. Another perk was the service. Staff was very helpful and we were even given 4 free drink passes upon our check in. I had a great night to say the least & would stay again anytime!

title: Average, nothing special
text: Hotel rooms worn.  Could use a renovation.  Faucet in room stuck on hot.  Sink drain did not stay open.  Shower tiles worn.  Staff was very nice.  Would not stay here again. Location is ok.  Outer limits of soho.

title: Worst. Hotel. Ever!
text: The entry smells, the sheets are scratchy and the staff is not helpful. You have to go up multiple levels just to get to the right elevator.  Do not stay here - there are better hotels at better rates nearby!

title: Awesome hotel!
text: Luxiorious, clean, good location, excellent service! The rooftop pool was wonderful even if the open hours for guests where a little on the down side. A little pricey as most hotels in Manhattan, but really worth every penny!

title: Mooi hotel, goede service.
text: Kamers zijn netjes en schoon. Heerlijke regendouche en goede bedden. De service is uitstekend. Erg behulpzaam personeel, ze nemen de tijd en moeite om je met vragen en problemen te helpen. De Jimmy rooftop bar en pool heeft echt een super mooi uitzicht over Manhatten.

title: Average Service, Average Experience
text:
My wife likes boutique hotels and Soho so I thought we’d try this place.  The room was ok, average standard, very minimalist style and quite small for a suite.  The service was average, wheeled our own bags out when we left, room service often wouldn’t answer the phone and when they did they were abrupt.  Service at the garden restaurant was very good though.  The gym was good quality with a great view on the top floor.

There are better boutique hotels in Soho like the Crosby street where we had a great stay during another trip.  I’d also avoid as a family as there are crowds lined up at the lifts for the rooftop bar often, same lifts as to the rooms.  You also miss the service standard of a classic hotel which we got when we went to the Langham for the later part of our stay in NYC this trip.

title: Girls weekend
text: Had an amazing time at this boutique hotel. Rooms were super clean and nice. Kenny by far have the most amazing customer service! Super attentive and friendly!! Made our arrival and departure seemless!! Can’t wait to come back!

title: Amazing hotel
text: The James is one of the best hotels we’ve stayed at in New York.  Everyone was friendly. The front desk had great advice on things to do, places to see , and where to eat. Becky and Yu-On were a great help in making this trip unforgettable! They were an absolute delight !

title: SoHo So Good
text:
Annual visit to NYC and we wanted to stay in the SoHo district because there is more to do. Found this hotel, located on the corner of East 29th and Madison. Small property with great location. Upgraded to corner room which was smart because a peek into the standard room revealed small rooms.  Do the upgrade. 

Great restaurant and bar in the hotel. Scarpetta restaurant. Excellent service with food to match. The bar has great small plates and live music. Hotel staff was attentive to any needs. 

Our room was huge for NYC with king bed, seating area and reasonably sized bathroom. The towels in the bathroom were huge,  the soaps for the shower were plentiful. No issues with WiFi, it worked well. 

Great location that we will use again on our return visit.

title: The James SoHo
text: We stopped in for one night in the city after a wedding in CT. The service was wonderful! We instantly received an upgrade without asking— thank you!! SoHo/NYC in general is dirty, but this boutique hotel was very neat. My husband almost died when he went into the bathroom and he could see into the bedroom... but the shade fixed that. Very modern decor. Great view. I slept very well. Wonderful location. We popped up to the rooftop before the party started... wonderful views. Several reviews mention this being a nuisance and it really wasn’t. Wish we stayed longer!

title: Hotel moderno e confortável
text: Ótimo hotel no Soho. Quarto pequeno porém bem confortável, com ótima qualidade do sono e limpeza. Ótimas instalações e bom atendimento. A localização também é muito boa, fica em uma rua tranquila porém perto de boas atrações. Não tivemos nada a reclamar.

title: Aside from a comfortable bed & nice shower, the entire place is mediocre.
text:
Overall, the design of this hotel is very awkward and uninviting. I love modern architecture, but, this building is a failure in both form & function from the lobby and elevators to the rooftop "pool".  We booked a corner room which was decent sized, on the bigger side for NYC. The bathroom is definitely larger than average, well designed with a good shower and for a hotel that's 8 years old, I give credit to the designer for being ahead of the curve. Also, the bed has good linens and is very comfortable. Aside from that, the layout and common areas of this hotel were a disappointment. We made sure to spend as much time out and about to avoid doing anything but sleep there, which isn't hard to do in Manhattan. I suggest spending less if just want a bed and you're planning to be working or sightseeing most of your stay OR spend a little more (or even less in some cases!) if you want more of a luxury or edgy city hotel experience that’s memorable for good reasons. The James Soho staff were polite, but, from what I experienced, the hotel is obviously understaffed to the point of the person at the front desk might be the same person delivering your ice. 

Look elsewhere if you’re hoping to have some amazing rooftop pool or experience or you just want a nice rooftop bar like The Standard High Line (nice rooms, no pool, but great atmosphere). The James Soho rooftop pool is more like the size of a large hot tub. Forget about relaxing by this pool since by 9am guests and non guests (I wasn't sure if they have some sort or membership for locals or people just showed up) are jockeying for sun chairs on the roof. There’s supposed to be a separate entrance and elevator for rooftop bar patrons but we shared plenty of elevators with people from morning into night who snuck in as well. At night, we ended up using the stairs instead of the elevator because we got tired of the elevator doors opening to reveal a packed group of bar patrons.

BTW if you didn't catch it when you booked your reservation or maybe they mentioned it during check in, The James Soho adds their own $40 nightly “resort fee” which isn't uncommon with hotels with actual amenities, but, here, what resort? For random wine in the lobby in the afternoon? For “use of the pool” which is a joke since they'd rented out the pool area for an entire day which not only denied us access to the pool and bar but created a line for elevators? 

We enjoyed shopping and dining in the neighborhood, but, next time we'll be staying elsewhere.

title: Best place to stay for a getaway to NYC
text:
This hotel is definitely where you need to be if you are coming to NYC. The rooftop bar is amazing with unbeatable views of the skyline. And if you need anything make sure you ask for Johnny. He is the front office manager and he will make sure you get everything you need. Try a drink or a meal at the Treehouse bar for an atmosphere you will not forget. 

If you are looking for a chic and comfortable NYC experience this is where you HAVE to be. Hands down. 

Here’s an insider tip: ask for Maurice when you check in.  He was so great and got us an upgrade to a corner king. It made the entire vacation unforgettable.

title: Johnny is awesome
text: Girls weekend in nyc done right! The staff is amazing. Especially Johnny (front office manager) and Maurice.  He goes above and beyond. I’ve never felt more welcomed and comfortable in a hotel. To be honest, we had more fun hanging out in the lobby with him than we did in the club... in fact, we ditched bottle service at the club to hang out with them in the lobby... not even a joke. Basically, this place is great and I can’t imagine staying anywhere else.

title: Surprising perks, friendly staff
text:
First of all, the location is very central - next to the subway lines and one block from W. Broadway. There are tons of restaurants and bars within walking distance.
Pool - the pool is very small, but the location on the roof top can't be beat. My 14-year old daughter took a dip and could swim a bit in the pool. Grab a coffee and scone from the restaurant and enjoy breakfast from the pool.
Room - The King room I stayed in was very modern and bright. The shower was spacious (though the water got the floor of the entire backroom wet, but there were plenty of towels to dry off).
My booking included the Club amenities, and I must say that this was quite nice. I got welcome cocktails from the garden bar that included house cocktails. The mini bar credit got me a free water in the room, and the breakfast coffee and scone were just right.
What strikes me the most is the friendly staff. The doormen on the street level were sooo nice and helpful. The lifeguard, the bartender, the check-in - all super friendly and not in the normal NYC rush.
I liked my stay much more than at the SOHO Grand. The James has so many locations in the hotel where you can get a drink and wind down, without having to be "seen".

title: Worst stay
text:
Worst place I have ever stayed at.    
Room to small. 
Billing inaccurate. 
Not all but most staff members not friendly at all. 
Noise level from the roof top could be heard in the room. 
Will not recommend 
 .

title: Exceeded our expectations
text: We booked two rooms for three nights each and we will definitely be staying again on our next business trip. The rooms, the staff, the restaurant, the bar, the location, the vibe - everything was exceptional. Kenny was especially helpful and friendly and we hope to see him again on our next visit.

title: Hotel or Bar?
text:
Bisogna dire subito che gli impiegati sono molto carini e servizievoli, consapevoli della contraddizione e delle problematiche che il bar della terrazza è di gran moda.
Questo porta problemi in tutto l’albergo. Ascensori affollati, piscina che non si può usare . Terrazza che nel pomeriggio non può essere raggiunta dai ragazzini perché c’è il bar che vende alcohol!! Che ipocrisia questa americana, alla terrazza del bar no al ristorante si? Mah.
Camere piccole ma simpatiche con vista sulle strade, più in alto meglio! Per passare due gg, va benissimo. Colazione cara e non deluxe come dice lo scontrino di 35$ a testa.
Il personale molto gentile.
L’aria condizionata...tutta New York è surgelata, anche qui a palla sempre!

title: Best hospitality in NY!
text: I travel to New York every month and always stayed at a different hotel and side of town to have a new experience each time until in encountered the superior staff at The James SoHo.  As a frequent traveler it is often disheartening to see how few brands truly value their patrons anymore but The James can be an example for many.  Maurice, Irene and everyone else we interacted with went above and beyond to make our time there a great experience.  The James is our official home-away-from-home while we are in NY.

title: Great hotel!
text: My husband and I went on a little staycation and picked the James Soho to stay at and I’m glad we did. We absolutely loved the hotel, the staff was incredibly accommodating and welcoming and of course the highlight was the rooftop pool which actually becomes more of a bar scene at night which we enjoyed as well. We will definitely be back!

title: Love this Hotel
text:
My husband travel to NYC quite frequently.  We try to stay in different areas in the city.  But we have fallen in love with this hotel. We have had such excellent service.  We are greeted every time we come in.  Our room is comfortable and spacious especially for NYC.  It located near a subway station.  Its a nice walk to Little Italy, Chinatown and shopping in SOHO.  

Even though we like to explore other parts of the city we will be coming back to this hotel.  It literally has become one of my favorites.  

Side note: I read some of the reviews regarding the elevators.  1. We never had to wait. 2. It is very common in NYC to have to go down to get in an elevator to go to the rooftop bar.  It is partly how they manage the crowds.

title: Some lustre lost, but still good
text:
This was my second stay at the James SoHo.  My first was 4 years ago, and I remember before that seeing the hotel being built from the ground up.  The hotel has some age spots and lost lustre, but is still a good choice for SoHo lodging.  The location is hard to beat--at the southwest corner of SoHo, easily walkable to all the shops, restaurants and lounges in SoHo and Tribeca as well.  Plus the Canal St. subway stops for the A,C,E and 1 lines are a block away.  The A train links you with the AirTrain from JFK airport, while the A,C and E trains go to Penn Station, where you can link with NY Transit and the AirTrain to Newark airport.

Even though I'd stayed here before, the lower level floors were still a bit confusing.  The entrance lobby has a desk that seemed unstaffed, although there is a doorman and sometimes a bellman.  The glass elevator takes you to the Sky Lobby where the reception desk is, a lovely space overlooking the hotel's urban garden and seasonal outdoor restaurant.  A separate bank of 2 elevators extends from the urban garden level to the Sky Lobby up to the rooms and the rooftop pool and lounge.  Stairs must be taken to access the entrance level from these elevators, although they do go down to the partially subterranean restaurant  (David Burke Kitchen) level.  The outdoor urban garden itself has multiple levels.  

Reception desk service was friendly but sometimes bumbling.  I checked in early before a room was ready, but the receptionist ran out of luggage tags and it took quite awhile for the bellman to bring more.  And when I got my room keys later in the day, the key to the luggage storage room could not be found, and it took another while for the luggage to be delivered to the room.  And of course the front desk never called me to tell me the room was ready, even though they had my mobile number.  

This stay was booked via a non-opaque, pay-in-advance, non-refundable flash sale on a favourite website of mine.  The reservation was for the hotel's least expensive room, a queen.  I knew from past experience that one is never upgraded on bookings from this website, so I got my designated room on the 5th floor.  The majority of the James' rooms face west looking towards the Hudson River, but some, including mine, face east onto SoHo, with glimpses of the East River bridges from higher floors such as the 17th floor fitness centre or the rooftop pool.
The room was perfectly fine, compact but not cramped, full of light from the full wall of windows (a James' highlight).  Lighting was great at night also.  There was a built-in settee with storage drawers beneath it, a small round table/desk and a chair.  The minibar and fridge were well-stocked.  Rather that offer plastic bottled water, the James offers filtered water in refillable glass bottles.  The bathroom had a full window looking into the bedroom with a shade for privacy if desired.  The shower had rain and hand-held fixtures and pump dispensers for shampoo, conditioner and bath gel (loved the fragrance).  I liked the zori-style terrycloth slippers. The A/C was super effective during my hot and humid stay.  Niggles: no electrical outlets by the bed, no luggage rack and no alarm clock.  For my previous stay, I was in one of the one-bedroom apartments.  It was of course more spacious (only the penthouse suite is larger), but this queen room was no less comfortable.  

Although it was waived for my pre-paid booking, there is usually a $40 per night Hotel Facility Fee, noted on the hotel's website.  Although some of the things included with the fee are things one would expect/hope to be complimentary (WiFi, concierge services, fitness centre access, newspapers, in-room coffee/tea), there were some additional features such as a $10 daily minibar credit (kind of tricky to gauge cost because there was no minibar menu with prices), 10% restaurant discount, welcome cocktail in the restaurant, morning coffee/tea/scones, early evening wine, evening cookies.  

The rooftop pool is really a pool-ette but does offer wonderful views west, south and east.  It's seasonal, of course, but opens early for guests.  There is pool-side meditation and yoga on Thursdays.  The pool also closes early-ish in the afternoon, when the pool deck becomes part of lounge Jimmy.  Guests have access to Jimmy until later in the evening, when there is a roped entrance from the street.  The service elevator becomes Jimmy's elevator.  I was surprised that Jimmy was still so popular, given its age and non-remodeled decor, but this was perhaps because I stayed over the July 4 week.  I should add if you are over 30 years old, Jimmy may not be for you; look instead for a bingo game at a nearby senior citizen's centre.

More popular than Jimmy is the seaonal pop-up Tulum-inspired Mexican restaurant/bar Gitano across the street from the James on a vacant lot.  Since my visit, it was closed temporarily by the Health Department for violations including bathroom and potable water issues.

I've always wanted to try the James' outdoor Garden at David Burke restaurant, but it was just too hot and humid for me this visit.  The space is lovely, however, with ample foliage and situated above sidewalk level so passersby can't stare at you and the traffic heading towards the Holland Tunnel is not seen, although possible heard.  
Although I've eaten at David Burke Kitchen in the past, I skipped it this time.  For late post-theatre food, I went more than once to the bodega on the corner of Grand and Thompson next to the hotel, which offers made-to-order hot food plus prepared cold foods and groceries.  They actually have 2 stores across Thompson from each other. 

After  my stay here at the James, I transferred to the Beekman Hotel near City Hall.  The Beekman trumps the James for service, but the James' location is preferred.  Design/decor are vastly different, renovated/old vs. contemporary--I loved them both, and would stay again at both.

title: Great little Hotel
text: Really enjoyed this hotel, the location was great for us, as we flew in to see the David Bowie exhibition. Our room was cute and petit and clean, and the staff really nice. Just two thing to know about the hotel, first you can't swim in the pool after 4:00PM which was disappointing after a day out and about. The roof top turns into a loud hip bar in the evening but I would have preferred to swim. Also the restaurant next although very cute was terrible. We ate there on the the 4th of July because we were afraid most other eateries would be closed. The food is VERY overpriced, service was the pits, the water made us feel he was doing us a favor by waiting on us, I think he had 2 tables? the place was so empty. The menu was boring and the food was only O.K so I don't recommend it at all. Maurice at the front desk was wonderful and he recommended some great place within walking distance which were great!

title: Not What it Used to Be
text: The James has gone from being a nice, trendy hotel to being a party venue with rooms. The facility itself has many things going for it: good location, nice facility, some great views, especially looking west towards the Hudson. David Burke Kitchen gets high marks for food. The service however can be bad -- our reservations were badly handled not once but twice.  To its credit, the hotel removed some expenses and sent us a bottle of wine so nice gestures.  The fundamental problem -- mirroring some others I saw online -- is that the hotel now seems to revolve around the rooftop bar and pool, off limits a good bit of time to hotel guests.  Additionally, as others have noted, there is a steady stream of 20ish partygoers wandering through the hotel, it felt like a college dorm.  If that is your thing, stay here.

title: Best hotel I been to in nyc
text: I had the corner suite which was very luxurious and spacious enough for my liking. Maurice at the front desk helped me through check in and also was vet patient and accommodating and help through the transition of getting settled in. I appreciate his kindness . Over all James New York is an exceptional hotel.

title: Awesome Hotel!!! Cool pool, great veiw, perfect location!!!
text: Meeting long lost friends in NYC! picked this hotel for its location, and was like oh course when I saw it had a roof top pool!! Friendly staff, great drinks, good times catching up with friends!! thank you James!!!

title: Good value, not such great service
text:
The location of the hotel is good, it's easy to walk to most places. It is modern and attractive and everything was clean. 
There is a $40 a day 'facilities fee'. From what we understand this allows you coffee in the morning, wine at a wine hour in the evening and access to the rooftop pool - however as others have mentioned this is only specifically for hotel guests during very limited daytime hours and the crowds and queues really put us off. I have seen mentioned online by the hotel that this facilities fee offers a discount and a drink at the restaurant but we were certainly not told about this - nor were we told about the fee until we were presented with the bill which was particularly galling as we had not used any of the 'facilities' it covered. Perhaps it may be worth mentioning this fee on check in.
Doormen were great, reception staff were hopeless and bordering on rude.
The room was lovely and absolutely spotless, although you could hear other guests in the corridors very easily. Why on earth anyone would want an unfrosted glass wall between the toilet and bed is beyond me, and we do wish the blind we kept putting down had been left that way.
It was fine as a mid range hotel, but it certainly bills itself as something better than that. It would have been good value if not for the unexpected facilities fee for facilities we didn't use. We certainly wouldn't return.

title: AVOID AVOID AVOID - horrible service from JONATHON and others before i even checked in.
text: Wow i actually made a trip advisor account to warn you all. DO NOT BOOK HERE. This is the first time EVER that i have actually had such a bad taste in my mouth about a hotel and its staff that i actually cancelled my stay and booked elsewhere for a week (ended up at Mandarin Oriental). JONATHON YOU ARE THE WORST AND SHOULD BE FIRED IMMEDIATELY. IMMEEEEEDIATELY. Rude, not helpful, lacked customer service skills....just a nightmare. I will actually take the effort to get him fired he was so rude and couldn't seem to do his job. Why does their website clearly say they offer spa services IN A SPA AREA if they dont? Upon calling, i was told they dont offer MASSAGE, facials or ANYTHING. Wow really cause your website clearly says its available. Jonathon is a rude little dude and i hope he is swiftly fired from his measly position of "Director of Front Desk" yeah ok. Worthless piece of work he is.

title: 4 DAYS NEW YORK FOR JULY 4TH  CELEBRATIONS
text:
I was visiting my son for July 4th and he suggested The James Hotel Soho as it has a roofttop pool and u can sit outside and relax if needed- he had stayed there 5 years ago.
Firstly  check in was very smooth and the reception staff very friendly and helpful - I was given an upgrade to a corner king room - i did request a high floor but accepted the 6th as i was told the view was still very good. The room was large for ny hotels and plenty of  draw space and a wardrobe. Bathroom was large with rainfall shower. All in all very nice but the only downside was that it was in dier need of decorating  as there were chips and marks . The view was amazing - u could see the freedom tower.
Breakfast was $22 but the varierty etc did not warrant this and i have had better at other hotels - they do offer free coffe and scones every morning which is lovely and far  better - there are numerous cafes nearby if u require more.
The outside restaurant was very nice and a good menu with plenty of seating and shade. On the LOBBY level which is reception there is plenty of comfortable seating
and water and fruit is available all day.
Rebecca and the guys that front the reception desk were really helpful and always smiling and nothing was too much trouble.
The rooftop bar and pool over a weekend is far too busy and packed with youngsters
but during the week it is calmer and it is nice to sit out and admire the fantastic view/
u can get snacks inside the bar area if required. I found the elevators ok and did not have to wait long. The area is great and it takes about 10 mins to walk to BROADWAY with all the amazing shops - try to walk thru  prince street. Little Italy is not too far and all in all u can walk to most places to explore this fantastic area. I usually stay midtown but think i prefer Soho and the surrounding areas.
I would stay at The  JAMES HOTEL again especially is they redo their bedrooms.
All staff were very friendly and helpful and the cleanliness was exceptional especially in the bedroom and bathroom.
ALL IN ALL A VERY LOVELY STAY.

title: Avoid staying here! Join the public party to enjoy the views and pool!
text: This is likely the only time that I have felt compelled to only give only one point for a 5-star hotel, but I caution future travelers from having to endure the nonsense that goes on here.  I am basing my experience of this hotel for a 2-night stay during the festive Fourth of July period (wed-thurs night). The main attraction that got me to book this hotel was it's rooftop swimming pool, which I thought would be a great place to enjoy the Forth of July! It turns out that hotel guests, like me, who pay close to $400 per night plus an additional $45 pool access fee, are actually only able to use the pool for a short,limited time period during the day. Unfortunately, I only learned about this policy at the time of check-in that the situation arises because the rooftop pool opens up to the public, and the rooftop becomes an arguably ‘Wild’  party scene, complete with a DJ, full-bar at 5pm on weekdays! On the Forth of July, the pool closed to guests at 2pm, just after my check-in to make arrangements for the Big 4th of July bash complete with a DJ etc.... As a guest, I was actually precluded from even getting to the rooftop during the party because the party was filled to capacity by 6pm. more worrying is that I observed numerous folks roaming the halls and stairways over the course of the early and late evening, making my guest experience in this hotel feel absolutely  unnerving. Further, the elevator wait times at any time of day or night are remarkably slow, which may be due in part to the hoards of public who are waiting to get to the rooftop. On my last day, the pool was actually closed to all hotel guests, due to 'weather', which included light rain sprinkles. It's understandable to shut the pool down if there were thunder storms, but the kind of weather that I observed, was a very light rain. Fortunately, I was able to leave this hotel before my trip ended and found myself enjoying an absolutely glamorous 5-Star hotel with privacy, elegance and class.  I have never stayed in 5-star hotels that expose their guests to the kind of nonsense that hotel guest must endure at the James! I rounded down to one point because I would give the hotel a half of a star because the lovely manager graciously removed one of the $45 daily fees once realizing that my experience fell below expectations.

title: Bel hôtel idéalement situé et chaleureux
text:
Je suis une habituée de NY ou j’ai séjourné dans certains des concurrents directs du James et je dois dire que le James allie toutes les qualités que l’on peut rechercher : un emplacement exceptionnel à la limite de SoHo et Tribeca , avec une vue splendide et dégagée notamment sur la One Tower, métros à 5 mn, une ambiance très chaleureuse avec un personnel efficace et plein d’attention. Très belle chambre spacieuse, peignoir de douche parfait pas trop lourd ni trop chaud ! La vue du roof top est magnifique avec en prime une petite piscine ou plutôt un grand bassin , bien sympa pour se rafraîchir lorsqu’il fait 40 degrés dehors. 
Bref je vous le recommande pour un séjour en couple ou en famille.  
Un seul point merite d’être amélioré : le buffet du petit déjeuner qui manque un peu de générosité, même si le plateau de fruits est magnifique et délicieux. 
Francoise

title: Great staff and hotel
text: The staff and facilities couldn't have been better. The Concierge was great and answered all my questions promptly prior and during my stay. Front desk was friendly. Clean and neat room and bathroom. The design of the hotel is very unique. I had a lot of fun.The pool is excellent and well maintain.....very pleased!

title: Second Stay- Impressive Service
text: Booked my second stay at this lovely hotel and had an amazing time with my fiends. Everyone is polite, kind and truly cares about your stay. Kenneth- the tall guy in the ground lobby is a super star and deserves his own 5 star review. Celebrated my 30th birthday at Jimmy's. The views and cocktails are to die for. I will be back for a third time. Thank you for creating a memorable experience

title: Soho Shortlist: The James
text: Can’t beat The James Soho for the price. Pool on the roof is great to cool off with stunning views. Small and fills up quickly though. Get there early. Guests obviously get first preference but hotel opens the pool to the general public at 3 p.m. or 4 p.m. and then it gets crazy. Fun though. Get the frozen Negroni. $20 but worth it. Kenny at the front desk made our stay extra special. The 6’5” LeBron-esque Mr. Congeniality is the first face you see when you arrive and the last to say goodbye when you leave. He knows your needs and wants before you ask. He. Reads. Minds. Seriously. We had a minor issue with our car key falling into the tiniest crevice in the lobby and disappearing into a bottomless abyss. Things happen in life. It’s how you deal with them that matters. And Kenny dealt with it by immediately getting all staff on high alert. Managers, maintenance, engineers... crowbars, drills, power saws. He immediately called in all resources from the hotel to the 5 boroughs and rescued our keys from the bowels of a black hole so deep I thought we might find the Ninja Turtles. He makes you feel like you’re the most important guest in the hotel, whether you are or not. He executes all requests immediately and with discretion when necessary. He will make it happen and if he can’t, he will get you the person can. In short, this hotel should be on your Soho shortlist. And Kenny deserves a raise. He may be a magician...

title: Worse Hotel in NYC!
text: Save your money and do not book with this hotel. The customer service is horrible and the staff are rude. They were not accomandating and when I called to try and re-book my reservaton, the manager do not want to listen or help resolve the issue. I never received a credit or voucher.

title: Rooftop in Soho
text:
Rooftop con piscina molto carino, molto Smart con clientela multietnica locale e turistica ospitata nell’hotel sottostante.
Possibilità di sedersi sia a bordo piscina che all’interno, vetrate con vista sul quartiere, buoni cocktail, migliorabile il servizio non all’altezza della location (ragazze carine ma poco client oriented...)

title: Stunning views and great staff
text: Hotel was absolutely perfect for my 30th birthday. Originally planned to stay one night but because everything was so great, stayed one more. Hotel was in a great location, lots of food options and shops nearby, and metro was easily accessible. The rooftop had stunning day and nighttime views and a pool with a spacious bar. Access to the rooftop at night however, was an issue. Having to go down to the lobby to come back up was a bit annoying and top of it, rude security guards didn't help. The delux king room was beautiful, had a super comfortable bed and more great views; but my favorite part of the room was the bathroom, and awesome shower. Staff at the reception desk were the best, especially Yu On. The great customer service made my stay 10 times better. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Billling issues ruined experience
text: We visited in April, reserving a corner king that included valet parking in the price.  When checking out, the desk clerk said she would email the receipt.  Generally this is fine.  However, no email arrived.  Then a separate charge for parking ($130) showed up on Amex.  Disputed the bill.  Hotel said for parking.  Fortunately I had printed the reservation which showed parking paid for.  3 months later and still no credit.  A very disappointing outcome.  The room was as expected, having stayed there before.  enjoyed dinner at David Burke restaurant.  Expect heavy crowds on stairs waiting for rooftop space.

title: Great bathroom, roofdeck, and staff. Otherwise average.
text:
I wish I could review this hotel better. The staff is excellent and friendly, the roof deck boasts an incredible near-360 view of lower Manhattan, the bed was super-comfy, and the bathroom rocked...especially the rainfall-plus-wand shower.

Sadly, the elevator situation is a joke. They seem to have one working elevator (a maintenance person said the other one is broken a lot) and with 114 rooms in the hotel that is a huge problem. Also, while the room was large by NYC standards, it was pretty basic and boring aside from the bed and bathroom.  And finally, at no point during our check-in or one-day stay were we told what came with the $44 Resort Fee. I am still not sure, although I assume part of it was the free Internet, which was excellent. So, not a bad stay, really. But to me the cons outweighed the pros and while I may stay there again if the price is right I will definitely research other hotels in the area first.

title: Great location
text: Hotel has amazing location and really impressive roof top bar. Staff is very friendly and helping all the time. Rooms are fairly big with very nice bathroom and great views. (I stayed on 16th floor). Only disappointment was that I was not able to access rooftop bar from my room. Had to go down to lobby and then access the bar from another lift. I would recommend to change this in the future.

title: Great location.  Hotel needs some money spent on it.
text: We stayed in the penthouse loft suite.  The room was large and had great views as you would expect and would have been very impressive but for too many maintenance issues.  We arrived sometime after check in and had to wait for the rooms to be prepared which is always annoying with children.  On going into the room the sofa was fairly heavily stained, the curtains didn't close properly meaning a lot of light in the morning and the foldaway beds for the children were so uncomfortable they ended up sleeping on the sofa - thankfully they are small enough to fit.  Breakfast was ok in the restaurant and the staff were great - we were comped a number of drinks for the various issues without asking but I get the impression they do that a lot.  Management really needs to look at the maintenance budget as it takes the shine off what could be a great hotel.

title: Expected More
text:
The James has an excellent reputation, but frankly felt mid-grade. Rooms were ok, but will be updated in 2019. They are acceptable, but not cutting edge. Cleanliness was average. 

Dining was a disaster including mild upset stomach. Tried 7 dishes between us, didn't like any of them, but credit to them - they did get the allergens stuff correct, so thank you for that. There are so many excellent choices for food both delivery and within blocks walking, do yourself a favor and take business elsewhere.

The rooftop is fantastic!
Staff was really incredible but did feel short-handed.

title: NYC 2018
text: Great location, service and ambiance, we had a corner Queen-size room that is perfectly enough for two on a short trip. The rooms are perfectly clean, the bathrooms with rain shower very luxurious. The staff are ever so helpful and friendly and keep everything fun while being very attentive. There’s modern artwork all around the building making it very interesting and  not as non-descript and anonymous as many other hotels. There is a David Burke restaurant as well as a rooftop bar to enjoy. It is also great how central it is as Broadway is only about a 5 minute walk away. All in all a perfect experience.

title: Does anyone work here?
text:
From the moment we checked in, there has been a lack of staffing anywhere in the hotel. No bellman, no front desk person. We waited 7min at the front desk after almost 2 hours in a taxi to get here from La Guardia, and no one to greet us. We finally got to our room and it was filthy. Toothpaste on the bathroom tile, buggers on the wall near the bed, the whole place was filthy. 
To make matters worse, after coming back to the hotel at 9pm, with my 11 yr old the “bouncer” that hangs out at the elevators was yelling at other patrons in front of my child. We walked in, again with no greeting because there is no one at the front door, and the first thing we get from someone at the hotel is a reprimand to “stay to the right”. 
This has been a horrible experience for bringing my child for a mother/ daughter weekend. The location is pretty much the only thing I can say is a positive.

title: Amenities fee
text:
The James has a lot of perks but it’s MAJOR negative is the $40 plus tax (!!!) a day “amenities fee”. As a solo business traveler I don’t think I had the benefit of any of these amenities, from wine hour that was on the raised lobby level to morning coffee that again was in an area of the hotel that you don’t naturally pass through. I’d rather have my $40 and buy my own coffee and wine.

Otherwise the room was nice, albeit small even for NYC standards. But it was very clean and the room had nice views over Soho.

The roof bar was insanely busy and very expensive. The restaurant was very nice however.

I’d stay here again if the room rate was low enough to incorporate the $40 fee, otherwise I’d choose a different Soho hotel without the mega fee.

title: Wonderful location & nice rooms, but poor attention to detail
text:
We stayed at The James several years ago, and were exited to return. The rooms are beautifully designed with large windows, hard wood floors and structural concrete columns that all form a cohesive aesthetic. And the location is fantastic, convenient to SoHo and the trains. 

But it feels like the hotel has not had the attention to details warranted. From the start of the booking process, we ran into little oddities and neglects. The phone reservation service did not know the hotel offered family suites, despite listing them on the website (she asked me to read the website to her). I ended up having to book regular rooms and call the front desk to modify the reservation. 

Once we arrived, the rooms were nice, but many details were amiss; the HVAC panel in the closet was open, the corner king had one curtain sealed closed, defeating the benefit of a corner room; the shelf holding the hot water was loose (it was missing a peg); there were stains on the curtains; etc. None of these were big problems, but these did not live up to the promises of the hotel. 

Finally, the concierge and bellhop were frequently away from the desk. On multiple occasions we waited a while, to no avail. 

Overall, the location is nice, but the hotel feels a bit neglected and underwhelming.

title: It’s fine but there is nothing special about
text:
Rooms are nice and clean, although small very comfortable. 
The high ceiling and large window gives the room a spacious feeling.
The linen and cushion are extra orderly comfortable. And they offer free water bottles in the room with us really comfortable and nice. 
BUT  for the price they charge - the gym a small old fashion equipped.
To get the free coffee and (un-eatable) cookies they offer for free you have every morning to run the elevator between the different lobby and cellar level (G, L or C) be sure that it’s is definitely not where it written it should be. And also they say it offered from 6 AM don’t expect to find it before 0730. (Just go to the small coffee across the street - it costs 3$ but tastes also a a coffee.

Don’t go for the room service breakfast it’s  extremely expensive and horrible !!!

Also the location is great and the rooms (especially the shower) are fine and the art hanging in the corridors is nice - there are many more better options just around the corner for this better a price!!

title: Unexpected Upgrade at the James - Excellent Modern Property, Great Location
text: Had an amazing one night stay at the James SoHo - Was doing business in the area and wanted a, convenient, clean and comfortable place to spend the night. I found all that and more at the James.  Was greeted on the ground floor by the bell man and took the elevator up to the lobby area.  Was informed I had been randomly upgraded for my one-night stay to the incredible penthouse suite (see photos).  The room was beautifully decorated and clean, modern four-room suite with awesome sweeping views of lower Manhattan. Many cool features including soaking tub, rain shower (with great water pressure), automatic lighting modes and curtains.  In addition to the incredible room, enjoyed a drink at the hip rooftop bar with pool and deck. Excellent service experience.  I have no idea if "standard" rooms come close to the standards and comfort of my suite experience, but definitely will return on business and/or personal visits.

title: Disappointing Penthouse Experience
text:
I booked the penthouse for a special occasion and I was profoundly disappointed by the value proposition. 

Yes, the view was breathtaking and it was a well-decorated room in terms of the interior design but that is the only positive element that I experienced in my stay. 

My biggest complaint about the penthouse is that it had so many technical problems. The main toilet room near the showers had a door that would not close and the lights did not even work. In addition, the speaker system also did not work, and when I asked the hotel staff for help they just simply said "it did not work" and made no attempt to alleviate the issue or suggest any alternative solutions. In addition, the space was not that clean -- the sofa was dusty and the "leather" chair was full of wrinkles and was almost tearing at the seams. The floor was also not particularly clean either. 

The complimentary wine was a nice touch, but that is expected given that it is around ~$1,500 per night. I am profoundly disappointed to have spent such a large amount for a special occasion that was largely ruined by technical failures and poor condition of the space -- not to mention the other inherent problems of the hotel (such as slow elevators and loudness of the rooftop bar) that I have not even explored in this review. 

I guess the final straw was when I expressed these issues at check-out, the receptionist just simply acknowledged the problem nonchalantly and said that she would get it "checked-out" with no offer for any remedy whatsoever. I would have expected a far comprehensive customer service given the claim that the hotel is "up-scale" and commanded such a large premium accordingly. 

I would not say don't stay at the hotel, but I would definitely say avoid the penthouse at all costs (you can get the view at the bar) and be aware of some insufficiencies in the customer service department.

title: Amazing trip!
text: An amazing 8 night stay at The James. Cannot really fault it! Both the room and view was great, and I loved the roof top pool! Gym pretty well fitted out too. Special thanks to Brian and Rebecca on the front desk who helped me several times during my trip and made the stay even more special. The location as well is perfect, great connections on the subway but also well positioned to explore the downtown area. Will definitely be back!

title: You can do a lot better than this
text:
I've reviewed a ton of hotels and I would not stay here again. Where do I start:

1. It's a party hotel. Not that there's anything wrong with that but if you like 250 millennial's partying day and night on the rooftop bar (which is nice BTW) this is place for you.

2.  The crazy influx of partiers makes the elevators take forever. The hotel is oddly laid out so that the lobby is up a level which means you take 2 elevators to your room or stairs. Either is just a bad design. 

3.  Rooms are small and have an odd wax on them. So bad that I was falling everything, so no socks or trouble. They moved me to another room, a little better not much.

4. Gym and internet are ok, not great. 

5. Location is good - next to canal station which takes you up town quick. Also, always great to be in SOHO and close to Tribeca. 

6. Air conditioning - not good at all. I'm in a corner room and it becomes a furnace.

title: Great views of NYC
text:
I stayed 5 nights and enjoyed my time at the hotel. The room was small, but this is NYC so I have some acceptance around that.

It was fresh and clean, with the hotel smelling divine. 

I really enjoyed the views from the rooftop and bar. You don’t have to stay there to use it, so if you’re in 2 minds about staying here and choose an alternative, go visit anyway.

I didn’t eat here, there were too many great choices around. Subway was close and convenient.

I was high enough up not to be troubled by any road noise. There is a massive intersection right below which is really cool to look at and fortunately inaudible from the room.

I paid around £230 a night, which, for my money is probably right for a good 4 star hotel in NYC. 

If you want 5 star service, head up to Central Park and spend LOTS more money.

title: Very cool hotel, well located in Soho, NYC
text:
Excellent hotel in Soho, NYC. Very well located in walking distance to Soho's restaurants, cafe's and bars. Also a 20 minute walk to Lower Manhattan with plenty to see on the way. Heading North it's only 15 minutes walk to Greenwich Village, another great place for restaurants cafes and bars in NYC.
The Hotel itself has an awesome rooftop bar called The Jimmy with excellent views of the Hudson River and NYC Skyline. 
Rooms are big in comparison to other major city rooms (London/Paris) at a similar price and the staff are all very helpful and friendly. 
Highly recommend this hotel if your heading to New York.

title: Great location
text: I stayed at this hotel on 4/5/2018. It’s close to many fine restaurants and shops in Soho. My room was rather small. However,the bed and luxury soap products were a plus. They have a free wine hour which was very nice. I left some of my clothing behind and called the staff the next day. Mavis was a pleasure to speak with and made the effort to send my belongings overnight via fed ex. Great staff and impeccable service.

title: Weekend in NYC at the James
text: Amazing hotel with beautiful views of Manhattan on every floor! The hotel has everything you need for a perfect weekend getaway in NYC. Super close to Soho where everyone shops and eats. The front desk staff was super friendly, Brian and Rebecca had tons of recommendations for restaurants and things to do. The view and drinks up at the rooftop bar Jimmy, made my stay incredible. The room and bathroom were good size and the products (lotion, shampoo, etc) were really nice too. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Loverly Hotel, but beware the hidden charges for the "free stuff"
text:
The hotel itself is very funky with friendly staff all throughout. The thing you need to be careful about is the stuff you are told is free (Wifi, Swimming pool, Cheese, cookies in the lobby) are all paid for by a stealth charge of $45 a day. This is quite annoying considering the wifi kept failing during my stay.

It is a-shame they kept these charges from you when you check in because it completely soured my stay here.

title: Грязь!!!
text: Разочарованию нет предела! Вселились сегодня с двумя детьми в 2 номера. Зашли, хотели помыть руки и зайти в туалет... на унитазе засохшая моча(!!!) и чьи то волосы! В отеле ха 500$!!! И это не все. Следы от... в унитазе! Как так?! Ничего подобного не встречали в отелях. Пыль! Везде! В ванной следы от пасты везде, в мусорном баке чья то насадка от бритвы. Ощущение, что нас поселили в свинарник...мини бар не заполнен. По списку одно, а на деле, в корзинке не хватает нужного. Это способ снять с нас денег или что?! Полы грязные( ходили в носках 10 минут и носки чёрные!!! Жили в отеле неделю назад и ничего подобного не заметили, но в этот приезд, полное разочарование! Грязь! Никому до этого нет дела?!

title: The best
text:
Love this place 
Excellent staff who are beyond accommodating and take care of everything top to bottom 
Great views and the rooftop bar is the best in town 
Value for the money is awesome 
This hotel can’t be beat

title: Special double birthday celebrations
text: Surprise visit to meet family and share the birthday experience in NYC. Lovely quirky restaurant. Staff all super friendly. Rooms clean, adequate and quiet. Being on a high floor gave down town views which was good to see. Roof top bar even better. Drinks are expensive to be careful but the view is stunning during the day or at night. Much fun was had. Breakfast in the restaurant just next door as part of the hotel. Nice if you want a decent breakfast. Complimentary happy hour and breakfast pastries at the hotel. I like it. have no complaints!

title: Not as cool as I would have hoped for the price
text: So this is a very cool hotel on the outside but really nothing about the interior was impressive except maybe the glass elevator. Also, the location is very difficult for uber/ Lyft to find and it’s not that accessible to taxis or main roads. It’ll cost extra just to get 5 minutes away. It is across the street from a hipster coffee bar, it was quiet, the staff seemed very accommodating. Underwhelmed by the room size, comfort and view.  Nothing about this hotel was worth the over $300 night price. Wait, I take that back,  the rooftop bar was amazing! Def go there, you can go there no matter where you stay in the city. a month prior I stayed at the Sheraton tribeca around the corner for $100 and it was better from a comfort and accessibility standpoint.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: I live in NYC and have stayed at a few hotels over the years here... but this is by far my favorite. Great rooms, cool experience, helpful staff, and the bar on the rooftop is maybe the coolest bar in the entire city, with a good vibe. The Standard but with way less pretentiousness.

title: Fun, personable
text:
Perfect for a weekend in Manhattan. Great vibe, young and cool guests, cocktail bar ln top, really nice rooms - yet simple, ask for one with a view. Good bedding, silent room.

Personnel really nice and cool. Would definitely stay again.

title: חורף ניו יורקי
text:
מלון ג׳יימס מקסים נעים מזמין ומומלץ במיוחד כולל הבר על הגג ג׳ימי. 
חדרים נקיים שיש בהם הכל. נעלי בית, חלוקים, ערכת קפה ומיני בר מלא בכל טוב. האזור מצויין ונגיש לכל אזורי העיר. 
הבר נותן אפשרות להשקיף על העיר כמעט ב 360 מעלות. בקיץ יש גם מרפסת יפה עם בריכה. 
יש במלון מכון כושר שנותן מענה למכורים. 
וכמובן לא אשכח לציין את קני הבלבוי הענק המתוק 😃. איש מקסים.

title: Ottima sistemazione
text: Ero scettica per via delle recensioni lette qui. Invece mi sono dovuta ricredere, servizio e camere ottime. Struttura modernissima, con una bella vista e un ottimo ristorante. Non male nemmeno il bar sul tetto con la relativa piscina anche se davvero troppo troppo affolata (e questo reca qualche problema di utilizzo degli ascensori). Super i prodotti beauty.

title: Good vibes
text: Great hotel! The Rooftop Bar has amazing views and it's a must if you're in New York City. I ate dinner on the terrace below and had an amazing evening, with great food. The staff was friendly, energetic and helpful. Next time I'm in New York, I'm going to stay at The James because my experience was so good!

title: Excellent Stay
text: Stayed at the hotel for a weekend in a corner room with an amazing view of the Freedom Tower. The hotel is clean, well organized and centrally located. The views of the City are fantastic. I invited friends for drinks at Jimmy's where we had a great time.The best part of all is that everyone is nice and greet you with a big smile. I would definitely be back!

title: Great hotel, a little pricey - but its New York...
text:
Lovely hotel and close to our office in Hudson, so no complaints there (appreciate I’m biased)

For me, the reception and entrance is clearly built for instagram - really nice.  

Rooms themselves were very small, but clean.  No desk to sit out - just a small table at the end of the bed.  Shower room was also small, but fully functional.

Great towels (no one likes crappy old towels).

Gym on the 17th floor has a great view over the city.  Also a short run to the bridge and back too!

Scones and coffee every morning were also great.

Breakfast was OK, i asked for sparkling water one morning and was charged an extra $8!

If you do stay, you also must visit Black Tap (burger place) 2 blocks away..

title: Good hotel at a reasonable price in Soho
text:
This is our 5th stay at this 18 story hotel at the South-West tip of Soho. This time we got a larger corner room on a higher floor with a great view of the Soth Manhattan skyline. Overall a positive experience but I do have two issues:
-The extra "resort charge" for internet/coffee/muffins/wine hour. Not cool!
- The numerous stations on the convenient 17 story gym's cardio equipment were mostly crap, to the point that I actually ended up watching Fox....

title: Super short stay, superb food
text: I had about 5 hours sleep after The Grammys and decided to treat myself to a nice hotel.  It was really nice. Good bedding, strong shower, clean, (a bit tiny room), but the magic of it all was the breakfast that was part of the room price.  Delicious ham and egg omelette, whole wheat toast, salad, great coffee.  I will for sure be going back again!

title: Great location, great hotel
text: Great location, nice rooms, helpful staff.  Liked the coffee and pastry in the morning and the cheese and wine in the evening.  No problems with housekeeping, our room was cleaned everyday.  Had a problem with shower and light bulb on arrival but it was fixed within an hour.  Had a drink in the upstairs bar early one evening which was nice, great views but very busy.   The lobby always smelt gorgeous too.  Had a great room on the 11th floor with amazing sunrise views.

title: Location! no fuzz
text:
I wanted to stay in that area and so The James came up naturally. I was not disappointed: The rooms have a decent size and they are very clean.Check in was smooth and with the great choice of restaurants and cafe places in the immediate surrounding I didn't miss a proper breakfast but was very happy with the muffin and the coffee in the lobby in the morning. I like the less formal approach of the staff and rather enjoyed the slightly less formal atmosphere. 
The bar on the top floor is a nice place to grab a drink. 
I will consider The James for future trips to New York City.

title: Great location, spotty service and cold, drafty windows
text:
Great location in Soho. Nice boutique hotel. Room amenities are good. Unfortunately my room faced west and the January winds blew in through the gaps in the windows. Stay on the east side if you can, or go in warmer weather. 
I couldn't get housekeeping to service my room for 2 days, despite repeated calls to the front desk. Don't know if this was unusual or a pattern.

title: Design et agréable mais des frais supplémentaires prélevés
text: Très bel hôtel design et confortable dans un quartier sympathique. Petit cocon très agreable. Dommage qu’on ne prévienne pas des « frais d’utilisation des services » qui sont pays et prélevés en plus sans que l’on vous avertisse. Et surtout je me demande encore quels sont les petits services ajoutés que l’on paie. Dommage car sinon l’hôtel est bien.

title: So nice, came back twice!
text: Superb customer service!  Amazing bed that helped us fall asleep despite being jet lag from our travels in Asia!  Chic rooftop bar!  We stayed before the holidays and then booked a return visit when coming back into the city before flying out again!

title: Not Up To Par With "The James" Standard
text:
Possibly our expectations were too high as having stayed several times at The James Chicago where everything has always been exceptional.  My daughter and I arrived on Saturday afternoon about 12:30. As we entered the very understated (not in a bad way) entrance on the ground floor, we were not greeted, or offered help with our bags.  The doorman stood at his desk, and just gave an eyebrow raise from his cell phone.  No "welcome"...no nothing.  We had to figure out our way up to the next floor lobby.  Here there was a very luke warm smile, with a forced "hello" from the one person standing at the desk.  It was a pleasant surprise to see our room was ready upon arrival. We made our way up to the 6th floor King Corner room.  It was a decent room with a decent view.  Nothing more, nothing less.  The room had quite a bit of dust accumulated on the night stands on each side of the bed, as well as the baseboards throughout.  It just never felt "clean"  We had to request extra towels as there were only two, and an extra robe as there was only one.  Ordered room service for coffee two mornings.  One morning it never came, so I had to call and request a pot.  It was promptly brought up with two plastic high ball glasses. Maybe they ran out of proper coffee cups? It was 9am. The next day they only sent hot chocolate. A call quickly fixed the situation though, and they did not charge us for the coffee.  The "Jimmy" bar upstairs had a great view and vibe, but would not let you order a drink to bring back to room. If you wanted ice in your room, you had to call guest services and get it by special request.
Overall it was an underwhelming experience.  We felt like a bother if we requested anything, and had to laugh at times at the lack of service and attention to detail. Just not what we were used to at this price point and this hotel chain.
On a bright note, our last day there a new doorman was working and was extremely engaged and helpful.  As we checked out the person at desk said he would e-mail my final bill and receipt.  I have yet to see it.
We would not recommend this hotel to friends or family.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text: I came to The James hotel during July 4th weekend and had a great experience. However, returning for New Years it was a different story. I had a multiple night stay which would end New Year's Day. They did not clean our room on time once this entire stay. I would leave for hours to come back around 6-8 pm with my room still disheveled, no refilled waters, no new towels. They didn't have our room on file when we went to check in and check in took 30 minutes+ because of that, their response was a flaw in their new booking system (I get it things happen). Our keys kept getting deactivated which meant I had to get it reactiviated multiple times through my stay when the key was in my wallet so it's not like my phone deactivated it. After all of this I took the step to speak to the manager and he said he would take care of it. He removed one night off our bill for our stay and gave a $50 drink ticket for the rooftop which made me think changes would be made and I truly thought that was kind of him. But not at all nothing changed. Once again the very next day they still didn't clean the room when we had the clean the room sign out there. He claimed after my frustration for this going on the entire stay that "maybe I shouldn't have a room here." That sounds like luxurious service to me having a manager speak that way to someone staying at this facility. I am displeased by this whole experience at The James Hotel. Their subpar service and bad managerial skills made a place that I once enjoyed a place I will never give my money to again. The supervisor kept apologizing emensly and is truly a kind guy but kindness doesn't replace going to a 4-star "luxurious" hotel to only be met with subpar motel service.

title: Hôtel bien situé dans Soho
text: L'immeuble est beau, la suite en  coin que nous avions au 11 ième étage nous offrait une vue superbe. Il n'y a malheureusement aucune ambiance, le chasseur de l'hôtel ne nous accueille que du bout des lèvres, le lobby est désert, et meublé sans goût, la préposée et seule employée au comptoir, semble débordée à gérer des paquets.  Nous avons gelé les quatre nuits que nous avons passé à cet hôtel, nous avons fait venir trois fois la maintenance, pour régler ce problème. Éviter le restaurant, le matin, on met un temps fou à vous servir. Réserver plutôt à l'hôtel Crosby , c'est le jour et la nuit !

title: 5-star price, but not 5-star service
text:
Prior to my reservation at The James-Soho, I exchanged e-mails with the staff and got confirmation on e-mail that I would accept a $75.00 early check-in fee since we would get into town early. The $75.00 payment should have allowed us to check in at 11:00 am. Despite my due diligence, when we arrived at around 12:30 pm (cancelled flight caused a delay coming in), the front desk (same person who I exchanged e-mails with) had no record of my request and the room was not ready yet. This was a disappointing start, even though the hotel ended up not charging me for early check-in. The room was ready a few hours later. Although I had requested a higher floor when I booked the room, we were given a room on the 4th floor and told they were fully booked. Another request that was not fulfilled.

Although the room itself was clean and well appointed, it was not in the condition that I would expect from a 5-star hotel. The faucet in the shower came right off and the button to activate the rain shower head did not work. We had to use the shower handle instead. It is not acceptable that a hotel of The James' caliber should exhibit such a poor level of maintenance.

The lobby is very tiny with a small sitting area and very basic amenities. The complimentary coffee was not refilled promptly in the mornings and the staff seemed to not want to be bothered to do so. The same went for the nightly wine and cheese. Despite showing up in the lobby only 30 minutes after the wine service began, there was no food left and it was not refilled until much later. Again, the staff seemed standoffish and not interested in going out of their way to deliver 5-star service.

Finally, upon checkout, early Sunday morning, there was no staff to be found in the front and I had to go looking for them in a back room to check out, only to be told by the staff (who didn't even leave the back room to greet us or thank us for staying) that we didn't need to do anything to check out.

The high notes: the location is very good and easily accessible by car service, taxi and train stations nearby. Also, the Jimmy (rooftop bar) was a lot of fun, with great views of the city, excellent music with live DJ and good drinks (be prepared to pay around $20/drink). There is also a great little market (Soho's Finest) right beside the hotel entrance which had great Panini sandwiches, snacks, drinks, water bottles, fresh salads, desserts and much more!

Overall, we were a little disappointed in The James and would probably opt to stay at a different hotel in the area on our next visit to the great city of New York.

title: REVIEW YOUR BILL!
text:
The location was terrific. The service was fair. If you go ask for Kenny Francis, he's terrific. 
The room was quite small, around 350 square feet. But make sure to clarify and confirm all the costs before you check in. We were mischarged and uncharged.

title: Anniversary getaway
text: What a lovely stay at The James! This hotel is a modern, boutique hotel in Soho. Initially after booking on line I had to call the hotel and make an adjustment to my reservation that I couldn’t rectify online. I spoke with Johnathan, a front desk manager, and he kindly made the correction, as well as arranged for an upgraded room when I told him it was our 25th Anniversary and that we were coming in from Long Island for a few days to celebrate rather than go out of town. We had a lovely corner king room, with a large bathroom, well laid out and spacious by nyc standards. After entering returning to our room the first evening, we were surprised by a bottle of Proseco and chocolate covered strawberries with a lovely card from The James, wishing us a happiness on the special occasion.  Just a classy, unexpected gesture. The front desk/ guest services staff was helpful throughout our stay.  We enjoyed the complimentary cheese and crackers and wine in the lobby in the evening, and the delicious scones and coffee in the morning. The outdoor seating area was very pretty as well, although we didn’t spend time there this trip due to the colder weather.  The hotel is within walking distance to many good restaurants including Little Italy, and to the World Trade Center area as well. The only negatives I can offer are that I wasn’t crazy about how close we were situated to the sights and sounds of the Holland tunnel traffic. And that there was an erroneous room charge from the JIMMY hotel bar on our bill at checkout. All in all, I’d gladly return.

title: Great location
text:
Fantastic location. Jimmys bar was well worth the visit. Great music, fun atmosphere and delicious cocktails.
Rooms are small with limited shelf space but the bed’s very comfortable. Good size bathroom with powerful shower.

title: Thanksgiving weekend stay.
text:
This hotel was easily the nicest I've stayed at. The room was comfortable, there were heated floors, and the location couldn't have been better. The woman who booked me (Rebecca) made planning the trip a breeze. There's a rooftop bar and it has a great view. (For those of you who don't want to pay $20/cocktail, an uber ride is only $6 to get to brooklyn and hit the fun, cheap clubs like TBA and Bembe.)

All in all, great stay. I would happily stay again.

title: Stay here!!!
text: Place was great top to bottom came in for John Legiuzamo show and didn’t want the hustle and bustle of mid town so decided on SoHo and loved it. Check out the coffee shop across the street and the pasta house on the corner   5 stars. Thx staff at The James

title: Perfect location in SoHo
text: Perfect location in SoHo. Plenty of shops, restaurants and bars in the area. Great in house restaurant - David Burke and the rooftop bar Jimmy with great views of the city and Hudson River. A good choice 👍

title: Geweldig hotel
text: Voor het eerst in dit hotel verbleven en het is zeker aan te raden. Aardig en servicegericht personeel. Ruime (voor New York) en schone kamer. Prima locatie (metro om de hoek). Misschien wat hogere prijsklasse, maar dat is het zeker waard.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: It nestles in a nice neighborhood, more quiet and friendly than what you would expect for NYC.  It is close to fantastic shops.  Public transportation is not an issue.  The view is fantastic from the room.  It is a very well staffed hotel.  The bed is amazingly comfortable.  The amenities are great.  It is close to Hudson River Park for those who love to hike or run.  I highly recommend this hotel.  Would definitely come back again.

title: Excellent in every category!
text: I stayed one night and loved every part of my experience.  The hotel is very clean and well maintained.  I loved the modern aesthetic, and the electronic bathroom shade was dope!  The view from my room on the 15th floor was amazing.  I also received excellent service both at the from desk and in the lobby.  One of the highlights was checking out the rooftop bar, The JIMMY, at night - truly amazing!  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Excellent Stay
text: I would highly recommend this hotel. The space is beautiful, the rooms are large and the location is perfect. The staff was very welcoming and accommodating from the minute we checked in. There are many different spaces to unwind and relax, and the complimentary evening wine and cheese was a nice touch.

title: Soho hotel with style and heart
text:
I stayed at the James New York - Soho for only one night, on a business trip. I would have stayed longer, given the chance.
My room was confortable with neutral washed out beach colours that were soothing and modern. The linens and bathrobe were good quality. The bath amenities included quality natural products with wonderful scents. They also have the larger in-shower formats for shampoo/conditioner, which means less plastic polluting our oceans.
The service, from the valet welcome at street level, to the reception lobby, to room service is friendly and professional. 
The hotel pays a lot of attention to design details, is careful of the environment and serves early morning coffee in the lobby with fresh scones. 
I just wished that the breakfast menu had included oatmeal without sugar based toppings. I always wonder why I can't choose a selection of toppings to my taste. It would be so easy to offer a choice of 3 toppings.
However, what really impressed me is the staff.  The morning that I checked out, I forgot a bracelet that I had just received for my wedding anniversary. When I called the next day, room service had my bracelet and the concierge arranged it's return via FedEx. I was completely impressed by the cleaning staff's honesty and the concierge's  (Morgan Kelly) quick response and follow-up emails. 
I would stay here again for the location, the welcome, the atmosphere, the attention paid to details (room service staff have a very cool uniform) and the confort of the room. Thanks.

title: Great boutique hotel
text:
Great location right next to subway and great access to SoHo.   Rooms are on the smaller side (expected at this price point) and west facing views only.  But the higher floors do have a nice view.  The service here and the small lobby give this place a nice cozy feel though.

All of the staff was extremely friendly and would go the extra mile for us.  Yu Un at the front desk really took care of us this trip.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
As previous reviews have said the rooms are small however well laid out. Ours had picture windows, comfortable bed and a little sitting area. The bathroom was a good size although no really place to put your toiletries. Also there are no drawers anywhere to put things in. 
The rooms are showing slight wear.
Our service prior to from the concierge was excellent and check in was smooth. The service is solid although in a relaxed manner. 
Housekeeping was excellent.
What we enjoyed was access to a roof top bar with a fabulous view and when we were done it was a quick elevator ride home. We were on the 15th floor and had no trouble with noise.
The best thing about the hotel is the location!! Right next to a subway station and walking to whatever was needed. We felt away from the tourist crowds of times square and central park area.
I would stay here again.

title: This is the view!
text: To feel in New York you must go to this place, the terrace is just amazing! Good cocktails and nice staff. Not very big, overcrowded during the weekend, better during the week. If you want to drink in a rooftop over a pool with an amazing view, you must go there.

title: Disappointed
text: This is my second review of The James and unfortunately this one is less positive. I identified the mediocre service in my first review but this time I’m going to say it was frankly quite bad. Or perhaps nonexistent would be better. I feel the like the hotel relies on the trendy bar and the boutique concept and therefore doesn’t give service much consideration. I stay in luxury hotels weekly and that isn’t enough for me. I was not greeted upon checkin, I was given zero information whatsoever and they basically barely spoke to me. I won’t go into the fact that I also had billing issues that I caught and had to call about without a return call from the manager I was promised. When I checked out, I was not asked a single question. A simple “ how was everything” would have gone a long way. Your cool hotel isn’t enough to bring me back again.

title: Expensive vs Value
text:
Roof top bar very expensive for poor drinks
Rooms small for $500 a night
Not good at all for business meetings ( no facilities)
WIFI weak on terrace and there is really no common area to chill and relax in.
Over designed bathroom glass separator from room has a translucent cream colored blind which closes to give privacy .  You do the math trust me it does not provide full privacy .  Also bathroom lights shine thru blind into bedroom making bedroom bright when at night . So your partner cant sleep while you are in bathroom due to light.
